desc: The AdTheorent Data and Analytics (D&A) team is responsible for organizing, analyzing, and deriving insights and actionable recommendations from digital campaign data. The team then communicates these findings to internal and external stakeholders via concise, impactful deliverables. The ideal candidate for a role with the team thoroughly understands the digital landscape, has a strong eye for detail, can tell a clear story with data, and thrives in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.      Responsibilities:      Self-sufficiently manage reporting responsibilities and analytical projects with guidance from senior team members Provide proactive analytics support to other departments, including working with other teams to execute against analytics and reporting frameworks tailored to meet the needs of each campaign Work with complex data structures and produce easy-to-understand, error-free, and timely deliverables that analyze user behavior online to provide actionable insights that address client business objectives Deliver campaign performance results and presentations to internal stakeholders     Qualifications:   Bachelor's degree in quantitative studies preferred. The equivalent combination of education, training, and work experience may be suitable Up to 1 year of relevant experience working in a quantitative business environment Basic understanding of digital advertising landscape Strong project management skills: ability to concurrently manage multiple deliverables and meet deadlines Excellent written and verbal communication skills: ability to tell a compelling story with data Strong attention to detail Intermediate Excel and PowerPoint skills (required) Experience with Relational Databases (e.g. - SQL Server) and Business Intelligence tools (e.g. - Tableau) (preferred)      We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and seek to foster community, inclusion and diversity within the organization. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of racial, religious, sexual or gender identity, to apply.

Requirements: Minimum bachelor's degree in Accounting/Fiscal Administration from a reputable university Having experience in Big 4 / consulting firm / multinational company, minimum 1-3 years working experience Excellent knowledge of local tax regulation Understands the concept of WHT, VAT and KUP. Able to do the tax reporting and tax calculation. Familiar with checking invoices, and creating e-faktur and e-Bupot. Expert in managing data in Ms Excel with various functions and formulas. Having a good work ethic, good analytical skills & proactive in a demanding situation An excellent team player, and respectful to others  Job description: Ensure that the invoices, tax invoices and WHT receipt that we received are complete and correct according to tax regulations. You will then determine the correct rate of WHT we must deduct from each invoice received. Assist in paying and reporting the company taxes accurately and on time. Assist in recapping and reconciling taxes accurately. Work with other departments to seek more information regarding the transaction. Assist in sending the tax documents to those who need them.

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  The opportunity  Modern technology produces more data than ever before, but also provides the tools to store, organize, analyze and share this data, resulting in new opportunities and substantiated business insights in support of new and deeper insights and more informed decision making. EY delivers leading services and solutions in the area of big data, business intelligence and data engineering built on a blend of tools and custom-developed methods.  As part of our Data and Analytics team of the Technology Consulting practice, you will work with multi-disciplinary teams to support clients in a wide range of data initiatives aiming to generate and present new, useful and actionable insights. You will have the opportunity to work and take responsibilities in challenging engagements, gaining exposure to clients in various sectors both in Greece and abroad.  Your Key Responsibilities Participation in large-scale client engagements. Contribution towards, or even leading delivery of innovative and engaging data engineering solutions. Understanding of business and technical requirements, provision of subject matter expertise and implementation of data engineering techniques. Conducting of data discovery activities, performing root cause analysis, and making recommendations for the remediation of data quality issues. Putting into practice good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and complete multiple complex projects under tight deadlines.  To qualify for the role you must have A BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or other related, quantitative fields. Advanced SQL skills Knowledge and experience in PowerBI  Ideally, you will also have 0-3 years of relevant professional experience.  What We Look For Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills. Desire to investigate and try-out new tools and technologies as they are released. Ability to work under tight timelines, in cases for multiple project deliveries. Good interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively within high-performing teams. Confidence to convey technical advice and guidance to clients. Advanced technical writing skills in Greek and English (additional languages a plus). Evidence of self-motivation for continuous development.  What We Offer  We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Plus, we offer: Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  About EY  EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy, transaction and consulting services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.  EY refers to the global organization, and may refer to one or more, of the member firms of Ernst & Young Global Limited, each of which is a separate legal entity. Ernst & Young Global Limited, a UK company limited by guarantee, does not provide services to clients. Information about how EY collects and uses personal data and a description of the rights individuals have under data protection legislation are available via ey.com/privacy. For more information about our organization, please visit ey.com.  If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  Apply now.  #betterworkingworld

You’ll be learning about the latest advances in data, AI and research, as well as developing your technical skills in SEO and KPIs.  Responsibilities of the role will include: Checking data quality from across our award-winning AI platform Telling stories through our data Creating dashboards and writing database queries Supporting data quality and insights for LIVE client projects with global mega-brands like S&P, Sony and Mastercard Working closely with both client services and technical teams to deliver epic results  Requirements While we don’t require any formal experience for the role, you should be passionate about Data Analysis and Data Quality Keen interest in Marketing and Technology Be able to demonstrate a strong track record of problem solving and teamwork Have a can-do attitude and be flexible to the changing needs of the business Be eager to learn, and willing to invest in your own personal development Experience working with Microsoft Office and Google Workspace Some knowledge of Python, or a willingness to learn. From staffing to full implementation of projects we provide the highest quality IT Services. We Intend to deliver exceptional student outcome. Helping develop reports and analysis. Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalisation. Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing. Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements. Desired Candidate Profile Degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, IT or any equivalent degree. Junior Data Analyst  Location: Borough, London  Competitive salary dependent on experience.  Company performance-related bonus, healthcare insurance & wellbeing benefits.  About us  Liv-ex is the global marketplace for the wine trade, with over 550 members worldwide. We offer business services that span trading, data, fulfilment and automation technology to a diverse group of wine businesses – from ambitious start-ups to established merchants. Our goal is to make fine wine trading more transparent, efficient and safe for the benefit of our members and the market as a whole. We are hard-working and committed yet informal, energetic and action oriented.  Founded in 2000, Liv-ex has grown to serve a growing number of merchant members with a broadening range of services. We help clients and other stakeholders to better understand the fine wine market and identify opportunities to profit.  Summary Purpose  We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our established data team based in London. The Junior Data Analyst will produce analysis and insights for all areas of our business to enable data-driven decision making. Reporting into Head of Data, this role roles combines regular data activities as well as supporting with projects, therefore is an exciting opportunity to develop your data analytic skills in a wide range of settings.  Role Responsibilities  Calculate and update Liv-ex Mid Prices and Fine Wine Indices Conduct wine price valuations for our members and wine investment funds Develop and maintain Key Performance Indicator (KPI) reports, tracking our business performance and highlighting under/over performance Extract, transform and load data from and into Aurora or Redshift Produce day to day data requests from various stakeholders Prepare reports for internal stakeholders using business analytic reporting tools Create data dashboards, graphs and visualisations Manipulate, analyse and interpret complex data sets  Knowledge, Skills & Experience Experience using Excel and SQL, and manipulating information to produce reports Understanding of data, data structures and their value to the business Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge Good organisational skills and attention to detail Ability to work in a constantly evolving environment with minimal guidance Excellent interpersonal and team working skills Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems Be comfortable pushing back and challenging the status quo at all levels within the business Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal A keen interest in the fine wine market Familiarity with analytics tools on Amazon Web Services or programming languages such as Python or R is advantageous

Esta vacante viene de la bolsa de empleo Talenteca.com  En /bluetab seguimos con el desarrollo de negocio. Nuestros equipos están en pleno crecimiento, llevando a cabo con éxito nuestro trabajo en modalidad 100% remota, para cuidarnos todos.  Nos alejamos del concepto de consultoría tradicional, ¿Sabes por qué?:  Contratamos para nosotros. Somos fieles a nuestra cultura y queremos compartir contigo nuestra filosofía de trabajo cooperativo, en equipo y de formación continua. Siempre podemos aprender más. Confiamos en la gente y que es posible trabajar bajo pasión, y que sientas en nuestro apoyo tanto en lo profesional como en lo personal.  Ningún mar en calma hizo experto a un marinero. ¿Somos exigentes? Sí, porque nuestros retos los son, pero te desarrollarás entre cracks, en entornos innovadores y con las últimas tendencias tecnológicas.  Esto es lo que te aporta ser /bluetaber…  Es por eso que nos sentimos muy contentos de invitarte a formar parte de nuestra familia de /bluetabers en esta nueva generación para la/bluetab University, un programa de formación de una semana donde conocerás más al respecto del mundo de los datos.  Antes, durante y a la culminación de ésta formación, estaremos evaluando tu gran desempeño con la finalidad de ofrecerte una nueva oportunidad laboral para formar oficialmente parte de nuestro gran equipo.  ¿Qué buscamos?  Requisitos Ser egresado (a) de carreras como Tecnologías de la Información o afín. Contar con 1 año de experiencia en desarrollo con Scala, Pythono afín. Buscar desarrollarte como Data Engineer para participar en proyectos de ingestas y procesamiento de datos Tener disponibilidad de tomar una capacitación en Mayo 2022 Disponibilidad inmediata a confirmación de oferta laboral para incorporarte a una capacitación directa con fabricante. ¡Que te apasione lo que haces!, ¡Que ames la tecnología, la formación continua y los nuevos retos! Se Valorará De Forma Especial Apasionado de la tecnología. Completamente al día de las últimas tendencias de la industria. Habituado a trabajar por objetivos. Acostumbrado a trabajar bajo presión en entornos altamente exigentes. Buen comunicador, sabrá transmitir ilusión al entorno de trabajo. Capacidad de análisis y solución de problemas. Buenas habilidades de negociación. Capaz de generar empatía tanto con los empleados y clientes. Capaz de adaptarse a la cultura de trabajo de una pyme. Sin grandes jerarquías. Compatibilizando la capacidad de trabajar con autonomía con un fuerte espíritu de colaboración y, sobre todo, de trabajo en equipo. Interesado en desarrollar su carrera profesional en entornos altamente competitivos y con alto potencial de crecimiento. Eso Se Traduce En  Tu comodidad nos importa. Los /bluetabers trabajamos en un entorno confortable, sin dress-code (A reserva del cliente), agradable y con proyección de carrera. Contrato indefinidocon un salario competitivo. El salario se relaciona en función de los conocimientos técnicos detectados en el proceso y rol asignado, procurando respetar el sentido de equidad y siendo susceptible de mejora tras las evaluaciones continuas de desempeño. Formación continua. Plan de carrera individualdefinido ya sea técnico, funcional o gestión (¡Decide tu camino pero sigue formándote!). Tendrás unCareer Coachpara que te guíe en tu desarrollo profesional. Beneficios Sociales Más Allá De Tu Salario Seguro de gastos médicos menores y de mayores familiar, seguro de vida. Vales de despensa. Vacaciones superiores a la ley. Bolsa de capacitación Días de descanso adicionales a la ley. Si te gusta la tecnología y la resolución de problemas tanto como a nosotros, ¡Nos encantaría conocerte! Direct message the job poster from Delvinia Alessia Fusca, MMgt People and Culture Specialist at Delvinia It’s Nice to Meet You!  AskingCanadians is currently looking for a Junior Database Analyst to join our team.  About Us We are AskingCanadians, a Delvinia company and one of Canada’s fastest growing technology firms as recognized by Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500 program for the last three consecutive years. Our team is transforming the way organizations collect consumer data by challenging the status quo in the research and marketing industries and applying new technologies in innovative ways, enabling companies to gain valuable insights.  Delvinia owns and operates a portfolio of innovative companies that offer a range of data collection services to marketers and market researchers across Canada, throughout North America, and around the globe. Our AskingCanadians business is dedicated to providing market researchers with the ability to quickly gather and deliver high quality information about Canadian consumers. We do this by accessing our research community of more than 1,000,000 Canadians.  We provide our clients, organizations of various size, with online data collection services. We offer survey programming and hosting on the Confirmit platform, online tools for testing rich media creative, one-on-one interviewing, custom recruitment and online panel management.  Our Values Our team believes in delving in and digging deep. Passion, patience, perseverance, perspective and people are our core values. We promote a culture of openness, authenticity and trust. We believe in being accountable, being committed to ongoing learning, and demonstrating excellence and leadership in all that we do. We consider ourselves to be a pretty formidable team with a close-knit work environment and an entrepreneurial spirit.  Job Description As a Junior Database Analyst for AskingCanadians, you will be responsible for: Preparing data for creating, running, and modifying sample jobs. Developing complex SQL queries using join operators, subqueries and correlated queries, functions, set operators, virtual tables and procedures for large datasets Performing data conversion, data cleansing, data masking, de-identification and encryption techniques Extracting data for feasibility studies, raw data pulls, sample pulls and data appends. Preparing data files in appropriate formats for client review and overseeing the quality of data deliverables Liaising with Sales, Project Managers, and Programmers on ad hoc data requests Qualifications/Attributes We are looking for applicants with superior organizational skills and a high attention to detail. In addition, you must have: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Software Engineering, or related discipline with 0-2 years of work experience Experience with SQL-based database management systems such as Microsoft SQL Server or Oracle Experience with NoSQL-based database management systems such as MongoDB or Cassandra Proficiency with MS Excel functions and formulas including VLOOKUP or Index Match, pivot tables, conditional formatting, Logic functions and filter/sorting. Designing or Understanding data architectures (CDM/LDM/PDM). Knowledge or experience indata conversion, data cleansing, data masking, de-identification and encryption methodologies Knowledge or experience with data privacy legislation and database performance design best practices Demonstrated commitment to the accuracy and completeness of information Comfortable working in a team and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision Integrity, initiative and commitment to continuous learning The ability to thrive in a fast paced, deadline-driven environment  Definite Assets / Differentiators Experience with or knowledge of MS SQL and/or MongoDB is an asset Experience with online data collection, reporting and sampling  How to apply If this sounds like the role for you and you are up for the challenge, please contact us. We look forward to reviewing your qualifications as outlined in a cover letter and resume. Please send your application to: careers@askingcanadians.com Some things to note We will only contact candidates who qualify for an interview. A satisfactory review of your references and a criminal background check are part of our selection process. AskingCanadians is an equal opportunity employer and we highly encourage applications from; women, visible minorities, members of the LGBTQ community, persons with disabilities, and persons of Aboriginal heritage. AskingCanadians is committed to providing a fully accessible recruitment process. Should you require additional accommodations to participate in our process, please contact careers@askingcanadians.com with your request, or to obtain additional information.

desc: ¿Buscas impulsar tu carrera profesional en Auditoría Interna?  Deloitte busca ampliar su departamento de Auditoría Interna. ¿Aceptas el reto? Realizarás funciones de seguimiento del sistema de control interno de calidad de Deloitte España.  Si tienes conocimientos en la rama empresarial (ADE) como en Big Data, conocimientos de data analytics, capacidad para gestionar equipos de trabajo y capacidad Analítica, alto grado de responsabilidad en un entorno dinámico, y flexibilidad, motivación y espíritu critico; eres la persona que estamos buscando.  ¿Qué te ofrecemos?  Desde el primer día con nosotros participarás en proyectos que buscan agregar valor y mejorar las operaciones de Deloitte. Ejecutarás, coordinarás y realizarás revisiones sobre procesos, líneas de negocio u oficinas de Deloitte, así como los sistemas de información subyacentes, realizando los informes de conclusiones y discutiéndolos internamente con las partes revisadas.  ¿Te interesa esta oportunidad y crees que encajas con el perfil que buscamos? ¡Haz clic en ‘solicitar’! Y forma parte de Deloitte, una compañía multidisciplinar en la que desarrollarás todo tu talento.

desc: Company Description  Experian is the world’s leading global information services company. During life’s big moments - from buying a home or a car to sending a child to college to growing a business by connecting with new customers — we empower consumers and our clients to manage their data with confidence.  Analytics Center of Expertise Services (ACES) is the biggest analytics team in Experian. The mission of the team is to power business growth through market leading Analytics. The vision of the team is to be the trusted partner for our customers allowing Experian to provide unique to the market solutions.  Typical for this career path is the development of descriptive and predictive analytical solutions, using advanced modeling and statistical techniques. People specializing in this field are also responsible for different model optimizations and forecast.  We are currently looking for Junior Data Modeller with Python to join our growing Sofia based Analytical Team, established in 2007.  As a Junior Data Modeller, you will develop and validate analytical solutions for diverse clients - this includes ad hoc data analysis as well as development of statistical models for predicting and managing the behavior of consumers.  Job Description  Your day-to-day duties will include: Under significant guidance extract, formulate and manipulate data to create the structured samples necessary to address business requirements. Support the development of analytical models and solutions. Working with other Data Modellers, interpret analysis results. Ensure quality and accuracy of own work. Under guidance, follow the relevant procedures and processes throughout the analytics solutions delivery process. Supports low complexity projects and provides support in the shaping and refining such projects Ensure full understanding of the client’s/customer’s requirements Take part in workshops. Interpret documentation. Qualifications  We look for a person, that will bring us: University Degree in a quantitative subject as Mathematics, Statistics, Informatics, Economics, Physics or Business Excellent command of English – both written and spoken Python skills; Predictive modelling Programming and coding; R-programming Interest to extract, transform, and analyse vast data pools Strong analytical skills, and desire to learn Knowledge in statistical software packages and other related technologies We Offer  Additional Information Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized strong team spirit, fun and quality recreation time Social benefit package - life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, corporate discounts, Multisport card, and a Share options scheme Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation and 3 additional paid days for participation in Social responsibility events Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office In order to stay safe and be responsible, we introduce a remote hiring process with online interviews for all candidates.  Interested to find out more about our Experian Bulgaria team, review our candidate book by following the link: https://view.pagetiger.com/experian-bulgaria-candidate-book/experian-bulgaria-candidate-book-2020  Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together  Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Working within the Warehouse Systems & Data Team to take raw data from key sources and translate into actionable insights for the business; supporting project delivery and/or decision-making processes. Taking responsibility for developing reporting, such as performance reporting, and seeking to continuously improve the products and services in which you are involved. Creating innovative and engaging dashboards to enable data visualisation for the relevant stakeholders – mainly via PowerBI Supporting presentations to internal stakeholders and where required provide in-depth analysis to support teams in the delivery of their objectives.           Full training and development plan as part of this role       Qualifications  Comfortable learning new systems to extract and exploit data Strong analytical skills and the ability to manipulate, and work with large amounts of data  Inquisitive nature, asking questions and big on self-development Problem-solving ability and a pro-active learning attitude Good communication and interpersonal skills Excel knowledge (PowerBI and SQL or similar desirable)      Additional Information  An opportunity like this at Frasers Group is for the fearless. The potential is massive, the experience unrivalled. To be able to make the most of it you need to live and breathe our principles:  Think without limits and take the team with you Own it and back it Not hesitate and act with purpose Be commercial and customer-focused.

First, a little about us: Born in 2000 as an ad agency for the videogame community 45 teammates in 2016, 100 today Agency partner to Cyberpunk 2077, Tomb Raider, Marvel’s Avengers, Sonic the Hedgehog, Doom, Fallout, PUBG and more. See our work at www.liquidarcade.com! This position  What’s this position about?  We are ALWAYS curious about what data are telling us.  Every day we run dozens of digital advertising campaigns, spending millions of dollars, on behalf of our clients—some of the most successful videogame publishers in the industry. Our analytics team helps ensure that we’re investing those advertising dollars in the most effective and efficient way possible. Our analytics projects and reporting vary widely in complexity, typically exploring datasets in the millions of rows.  This junior position on our analytics team will show you how to create rich data stories about advertising campaigns—and the video game fans behind them. As the successful candidate, you will use your Python, SQL, and other scripting skills in wrangling data, then visualizing in Tableau to help your teammates and our clients understand the stories in the data.  Requirements  What do we look for?  Ideally, you will be a graduate of a research-heavy academic discipline with at least a year of professional analytics experience. Your technical skills will include— Strength with coding in Python Experience with SQL and other data-focused scripting Excel formulas and macros with an emphasis on analytical projects Developing visualizations and narratives, preferably with Tableau dashboard experience Driving projects from data ingestion to presentation (tell us about this in your application) Coding experience is not required but highly preferred  Benefits  The perks we offer  Base salary for this role is commensurate with major digital agencies in the LA market. You’ll also be eligible for a generous annual bonus plan.  Our people also enjoy fully paid premiums for comprehensive health insurance, generous paid time off plans, and 100% match on 401k savings. Management treats us like ballers, even while remote, and before lockdown we traveled to Hawaii, Cabo, and New Orleans together the last three years.  Our stance  Liquid+Arcade is committed to creating an anti-racist, anti-sexist environment. We’re building an ad agency where committed and creative people from all backgrounds can do their best work.  No agencies, please. This is a pretty good representation of this position’s responsibilities but is not a comprehensive job description. Duties, clients, and team assignments may change as assigned. We regret we cannot consider applicants outside of the United States or those requiring visa sponsorship at this time.

job_title: Remote Entry / Junior Level RPG / Web SWE
desc: Responsibilities  Kforce is currently seeking a Remote Entry to Junior Level Software Engineer (Web/RPG) to join our San Diego, California (CA) based client. This role is currently 100% remote and might switch back to an office occasional environment when COVID-19 restrictions are lifted. Summary: We are seeking an engineer with a desire to grow with our company. We will train you and invest in you. The primarily responsibilities are under general supervision, for assisting in the design and development of front end web including mobile application development using JavaScript, HTML, Bootstrap and RPG. Responsibilities: Under the supervision of senior-level teammates, the Engineer help develop and maintain current applications for existing systems on a variety of technical platforms Participate in systems design sessions with users, Business Analysts, and/or senior-level teammates to develop complete specifications that capture impact of changes on all applications, systems, and databases Apply knowledge of data centric architecture, design, programming, and performance to help update programs and resolve problems As an Engineer, you will apply knowledge and help manage projects using web, database, and software technologies Demonstrate a high level of personal commitment and accountability to the business with a focus on quality and customer service Work in a team environment, and communicate positively with team members, peers, customers, and vendors Provide time tracking and project feedback data Perform other duties as assigned Requirements Bachelor's of Science degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or a related field either completed with a 3.0 GPA or higher 0-3 years of academic or professional understanding of programming languages Self-starter with the demonstrated ability to learn/adapt to new technologies and techniques Experience with Software/DB modernization, analysis, design, and construction including application of modern DB, OO, and modular software concepts and patterns a plus Highly detail-oriented and organized Ability to prioritize multiple tasks in a deadline-driven environment; Strong sense of urgency and responsiveness Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to think critically, including the ability to evaluate facts and data to draw conclusions, determine the downstream impact of decisions and associated risks Applicants must be fully authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status  Salary: Competitive
Industries: Banking and Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals

desc: Job Description  Você fará parte de um time de desenvolvedores extremamente qualificado fortemente orientado a resultados e que não tem medo de inovar.  Você será parte vital no desenvolvimento da nova plataforma de um de nossos principais clientes, trabalhando com boas práticas de desenvolvimento em um ambiente dinâmico que incentiva a autonomia e o aprendizado constante.  Somos especialistas em softwares voltados ao mercado segurador. Estamos ajudando a impulsionar a transformação no setor de seguros no Brasil. Estamos presentes em São Paulo e Rio de Janeiro, duas das principais capitais do país.  Estamos crescendo e precisamos de pessoas que amem tecnologia e que sejam fascinadas por aprender!  Main responsibilities  Desenvolvimento de sistemas.  Requirements And Skills  Para fazer parte da equipe você precisa ter atuado em projetos ou conhecer muito bem as seguintes ferramentas e práticas de desenvolvimento: Python Familiaridade com APIs. Frameworks: Flask ou Django. Você Se Destaca Caso Conheça GIT. AWS. Metodologia ágil. Data Lake Additional information Home office Horário Flexível Vale Refeição ou Alimentação (você escolhe!). Plano de Saúde Plano Odontológico PLR Programa de incentivo a cursos e certificações Desconto com faculdades parceiras Gympass Day off Quem somos  Você conhece uma empresa que cresce sem parar há quase 20 anos?  Que trabalha exclusivamente com soluções tecnológicas para as empresas líderes do setor de seguros e resseguros?  Que une confiança e tecnologia no próprio nome e na prática, no dia a dia?  Não?  Então, está na hora de conhecer!  Prazer, somos a Confitec.  E o que é ser Confitec? Respirar tecnologia e se orgulhar de ir além do desenvolvimento do software. Um time altamente qualificado, comprometido, capaz de atender aos mais altos padrões do mercado. Desenvolvemos pessoas - e gostamos muito de fazer isso! Todos têm espaço e motivação para crescer. Sabem o que fazem e querem fazer mais! Somos especialistas em softwares voltados ao mercado segurador e nossa equipe se divide entre as sedes no Rio de Janeiro e em São Paulo. Nossa Cultura Confiança Respeito Empatia Conhecimento e inovação Resultado Compromisso Responsabilidade social e sustentabilidade O que oferecemos para você?  Escolha - Vale Refeição ou Alimentação? Você define!  Flexibilidade - possibilidade de home office e horário flexível. E Vale Transporte, é claro, para os dias que você vier ao escritório. Além disso, oferecemos auxílio home office.  Desenvolvimento e aprendizado contínuo - Programa de Treinamento e parcerias com diversas Instituições de Ensino.  Cuidados com a sua saúde e bem-estar - Assistência médica e Assistência odontológica, Gympass (benefício corporativo de bem-estar mais completo do mundo), além de dicas de saúde em nossa rede social interna. Licença maternidade (180 dias) e Licença Paternidade (20 dias).  Participação - em tudo, inclusive nos Lucros e Resultados (PLR).  Um dia só para você - Day-off no mês do seu aniversário.  E mais...  Em 2018, fomos premiados na categoria inovação pela revista “Seguro Total”, uma das mais respeitadas publicações do setor no país. Ainda no mesmo ano, nos tornamos Gold Partner Microsoft.  Por 3 anos consecutivos, fomos reconhecidos como um GPTW (Great Place to Work ).  Existe a possibilidade de crescer aqui dentro! Você pode se preparar e encarar novos desafios sem sair da empresa, através do processo de recrutamento interno.  Curtiu?  Então, vem fazer parte do #teamconfitec  Conheça mais sobre nós Website LinkedIn Instagram

Description:* This position is in the Securities Administration Services (SAS) group.  Responsible for processing the most complex transactions or reconcilements relating to loan or security payments.  Duties include: Providing remittance and correction information to servicer Monitoring and analysis of pooled loans to determine non-compliance, communication of information to investors Evaluate servicer performance to ensure compliance with stated agreements Participates in system enhancements by attending user group and testing. Identify and communicate processing exceptions that are relevant to similar series across individual portfolios.  Incumbents must maintain a working knowledge of their area of expertise, including Collateral, Securities, Default or Trust Administration. May train junior level staff and review junior staff processing and reconciliations. May propose recommendations and implement automated solutions on an ongoing basis. Candidates will be responsible for data entry, accounting, and analyses of pooled loan data from many different mortgage servicers. Candidates can expect to be using multiple database systems including Microsoft Excel regularly to ensure that any variance in data is identified and accounted for. Research and interpret all controlling legal documents as issues arise with collateral or bond payments. Candidates will be working with Collateral, Securities, Default and Trust Administration. The environment is extremely team oriented and deadline driven as analyses must be complete at certain points during the month which will require overtime Skills:* Business analysis, Excel, Analysis Additional Skills & Qualifications:* 4 year College degree (in Math, Economics, Finance, Accounting, Statistics, Computer Science, Business) Strong Excel Skills and Experience Prefer 1+ year in the workforce (Finance, Accounting, or Financial Services) Experience Level:* Entry Level  About Aston Carter:  At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. Our success is driven by the talented, motivated people who join our team across a range of positions – from recruiting, sales and delivery to corporate roles. As part of our team, employees have the opportunity for long-term career success, where hard work is rewarded and the potential for growth is limitless. Established in 1997, Aston Carter is a leading staffing and consulting firm, providing high-caliber talent and premium services to more than 7,000 companies across North America. Spanning four continents and more than 200 offices, we extend our clients’ capabilities by seeking solvers and delivering solutions to address today’s workforce challenges. For organizations looking for innovative solutions shaped by critical-thinking professionals, visit [AstonCarter.com.](AstonCarter.com) Aston Carter is a company within Allegis Group, a global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email [astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com](mailto:%20astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com) for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

desc: Direct message the job poster from LIS Data Solutions ES | Technological Consulting Manuel Coterillo Fernández CEO & Cofounder en LIS Data Solutions | Desarrollo de soluciones de IA y Big Data Hola, somos LIS Data Solutions: una ingeniería especializada en el análisis de datos, que acompaña y ayuda a las empresas a transformar y desarrollar su negocio con soluciones tecnológicas en proyectos de Industria 4.0, Analítica avanzada de Datos, Big data e Inteligencia Artificial.  En LIS diseñamos tecnología que facilita y mejora la vida y el trabajo de las personas, y por ello, en 2019 fuimos reconocidos por nuestros desarrollos y algoritmos como una de las 6 mejores startups de Industria 4.0 de Europa.  Somos una empresa joven, con perspectivas de crecimiento rápido y en la actualidad contamos con oficinas en Vitoria, Santander, Barcelona y Ulm (Alemania)  ¿Qué buscamos?  6 Ingenieros de datos junior con conocimientos de programación, bases de datos, business intelligence y/o analítica avanzada de datos, para trabajar en nuestra oficina de Santander. Nivel de inglés B2  Bases de Datos SQL/MySQL/PostgreSQL MongoDB  Business Intelligence Qlikview/Qlik Sense Power BI Tableau  Análisis avanzado de Datos Big data Data Mining Machine/Deep Learning  Programación Python Java Rstudio  En LIS valoramos mucho: La capacidad y ganas de trabajar en equipo, La proactividad El compañerismo La curiosidad Las ganas de aprender La capacidad de autoorganizarse  La facilidad para comunicarse adecuadamente El compromiso  Si te vienes, te ofrecemos: Un entorno de desarrollo profesional dinámico y gratificante, con posibilidades reales de progreso Flexibilidad horaria Estabilidad laboral Entrada inmediata Contrato indefinido a jornada completa Salario: Según valía y/o experiencia

job_title: Junior Data Analyst- Insights & Data Solutions (All Genders)
desc: As a Data Analyst in the Insights & Data Solutions team at Dailymotion Advertising, you will be at crossroads of business and data. You will work alongside CSMs and Data Analysts in order to create business analysis frameworks for Dailymotion advertising clients across the globe (FR, EMEA, APAC, US, LATAM).   You will be providing tools, methodologies, and guidelines for sales marketing teams to maintain and develop Dailymotion Advertising’s insight products. Specifically, you will be responsible for:  Develop analysis frameworks and dashboards for different insight products (post-campaign, pre-campaign, audience profiling) across all markets. Explore data sources available at Dailymotion to add new features, create prototypes and proof of concepts for insight reports and campaign targeting. Document features, onboard and train CSMs and sales teams to leverage data and insights based on business cases. Work with sales marketing managers across markets to communicate product features and success stories. Learn and master Dailymotion’s data stack (Big query - SQL, Data studio, tableau, python…) to transform the massive amount of data into insights and fulfil the above responsibilities.   Qualifications  1-3 years of data analysis experience, in a media agency or marketing firm (Business analyst, data analyst..): Ability to make data-driven business decisions and recommendations Strong expertise in SQL, Tableau, Data Studio, and/or other data analysis related technologies (Python, R) Solid understanding of digital marketing and advertising (clustering, targeting techniques, persona creation, market research, consumer behavior analysis) Great rigor, very strong attention to detail, thirst for knowledge, and structured approach to problem-solving (translating business need to data requirement and vice-versa). Ability to manage a project and work autonomously: Communication skills and strong interpersonal skills to be able to foster relationships with peers and various stakeholders in different regions. Values diversity and works well in a multi-cultural environment BS or MS or equivalent experience in a quantitative and/or management field  Additional Information  At Dailymotion, we empower candidates to take action. If this job sounds like a great opportunity for you, be confident in your skills, we are always happy to meet you! If needed, we can accommodate our recruitment process for your special abilities.  Location: Paris  Type of contract: Permanent  Start Date: ASAP  For the France offices 🇫🇷  🏡 Hybrid Work Framework (4 types of remote work : Full office /Flex office (1/2 days remote) / Flex remote (1/2 days at the office) / Full remote + ability to work 3 month abroad) 💰International Group Savings Plan offered through the Vivendi Group 🍼 8 weeks paid Paternity leave or Co-parental leave 🕶️ Excellent Employee Culture (Company Events / Trainings / Parties / All hands …)  🚀 Career development support (training / career check-in with HR / internal mobility / compensation cycle / 360 quarter feedback review …) 🏥 Company-paid Health Insurance and Personal Services Vouchers (CESU) 🚆Commuter benefit coverage - Public Transport and Bike refund ⛱️ Paid Time off – RTT and Saving time plan (CET) ✅ Meal Vouchers  🎡Workers representatives committee (sport membership/cinemas vouchers/gift vouchers/discount)    Feel free to explore Dailymotion culture a little further, please check out:  Dailymotion.com New-York office - BuiltIn Offices in France - Welcome to the Jungle Our articles

Advanced Systems Design is seeking a Junior Database Analyst for our client located in Montgomery, Alabama.  Sorry, remote work is not considered or negotiated.  Job Overview  The Junior DBA will be working in a team environment that will operate in all aspects of database design, security, and administration of SQL Server, including writing advanced SQL queries and stored procedures and working with SSIS to build and maintain ETL packages. Responsibilities may include the following: Meet with business partners to understand requirements. Communicate with technical, applications, and operational teams to ensure database integrity and security. Create design documents, develop and unit test code changes, and participate with users in UAT testing. Understand new and existing processes and come up with methods to resolve issues. Manage database access across various user groups (internal and external). Assist in Database Design and Development. Create and maintain SSIS packages to import/export data and automate processes. Participate in the creation of development, staging, and production database instances, and the migration from one environment to another. Recommend and implement emerging database technologies. Recommend optimizations to existing application queries. Assist in data security monitoring. Support production databases after hours as needed. Required Skills 2+ years of SQL Server Database Administration focusing on: Relational database modeling and design. Installing SQL Server. Writing and analyzing complex queries in T-SQL. Troubleshooting and problem solving of performance and other issues related to locking and blocking. Routine database maintenance such as backups, reorgs, and database recovery SQL Server security and encryption methods. Developing, maintaining, and deploying SSIS packages. Developing T-SQL stored procedures, functions, views, and triggers. Working in a VSTS (Azure DevOps) and Agile environment. Strong communication and organizational skills. Ability to use problem-solving and analytical skills to take on challenging tasks. Desire and ability to learn and hone new skills. Able to work both independently and as part of a team. Education  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or another related field;  Or  Advanced Systems Design, Inc. Is  Relevant equivalent work experience above the minimum required A leading Information Technology provider for Federal, State & Local government agencies. A certified minority-owned small business government contractor with capabilities related to Public Health IT, Criminal Justice, Transportation and Defense. A certified service-disabled veteran-owned company with a proud 37+ year track record of providing successful innovative solutions for our government customers. A drug-free workplace in accordance with the Drug Free Workplace Act of 1988. Applicants who have a signed offer of employment or contractor agreement are subject to: the pre-employment testing protocol: background investigation drug screening pre-employment consequences portion of the ASD Drug-Free Workplace Policy Our Employees Are actively working on next-generation technology projects with the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, and a wide array of Federal, State and Local agencies throughout the United States Are eligible for wide-ranging benefits and perks, including but not limited to: Comprehensive Health Insurance with PPO and HDHP/HSA options Dental Insurance Vision Insurance Short/Long-Term Disability Group Life Insurance - Company Paid Voluntary Life Insurance 401(k) Plan with Employer Match Paid Time Off (Vacation/Sick) Holiday Pay - Company Paid Federal Holidays Tuition Assistance Professional Certification Incentive Plan Employee Referral Plan Technology Exposure For additional information regarding Advanced Systems Design, please check out our website at: www.asd-web.com
