Company Description  Gameloft Barcelona, the studio behind the mobile gaming hits Despicable Me Minion Rush and Asphalt 9 Legends is looking for a Junior Data Engineer to join the team.  About Gameloft  Leader in the development and publishing of mobile games, Gameloft® has established itself as one of the top innovators in its field since 2000. Gameloft creates games for all digital platforms, two of which are featured in the “Top 10 Games by All-Time Worldwide Downloads” from App Annie. Gameloft operates its own established franchises such as Asphalt®, Order & Chaos, Modern Combat and Dungeon Hunter and also partners with major rights holders including Universal, Illumination Entertainment, Disney®, Marvel®, Hasbro®, Fox Digital Entertainment, Mattel® and Ferrari®. Gameloft distributes its games in over 100 countries and employs 4,600 people worldwide. Every month, 114 million unique users can be reached by advertisers in Gameloft games with Gameloft Advertising Solutions, a leading B2B offering dedicated to brands and agencies. Gameloft is a Vivendi company.  All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.  About Gameloft Advertising Solutions  With a monthly audience of more than 113 million unique players and an inventory of 2.4 billion impressions, Gameloft Advertising Solutions offers advertisers a unique level of visibility and engagement. To date, Gameloft Advertising Solutions has delivered more than 3000 campaigns for prestigious brands such as Air France, Coca-Cola®, Ford, FOX™, Kellogg’s®, McDonalds, ©Netflix, Procter & Gamble, Samsung and Unilever, in over 40 countries around the world (North America, Latin America, Middle East, Africa, Europe, Asia, etc.).  All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.  Job Description  Gameloft Barcelona is searching for a skilled and self-motivated Junior Data Engineer to join our central analytics engineering team. This role will collaborate very closely with data analysts, data scientists, peer data engineers and analytical engineers to continuously improving analytics solutions for the whole company.  Responsibilities Design data models in best practices Support ELT/ETL data stack Create, maintain and optimize our internal ELT/ETL processes and data pipelines Give support to other data practitioners Requirements  Qualifications 1 year of proven track record as a Data Engineer, BI Engineer or Analytical Engineer Good knowledge of SQL, mastering DML and DDL best practices Knowledge in Data modelling Knowledge in ETL processes and tools Familiar with one of the programming language Python, Java or JavaScript Good communication, you are both a team player and a self-contributor Interest for the gaming industry Bonus points Experience with Snowflake, dbt and Looker Additional Information  Why Join the World of Gameloft? Because you want to be part of an exceptional experience within a company that is constantly growing! Because you want to work with talented people who are industry pioneers! Because you want to be part of an international environment with daily contact with other countries & cultures! Or, just because you’re looking for a great place to work! Benefits Permanent contract, full-time job with excellent Social Benefits. 25 vacation days per year Private medical health insurance Flexible compensation with Ticket Restaurant Card Free language courses Free coffee and fruit every morning! Free afternoon on your birthday! Merit based salary progression system and a competitive initial salary package. Career-development opportunities. Excellent local working conditions (quality of offices, geographical location of office in the centre of Barcelona). ... and Thursday afterwork beers! We can’t wait to find our next great talent!  Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted and your CV will be saved in our files for a period of 6 months.  Want to know more? Please visit our Website www.gameloft.com  If the offer interests you, Join the Game!  ______________________________________________________________________  Additional Survey  Thanks for agreeing to take part in this survey and your interest in our Company.  As part of our Recruitment process, we would like to know more about your interests when applying in Gameloft.  The survey may take you less than 5 minutes to complete, and is totally anonymous. Your honest answers will have no impact on whether you will get the job or not.  They will only be used to support our continuous efforts to match our Employer brand with our candidate’s expectations.  https//www.surveymonkey.com/r/PVFDD2P  Many thanks for your help!  Kind regards

Centura Health is looking to hire a remote Junior Data Engineer as soon as possible!!!  Desired Skills and Experience * 3+ years of experience as a data engineer, business intelligence developer, database/data warehouse management or experience in a similar role.  3 years of cloud-based data architecture and/or engineering (must have experience with Snowflake and Azure)  3 years working with healthcare systems analysis/programming preferred  Experience with several querying languages, schema definition languages, and scripting languages - must have Python experience, DBT nice to have  Healthcare Data experience huge plus  Epic certifications huge plus   Plusses   Day-to-Day * An employer in the CO area is seeking a Junior Data Engineer. This is a fully remote position, must sit in one of 26 identified States. The Data Engineer must have cloud based experience working with both Snowflake and Azure. They must also have experience scripting languages, the organization uses Python. DBT, a SQL tool is very nice to have. Healthcare Data experience is a huge plus, as well as Epic certifications. The Data Engineer will be working on enterprise level data warehouse initiatives. They will be assigned to a scrum team and will work in 2-week sprints. They will be on a team of around 15 individuals. The team has a backlog of projects and initiatives they are currently working on.
Industries: Hospitals and Health Care and Accounting

desc: About Us  Dyson has set up a regional office for Southeast Asia in Singapore. The Singapore office provides the vision and strategy for Dyson’s business in Southeast Asia, covering key markets such as Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand, and growth/new markets such as the Philippines, Vietnam and Indonesia.  The analyst will play a crucial role in supporting the Analyst team lead, Digital Marketing Manager and the wider SEA Marketing team to build insights which will help the team make informed decisions and measure campaign success – from awareness to conversion.  The candidate will also be expected to have a close working relationship with the SEA eCommerce team, supporting with insights and recommendations to drive Dyson’s Direct business (Dyson Demo Stores, Dyson.com.sg, LazMall, ShopeeMall.  Main Responsibilities  Floorcare, Environmental Control and Personal Care are rapidly growing categories in Southeast Asia. Over the past year, the business has also pivoted to focus on its eCommerce channels to fuel this growth.  Given the current business landscape, we are now looking for an analyst who will be able to effectively identify opportunities, gaps and areas for efficiencies across all markets, and provide valuable insights that will ultimately help the SEA team reach its targets. Channel focus will be direct (Dyson Demo Stores, Dyson.com.sg, LazMall, ShopeeMall).  Reporting and optimization Proactively identify test onsite opportunities and propose solutions opportunities that will allow us to improve our site performance e.g., quality of traffic, conversion rate, page progression. Plan, prioritise and deliver accordingly to your testing optimisation roadmap across multiple markets. Provide prompt campaign insights that will allow the team to optimize campaigns on-the-go, as well as drive the development of future campaigns. Communicate relevant top level online performance, learning and insights to the wider team on an ongoing basis. Also provide distributors with insights and reports which will help them understand opportunities present in their business. Report on the commercial success of campaigns by measuring Return on Investment, considering all marketing activities (offline, online, retail) and sales. Contribute to the growing insight-based and data driven culture to drive informed business change. Measurement – along with tools already available, be able to work with our media agencies and Group/CoE media teams to ensure that all we track all our online marketing activities correctly and if not, be able to flag them quickly.  Trend Reports – be able to use both internal and external tools available to spot trends, understand why it's happening, and how it might affect the business.  Person specification/core competencies  Experience and Education 1-2 years of experience in measuring website and digital channel performance (e.g., search, social, video, display) Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Math, Statistics, Analytics or a related field. Experience in web analytics, social analytics, and campaign performance reporting would be an advantage. Experience in data mining and using data visualization tools would be an advantage. Mindset Entrepreneurial Delivery focused, and prepared to roll up sleeves to make things happen Strives in a fast paced & dynamic environment Works well under pressure An achiever, motivated by breaking new grounds and creating a business from scratch Skills and Competencies Highly analytical, strong attention to detail Advanced level Excel skills Passionate about digital & the opportunities it brings to drive commercial success for a business Ability to manage multiple stakeholders and work with cross-functional teams Good communication skills, both written & verbal Fluency in English, other Asian language would be an advantage (e.g., Mandarin, Thai, Bahasa) Benefits  Dyson Singapore monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. Beyond that, you’ll enjoy a transport allowance and comprehensive medical care and insurance. But financial benefits are just the start of a Dyson career. Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition.  Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

A Neon é uma fintech brasileira, fundada em 2016, com missão de unir tecnologia e design para redesenhar e simplificar a experiência financeira das pessoas. Nascemos com um sonho grande, nosso objetivo é diminuir desigualdades, mostrando caminhos financeiros mais justos, porque todas as pessoas merecem um futuro brilhante.  Quer aumentar a suas chances de ser um/a Neowner? Encontre aqui dicas valiosas! Baixe nosso Guia de recrutamento da pessoa candidata AQUI.  Sobre a vaga afirmativa  Sobre a vaga  A Neon está em busca de Cientista de Dados Júnior para fazer um time incrível e de alta performance. 💙  Na Neon, acreditamos que ao trabalhar com um time diverso e inclusivo, somos capazes de criar produtos que atendam a todos, todas e todes e para isso buscamos contratar pessoas independente de gênero, raça, orientação sexual, idade ou deficiência. Mapear grandes datasets e expandir dados existentes com informações externas quando necessário; Identificar padrões, selecionar features e preparar dados; Treinar e otimizar modelos de Machine Learning, avaliando o uso de algoritmos diversos; Identificar e propor novas aplicações de Ciência de Dados; Propor melhorias no processo de coleta e disponibilização de dados; Gerar insights criativos através da análise dos comportamentos dos clientes utilizando técnicas estatísticas e de modelagem; Interagir com múltiplos stakeholders para garantir entendimento adequado dos problemas e assegurar uso das soluções de Ciência de Dados nos processos-chave.  Requisitos Perfil crítico, analítico e data-driven; Colaborativo, disposto a aprender e a ensinar; Conhecimento na utilização de Python/R para aplicações de Data Science; Fundamentos de matemática e estatística; Boas habilidades de comunicação e colaboração.  Plus  O que você vai encontrar aqui  Aqui na Neon apoiamos e valorizamos nossos Neonwers, não apenas com excelentes benefícios, mas também pensando em bem-estar e desenvolvimento! Para sua saúde, oferecemos assistência médica e odontológica - e se liga, você ainda poderá escolher o melhor plano para você e seus dependentes Seguro de vida Para seu bem-estar, o “Alô cafune” - nosso programa de apoio psicológico Ama descontinhos? Oferecemos o Allya! Nele você encontra descontos em produtos e serviços variados Tem filhos? Aqui temos auxílio creche ou babá Pensando em carreira? Aqui você encontrará o Decola (nosso Programa de Recrutamento Interno), o nosso Ciclo de Avaliação semestral, rotinas de feedbacks e acompanhamento do seu plano de desenvolvimento, e muito mais  E mais um montão de opções de benefícios flexíveis para você distribuir da forma que mais combinar com seu estilo de vida! Entre eles estão: Refeição/alimentação (para você se alimentar bem!) Budget para cursos e treinamentos (para você ser cada vez mais talentoso!) TotalPass (para você se exercitar!) Massagem (para você dar aquela relaxada!) Mobilidade (para você ir e vir com tranquilidade!)  LGPD na Neon  A Neon adota uma política para garantir controle e transparência no tratamento de dados de todas as pessoas, inclusive aquelas interessadas em fazer parte do nosso time. As informações de candidatos à vagas abertas na Neon durante o processo seletivo são tratadas rigorosamente de acordo com a LGPD. Para mais informações, Leia nossa política de privacidade.

Direct message the job poster from PIXIE Mickael Leitao Practice Lead at Pixie Services Nous recrutons en CDI pour notre agence de Lille deux consultants Data.  En tant que Data Analyst Junior :  Soft skill: Aisance technique , capable de communiquer avec les équipes et le métier, capable de donner de la visibilité sur l'avancement d'un projet, méthode agile, capable de restituer une analyse auprès des métiers.  Compétences techniques: GCP, DataAnalytics, BigQuery, SQL...

Solving business issues raised by our clients by modernizing their analytics and data solutions. At Deloitte.  What impact will you make?  As a Junior Consultant Data Office, you are part of the Data Modernization & Analytics (DM&A) team within the department Artificial Intelligence & Data. Within this team, you help solve business issues raised by our clients by modernizing their analytics and data solutions. In doing so, you will have to use next-generation cloud-enabled platforms and big data architectures to enable analytics and AI-powered organizations.  You play a central role in this by using your analytical skills and knowledge of data to help the client unlock value from their data. Your projects are often for the Chief Data Officer (CDO) or Chief Information Officer (CIO) of companies. For example, you support the client in designing a data governance structure and formulating their data strategy, and determine the requirements for their new data models. You’ll translate the client's business requirements to the right data pipeline technology, or help them determine the right data platform architecture and future data technology landscape. In short, you are the linking pin between business and data technology.  In your first two years, you will continuously develop yourself by learning from experienced colleagues on the job and attending training courses at the AI&D Academy.  How do you do this? Understanding business problems and connecting the right data solution to this; Collecting and structuring business, functional and technical requirements; Data storytelling to explain insights from data to the client; Brainstorming and discussing data-driven solutions in multidisciplinary teams with business and technology focused people; Preparing and facilitating meetings, presentations, and workshops with clients; Contributing to internal projects, such as the development of innovative propositions and training courses and the preparation of client proposals.  What’s in it for you? You’ll receive a profit-sharing bonus. On top of your fixed salary. Continuous professional growth. Join our development program. A work-from-home office setup allowance to make sure you have everything you need for an ergonomically-correct workstation. Work part-time (32 hours a week) or full-time (40-hours a week). Flexible working hours, you are in charge of your own calendar. 26 days of paid annual leave, and the opportunity to purchase additional leave. The option to exchange three national holidays for three non-national holidays. A good mobility scheme: the choice of carious options such as a lease car, travel by public transport, a cash option or a combination of these. A laptop and iPhone for professional and personal use. A time for time arrangement that creates flexibility for personal moments that matter. A good pension scheme with a personal contribution of only 2%. For a comfortable future. An opportunity to take part in our collective health insurance scheme. An opportunity to benefit from tax-efficient facilities such as fitness and a bicycle scheme.  Be the true you  You see endless opportunities for your clients. You come up with the best 'out of the box' solutions. With clear project objectives and plans. You have the guts, by trial and error, to try out new things and continue to learn. For the role of Junior Consultant Data Office, you also have: a Master’s degree, preferably in Data Science, (Technical) business Administration, Econometrics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or Business Analytics; Knowledge of cloud platforms and/or data management; Experience with coding in Python or SQL is a pre; Developed yourself with extracurricular activities; An excellent command of written and spoken English.  (W)here  You will share your expertise with about 170 other colleagues in the Artificial Intelligence & Data team that is part of Deloitte Consulting. Our team provides consulting, strategy and implementation services in the areas of performance management, business intelligence and other analytical applications. We focus on issues where more advanced analytics for optimization, forecasting or risk estimation make the difference.  In this department, we find it important to continuously develop yourself. That is why we attach great value to innovation and personal development.  Let's get down to business  We look forward to receiving your application for this position. At Deloitte, we welcome everyone who can bring quality and ambition. We'd like to know who you are.  Contact Kyra Leliveld Campus Recruiter Consulting kyleliveld@deloitte.nl +31882888425

Czego Wymagamy około 1 roku doświadczenia w administracji bazami danych MySQL i PostgreSQL, umiejętności pisania optymalnych zapytań SQL, podstawowej znajomości systemu Linux. Do Twoich obowiązków będzie należało: administracja i optymalizacja baz danych PostrgreSQL, MySQL i baz typu NoSQL, monitoring proaktywny i reaktywny, optymalizacja zapytań i zasobów bazy, pisanie procedur składowanych. W Zamian Oferujemy możliwość dołączenia do eksperckiego zespołu o unikatowych kompetencjach na skalę światową, zdobycie doświadczenia w pracy na systemach obsługujących dziesiątki tysięcy operacji na sekundę i przetwarzających terabajty danych dziennie (obsługujemy ponad 5 000 000 000 transakcji, 40 000 000 000 zwróconych rekordów, 250 000 000 000 odczytanych bloków danych dziennie), pracę z ludźmi pełnymi zaangażowania, świetną atmosferę w pracy – nie jesteśmy sztywnym korpo! możliwość zrobienia kariery w międzynarodowej firmie i dodanie do swojego CV wyjątkowej pozycji, która na zawsze wzmocni Twój profil zawodowy, specjalnie przygotowany cykl szkoleniowy, który błyskawicznie wyposaży Cię w wiedzę niezbędną do skutecznego wykonywania pracy, bezpośredni wgląd i wtajemniczenie w metody prowadzenia innowacyjnego na skalę globalną startupu, mamy własny firmowy elegancki restobar, w którym codziennie pracownicy dostają bezpłatny ciepły posiłek, dodatkowo w każdy piątek ogólnofirmowe Happy Hour z darmowym, pysznym czeskim piwem bez limitu, a przez cały dzień nielimitowana kawa, napoje i owoce, specjalne bonusy za obronę pracy dyplomowej, becikowe (2 tys zł), dofinansowanie wieczorów kawalerskich i panieńskich i rozwód party, parapetówek we własnych nowych mieszkaniach, dofinansowanie badań lekarskich, karta OK System, dofinansowanie kursów językowych. SALESmanago to jedyna platforma CDXP (all-in-one Customer Data Platform & Customer Experience Platform) wspierana sztuczną inteligencją i wykorzystująca podejście no-code. Wykorzystywana jest przez ponad 2000 klientów (m.in. Starbucks, Vodafone, Lacoste, New Balance, Victoria’s Secret) w 50 krajach. Financial Times określił SALESmanago jako najszybciej rosnącą platformę marketing automation w Europie.  SALESmanago wykorzystuje pełen potencjał danych o klientach, łącząc zaawansowaną analitykę i hiperpersonalizację do dostarczenia w pełni konfigurowalnych, spersonalizowanych doświadczeń we wszystkich kanałach marketingowych.  Firma zlokalizowana jest w Krakowie i zatrudnia 300 doświadczonych konsultantów, data scientists i inżynierów. SALESmanago działa międzynarodowo dzięki szerokiej sieci ponad 1000 partnerów biznesowych.  Jesteśmy startupem z doskonałym produktem, wyjątkową kulturą organizacyjną, doskonale funkcjonującymi zespołami oraz ogromnymi ambicjami podbijania polskiego i międzynarodowego rynku

First, a little about us: Born in 2000 as an ad agency for the videogame community 45 teammates in 2016, 100 today Agency partner to Cyberpunk 2077, Tomb Raider, Marvel’s Avengers, Sonic the Hedgehog, Doom, Fallout, PUBG and more. See our work at www.liquidarcade.com! We are based in Los Angeles, this role will report to our Warsaw subsidiary company  What’s this position about?  We are ALWAYS curious about what data are telling us.  Every day we run dozens of digital advertising campaigns, spending millions of dollars, on behalf of our clients—some of the most successful videogame publishers in the industry. Our analytics team helps ensure that we’re investing those advertising dollars in the most effective and efficient way possible. Our analytics projects and reporting vary widely in complexity, typically exploring datasets in the millions of rows.  This junior position on our analytics team will show you how to create rich data stories about advertising campaigns—and the video game fans behind them. As the successful candidate, you will use your Python, SQL, and other scripting skills in wrangling data, then visualizing in Tableau to help your teammates and our clients understand the stories in the data.  Requirements  What do we look for?  Ideally, you will be a graduate of a research-heavy academic discipline with at least a year of professional analytics experience. Your technical skills will include— Python, SQL, and other data-focused scripting Excel formulas and macros with an emphasis on analytical projects Developing visualizations and narratives, preferably with Tableau dashboard experience Driving projects from data ingestion to presentation (tell us about this in your application) Coding experience is not required but highly preferred Polish and English language written and verbal proficiency are required  Benefits  What's in it for you?  In addition to competitive compensation, Liquid+Arcade also provides— Eligibility for our generous bonus program Private health coverage Gym membership Weekend trips within Europe and annual visits to the USA  Please include the following on your resume: “I consent to storage of personal in my application for the needs of the recruitment process (in accordance with the Act of August 29, on the protection of personal data, Journal of Laws No 133, item 883).”  This is a pretty good summary of this position, but is not a comprehensive job description and responsibilities may change. No agencies please.

Descripción de la oferta de trabajo: ¡En LaLiga Tech seguimos creciendo!  Si eres una persona con experiencia en explotación y análisis de datos, tienes buenos conocimientos de creación de Dashboards y Reports y además eres un/a entusiasta de la industria tecnológica...¡No lo pienses más y sigue leyendo!  Actualmente buscamos a un/a nuevo/a compañero/a que se incorpore como Becario/a - Analista de Clientes Junior en el área de BI & Analytics de LaLiga Tech. ¿Cuáles serían tus responsabilidades? Explotación de datos para segmentaciones y análisis de clientes. Prospección y análisis de nuevas variables. Monitorización de performance KPIs con el objetivo de proponer planes de mejora. Análisis de la efectividad de las campañas. Creación de Dashboards y Reports. ¿Cuáles son los requisitos? Titulación universitaria superior o Master: Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática Aplicada, Data Science, o similar. Dominio lenguaje SQL. Habilidades en el uso de herramientas de visualización: Power BI, Tableau u otras. Inglés nivel B2 (lectura y escritura). Persona proactiva, analítica y con buena capacidad de comunicación.  Si buscas un proyecto retador en una organización top, no lo dudes y... ¡Ficha por LaLiga Tech!

job_title: Junior Analyst Medical Data - Per Diem - Weekends
desc: Location  New York, New York  Shift  Weekends (United States of America)  Description  World-Class Clinical Coding  More than a job, we're offering the ultimate opportunity for clinical coding professionals. At New York's #1 hospital (U.S. News), you'll work closely with top physicians and documentation improvement nurses while employing the unique specialty coding model. There's never been a better time to join our team. A recent conversion to EMR across all five campuses is taking health information management to exciting heights.  Junior Analyst Medical Data ( Coder ) – Emergency Department - Per Diem - Weekends  In this role the Junior Medical Data Analyst performs diagnostic and procedural coding for Emergency Department medical records. Utilizing medical records, you’ll review, abstract and apply appropriate diagnostic coding, facility level E&M coding, and APC assignment of Emergency Department patient records according to coding guidelines as applicable. You will review Emergency Department medical records to interpret documentation and assigns accurate coding for procedures in accordance with guidelines established within the Emergency Department. You will communicate with physicians appropriate to clarify documentation as related to APC or coding assignment. You will prepare abstract information in accordance with mandated hospital, state, and federal registry programs. Corrects and resubmits data from abstracts as identified through edit reports from said registries.  This is a per diem weekend hybrid position which will be located at our corporate office in Midtown Manhattan.  Preferred Criteria CCS, RHIA or RHIT Required Criteria College level courses or equivalent in anatomy and physiology, and medical terminology One year demonstrated ED diagnostic and procedural coding experience preferably in a computerized/electronic environment in an academic medical center Provide evidence of successfully completed coding course in ICD-10CM, CPT4, HCPCS, E&M and applicable grouper coding schemes Pass a skills assessment consisting of a representative sample of ED services at NYPH for all promotion/hires Join a healthcare system where employee engagement is at an all-time high. Here we foster a culture of respect, diversity, and inclusion. Enjoy comprehensive and competitive benefits that support you and your family in every aspect of life. Start your life-changing journey today.  __________________ #1 in New York, "America's Best Hospitals 2021-2022." - U.S.News & World Report 2021 "Employees' Choice Awards: Best Places to Work" - Glassdoor 2021 " Best Workplaces in Health Care & Biopharma" - Fortune 2020 "America's Best Employers in New York State" - Forbes 2020 "Working Mother 100 Best Companies" - Working Mother 2020 "Best Companies for Multicultural Women" - Working Mother 2020 "Best Workplace for Men in Nursing" - American Association for Men in Nursing Discover why we're #1 in New York and a best employer at: nyp.org/careers  NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital is an equal opportunity employer.

DWP. Digital with Purpose.  DWP is the UK's largest government department. We help people into work, and make payments worth over £195bn a year to support some of the most vulnerable people in our society.  We are looking for Data Scientist to work with us on the design and development of cutting-edge data-driven systems, as part of our Universal Credit digital service, utilising emerging technologies to innovate the way that millions of UK citizens interact with DWP.  You'll join our community of tech experts in DWP Digital. We're driving a once-in-a-generation transformation of government services, using fresh ideas and leading-edge technologies to create innovative, scalable and user-centric digital solutions.  The DWP products and services we maintain and modernise will be used by nearly every person in the UK, at key moments in their lives. The scale of what we do is extraordinary, and our scale and purpose is unique. We'd love you to join us.  Delivery. Work. Projects.  As a Data Scientist, you'll be working on ambitious data-driven systems, looking to create simple data-lead solutions for complex problems within our Universal Credit digital services team. You'll be working closely with a variety of teams and stakeholders to outline, design and develop these innovations with the claimant at the centre of our strategy, improving the way that millions of UK citizens interact with our essential services.  What skills, knowledge and experience will you need? Applied maths, statistics & scientific practices: Understands the theoretical basis for applied practices and is beginning to be able to apply the theory to practical examples. Communicating analysis & insight: Aware of the need to translate technical concepts into non-technical language and understands what communication is required to internal and external stakeholders. Programming & build: Understands the process of software development and has a basic knowledge of how services/software components are developed and built. Experience of using SQL and R/Python Details. Wages. Perks.  You'll join us in one of our brilliant digital hubs in Leeds or Manchester. Whichever is more convenient for you.  We also have all the tools and tech we need to enable our people to work flexibly, and many of us are working remotely at the moment due to COVID-19.  In return for your skills, we offer a competitive salary of up to £34,285, a brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions worth over 27%, and a generous leave package starting at 24 days.  We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes: Flexible working, flexi hours and flexi days Hybrid working: some time in a hub with the team, some time at home Family-friendly policies Time off volunteering and charitable giving Bring your authentic self to work with 'I Can Be Me in DWP' Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket, so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a difference Sports and social activities Working in an award-winning environment and culture Professional development, coaching, mentoring and career progression opportunities. CLICK APPLY for more information and to start your application.

Formação em Engenharia, Matemática, Estatística, Administração ou áreas correlatas; Conhecimento em ferramentas de visualização de dados (Power BI, Data Studio, ou outros). Desejável Possuir lógica de programação; Possuir conhecimento em linguagem SQL. Entender as necessidades da área e estruturar dashboards para auxiliar a tomada de decisão; Criação e revisão de KPIs, métricas e dashboards; Ter papel consultivo de auxilio as áreas com relação à análise/ferramenta; Identificar pontos de melhorias e desenvolver plano de ação; Propor e revisar processos.

Direct message the job poster from OSL Retail Services Idrees Derwish It’s an exciting time to be at OSL Retail Services, working for a people focused company that’s at the top of its game. The momentum we’ve generated in recent years with our commitments to client customers, innovation, business results, and an entrepreneurial spirit has created energy, enthusiasm, and engagement among our employees that is pushing us to new heights. And we’re on the lookout for talented people who share our vision and values and want to join us in this journey. At OSL, our culture is our foundation. Passionate employees, great customer service and long-term relationships are all built upon that foundation. We value people, passion, honesty, respect, and integrity.  Summary: Reporting to the Data Systems Manager, the Junior Data Analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design. The Data Analyst will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.  Responsibilities: Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide regular, timely, accurate reports Maintain and monitor production system alerts and provided triage support for priority systems. Communicated state of service availability and continuity to business units Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Filter and clean data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Locate and define new process improvement opportunities  Who we’re looking for: Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases, SQL, programming, XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets, Excel, SPSS, SAS Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Excellent organizational skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Knowledge of application flows and application development processes Confidence and ability to work in a highly visible, fast-paced environment with minimal supervision, capable of delivering quality results with high expectations of workload output. Adept at queries, report writing, data visualization and presenting findings (Experience with Domo preferred) BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics an asset  What’s in it for you: Competitive base salary plus bonuses and other perks Vacation plus additional flex days Comprehensive benefits Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies A supportive workplace culture and work environment  If this sounds like you and you’re excited to be a member of our team, please apply now.  We thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted. This position requires the successful completion of a criminal background check.  Disclaimer: The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  OSL is committed to an inclusive workplace that does not discriminate against race, nationality, religion, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply. We are an EEOC Employer.
Industries: Computers and Electronics Manufacturing and Retail

desc: Direct message the job poster from Dahl Consulting Chelsea Swatkowski Associate Recruiter Contract to Hire $25 an hour Willing to go to the Red Wing location once a month Job Description This position will support the sales operations and business development teams in managing small business account renewals to ensure accurate data collection, updated agreements, and proper program pricing. desc: Conhecimentos de programação. Conhecimentos em SQL e Python; Conhecimentos em estatística e machine learning; Noções de plataformas e arquiteturas big data (MapReduce, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Cloudera); Conhecimento básico para utilização de APIs (REST, JSON); Conhecimento básico em MLOps, compreendendo suas etapas, processos e níveis de implementação; Familiaridade na utilização de plataformas de versionamento (Git, Gitlab); [Desejável] Conhecimento em infraestrutura e aplicações Cloudera (CDP, CDSW, CML); Conhecimento em PySpark; Conhecimento de serviços cloud para machine learning (GCP seria um diferencial); Conhecimento em microsserviços e habilidade para desenvolvimento de APIs; Conhecimento em CI/CD; Conhecimento em plataformas de BI e visualização de dados (Qliksense, Tableau, PowerBI); Atuação nas etapas de desenvolvimento e produtização de modelos de machine learning; Participação nas etapas de exploração e mineração de dados; Focado principalmente em desenvolvimento (Python, R, shell, etc.) para MLOps, o profissional poderá atuar desde as etapas de preparação dos dados à otimização dos códigos desenvolvidos; Responsável pela automatização de códigos e rotinas desenvolvidos pela área; Desenvolvimento e suporte à etapa de feature engineering; Desenvolvimento de pilotos junto às áreas para prototipação de conceitos; Desenvolvimento, implantação e avaliação das métricas de performance de modelos.

Direct message the job poster from Working Talent Marlies Wardenier Recruitment Manager at Working Talent Ben jij (bijna) afgestudeerd aan het hbo of de universiteit en wil jij je carrière in de IT een kickstart geven? Ben jij nieuwsgierig, heb je oog voor detail en werk je graag met data? Dan is ons Data traineeship iets voor jou!  Hoe ziet het traineeship eruit? Op 2 mei 2022 start Working Talent een traineeship waarin jij wordt klaargestoomd voor een rol als Data Engineer, Data Analist of Business Intelligence Consultant. Het traineeship begint met een bootcamp van acht weken. Na afronding van het bootcamp ga je aan de slag bij één van onze opdrachtgevers.  Het bootcamp Het bootcamp bestaat uit twee delen. Het eerste deel richt zich op IT-fundamentals en hierin komen onderwerpen aan bod zoals Agile & Scrum, networking, architectuur, modelleren, programmeren, databases, SQL en cloud concepten.  In het tweede deel van het bootcamp ga jij je specialiseren tot Data Engineer, Data Analist of Business Intelligence Consultant. Voorbeelden van onderwerpen die, afhankelijk van de gekozen specialisatie, aan bod komen zijn Python, SQL, Databases, UML, PowerBI, Azure BI-stack en Business Intelligence Fundamentals. Je duikt in de theorie achter deze onderwerpen en gaat aan de slag met verschillende (groeps-)opdrachten die gericht zijn op de praktijk.  Het bootcamp wordt in een hybride vorm gegeven: deels op een centrale locatie in Nederland en deels via online thuisonderwijs. Om jou zo goed mogelijk voor te bereiden op de toekomst, koppelen we de theorie continu aan de praktijk. Ook krijg je de mogelijkheid diverse erkende certificaten te behalen.  Aan de slag Heb je het bootcamp doorlopen? Tijd voor het echte werk: aan de slag! Onze opdrachtgevers zijn verspreid over heel Nederland en variëren van mkb tot de top 200-bedrijven zoals Robeco, Engie, Suitsupply, Fugro, ING, PostNL, KLM, Rituals, APG, Ordina en BAM. Ook werken wij met veel ziekenhuizen, gemeentes en/of rijksoverheden. Samen gaan wij op zoek naar een interessante organisatie bij jou in de regio. Wij creëren de kansen, jij kiest de opdrachtgever die het beste bij jou past. Je stroomt in als trainee en wordt vanaf dag één begeleid door teamleden, collega’s en Working Talent. Het uitgangspunt is dat je na 16 maanden in dienst treedt bij jouw opdrachtgever.  Dit vragen wij van jou Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding (een IT- of bèta studie is een pré) Je bent initiatiefrijk, communicatief vaardig en hebt een kritische blik Vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, in woord en geschrift  Dit bieden wij jou Een traineeship van 1,5 jaar Een contract voor onbepaalde tijd Al tijdens het bootcamp salaris! Je ontvangt € 1725 per maand vanaf week 4 Na afloop van het bootcamp een upgrade in salaris naar € 2900 per maand, vanaf dag een bij de opdrachtgever Nóg een upgrade in salaris na 16 maanden wanneer je in dienst treedt bij de opdrachtgever Baangarantie bij één van onze opdrachtgevers 25 vakantiedagen en 8,33% vakantiegeld Reiskostenvergoeding Pensioenopbouw Diverse erkende certificaten en soft skills trainingen Toegang tot een digitale leeromgeving gedurende het traineeship  En natuurlijk goede begeleiding door Working Talent!  Solliciteren Ben jij enthousiast geworden na het lezen van deze vacature? Dan ontvangen wij graag jouw sollicitatie! Voor vragen kan je contact opnemen met één van onze recruiters via 085-0608506.
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Research Services, and Internet Publishing

desc: Xtremax is looking for a Database Administrator who’s versatile in various servers. If you are a constant learner and problem solver who can deliver results in a fast-paced environment, Apply with us now!  Responsibilities Maintain, amend, update and administer database systems, web server and middleware tools Enhance and build database designs Integrate old systems data with new system Set up and testing new database and data handling systems Monitor database efficiency Sustain the security and integrity of data Troubleshoot and correct issues as they arise Create complex query definitions that allow data to be extracted Train colleagues in how to input and extract data Requirements Strong analytical and organisational skills Eye for detail and accuracy Understanding of Oracle and MSSQL Experience with database software/web applications Able to work on an on-call basis (after office hours and weekend activation) By submitting your resume/CV, you consent and agree to allow the information provided to be used and processed by or on behalf of Xtremax Pte Ltd for purposes related to your registration of interest in current or future employment with us and for the processing of your application for employment. Location: Sydney or Vancouver  When our movies hit, we're gonna need help writing them SQLs.  The Production Engineering team at Animal Logic needs your SQL skills to keep up with the creation and delivery of our growing slate of animated feature films. You'll be involved in many parts of our business, including digital asset management, production tracking, task scheduling for rendering and distributed data synchronization across our studios.  Join our high-caliber team and help world class artists live their best creative life, saving them from worrying about overflowing IDs and connection pools. You'll need an eye for detail, be a clear communicator and have a consistent, systemic approach to problem solving.  Our creative environment welcomes techies who are inventive, communicative and enjoy being part of a team. We hope you have a genuine interest in the whole process of movie making, but you do not need to have a background in this industry. We'll provide technical training and mentorship to prepare you for the movie making journey.  This role would suit a recent graduate.  What you'll get to do: Gather requirements from movie production stakeholders, such as producers, CG supervisors supervising TDs and collaborate with fellow Production Engineers Extract, transform and present data using in-house tools and SQL Configure our fancy digital asset management system Administer, extend and streamline access to production databases Monitor databases for scalability and performance Participate in database upgrades and migrations Diagnose and troubleshoot database issues Monitor database load with expected data growth and conduct performance tuning Perform preventative maintenance, document and recommend improvements  What you bring: Experience in manipulating database and query language experience e.g. SQL Excellent verbal and written communication skills High attention to detail, initiative, and resourcefulness High service level management and application of change management principles  It would be amazing if you also had: Experience in programming languages, like Java, JavaScript or Python Experience with Postgres databases in particular Experience in the computer graphics industry: games, TV and/or movies Familiarity managed databases like DynamoDB and AuroraDB Familiarity with monitoring tools like Zabbix, Grafana, OpenSearch Familiarity with reporting tools like Power BI A Computer Science or Information Technology degree  Please apply if you are eligible to work in Canada or Australia.

We believe every author should have an equal opportunity to succeed. Therefore, our mission is to discover hidden talents and turn them into globally successful authors.  Inkitt is a pioneer at the forefront of Data Driven Publishing. We have forever changed the traditional publishing model by inventing an algorithm which analyzes users' reading behavior to identify hits, in turn removing subjectivity from the equation. This gives Inkitt the unique ability to discover hidden talents that might otherwise have gone unnoticed.  At present, we are an international team of 85 passionate and dedicated inventors and entrepreneurs and we are growing quickly. We invent new solutions to problems we encounter, as opposed to simply iterating upon existing solutions.  Are you a builder? Are you looking for more than just innovating? We are looking for the changemakers of the world; the people who just build the solution anytime they are unsatisfied with the status quo.  Be a part of the revolution to develop new ways of distributing our audiobooks, creating games, and video series!  Come build the Disney of the 21st Century with us!  The Story Intelligence Team is tasked to create a systematic method for creating blockbuster stories consistently. By analyzing story performance and reader engagement metrics, we must continually improve our most promising IPs to provide our readers with a wide catalogue of epic experiences.  Story Intelligence team members must not only be excellent writers, but must also be true collaborators. SI work involves working closely with multiple teams that include data science, marketing, content development, and author relations. SI Team Members are: Passionate about storytelling and excel in their craft Skilled at detecting trends and possess a laser-focused analytical skill set Able to apply logical data-driven findings and transform them into creative prose on the page to improve reader engagements with stories Effective communicators, both written and verbal to communicate with creators from all walks of life, across time zones, from different backgrounds and environments Able to prioritise competing tasks and manage constant change Committed to their work and take ownership for all of their tasks Always looking to grow and learn by taking on new challenges Naturally curious Biased towards action  To be successful as a Jr. Story Intelligence Associate, an ideal hire has: A minimum of 1 year experience with screenwriting, creative writing, or working in writer’s rooms or similar environments A natural talent for all things storytelling The ability to ensure the completion of all deliverables in a timely manner An aptitude for learning new systems and styles quickly and applying that to their work The temperament to learn from failure The ability to both give and receive constructive feedback while maintaining an air of professionalism A willingness to step out of their comfort zone to try new and bold approaches to their work An aptitude for interpreting data and applying those learnings efficiently The ability to adapt to quickly changing priorities and conditions in a fast paced environment  What we offer you: Top of the line health benefits that align with your local market Generous parental leave and support with growing your family Ways to help you save and invest in your future Opportunities to continuously grow, learn and develop yourself Time away - no set holiday or vacation policy, observe what works for you Free access to our Galatea App, as well as an unlimited budget for books Fantastic office spaces in Berlin and San Francisco - and always coming up with the next best way to keep our remote colleagues connected  At Inkitt, we strive to build a company culture and provide employment opportunities based on diversity and inclusion. We believe every author should have an equal opportunity to succeed, as should our team members. As a growing team from 20+ countries, we welcome everyone to apply.  We look forward to hearing from you!  Check out our careers blog and follow us on Instagram & LinkedIn! #weareinkitt

Direct message the job poster from Cal-Maine Foods, Inc. Bob Gilmore SQL Developer Job requirements  We are looking for a qualified Database developer, with a strong grasp of Microsoft SQL Server, to develop new applications as well as improve and maintain existing applications. The developer must have experience with creating and maintaining databases, data integration and data analytics. Communication skills and problem-solving attitude are a must. The ability to work with a team and independently is required. The developer will learn to work with Vinyl by Zudy, a no-code development platform. The developer must be proficient using TSQL and have a working knowledge of Microsoft Visual Studio. This job requires the applicant to work from our corporate office in Ridgeland, MS or live in the Dallas/Fort Worth area and work from home under the direction of our Manager of Development and Programming who lives in Rockwall, TX  Skills and Qualifications Must have 3+ years of programming and application development experience with a strong proficiency in Microsoft SQL Server TSQL, SQL Management Studio and creating queries for analytics Experience with SSRS and SSIS Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio Experience with ETL projects Basic knowledge of HTML, .Net, and Java Understanding of data for integration with accounting systems is a plus An ability to understand end user requirements and communicate with colleagues who work in a farming environment. English must be the candidate's primary language.

Job Summary And Opportunity  This is an exciting opportunity as a first step in your career in technology. You will be joining the Axos Centers of Excellence, where you will get to be a part of a team responsible for the implementation of cutting-edge, software-driven solutions. For those looking to make an impact on the business, this is where it begins.  We are seeking innovative and energetic individuals who are excited about expanding their skill-set and accelerating their career path with immediate exposure to software applications. You will begin with a unique program geared toward providing multi-software platform exposure that focuses on the expansion of knowledge and real life application within each. Your journey will begin with an initial assignment to a software team with specific roles and responsibilities. As you progress through the program for the next 12-18 months, you will rotate into different complimentary software teams where roles and responsibilities will change. The final goal of the program is permanent placement within your area of focus.  In this role, you will be focused on SQL related software or software built on direct interactions with SQL. Through the different rotations, you will gain the knowledge and skills within database development, data quality, and business intelligence reporting to provide enterprise-level solutions.  Responsibilities Define, prepare, execute and implement data validation and unit and integration testing methods to ensure data quality Create SSIS packages for data transformation, cleansing, caching, aggregation, staging, and transfer Analyze and define data flow requirements and prepare applicable system documentation and operation manuals as needed Code, test and maintain new and existing SQL jobs, stored procedures and functions Performance tune existing stored procedures, tables and indexes Troubleshoot problems that may come up with database environments: performance issues, replication issues, or operational issues Review SQL code written by other developers to ensure compliance to coding standards and best practices as well as maximum performance Perform data analysis and data profiling tasks to provide support and recommendations for development and design decisions Join client meetings to communicate status, give demos, provide timelines and offer insights Participate in daily meetings that go over testing, and code reviews Work with IT, Enterprise Data Management, Project Managers, Business Analysts, stakeholders across multiple business units to systematically plan the launch of new or enhanced dashboards, prepare launch collateral/documentation and work closely with users during through the different phases of a project Develop deep understanding of the Bank's databases, identify appropriate data sources, relationships and logic needed to produce consistently reliable reports Document process steps of repetitive tasks performed Perform any additional duties as assigned Requirements Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, Mathematics or a related discipline Customer Obsession: "Good enough" isn't good enough for you. You're obsessed with perfecting the customer experience Leadership: A confident person with the ability to connect and inspire others to achieve success, whether or not they directly report to you Results Oriented: A driver who possess the ability to take actions and implement effective solutions in a timely manner. Excuses aren’t in your vocabulary because you always find alternative solutions when issues arise Ethics: Highest level of professional integrity and honesty as well as personal credibility. Your reputation for precedes you in this regard Innovation: Dedication to maintaining cutting edge talent with the courage to implement new ideas, technology, and aggressively challenge the status quo. You don’t accept responses to new ideas like “That’s the way it’s always been done” because you use facts, data, and people skills to implement meaningful change Immersion: A propensity to rapidly master the understanding and application of new technology Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to simplify complex concepts for technical and non-technical audience Preferred 1+ year's working in an office environment or recent college graduate Basic to intermediate knowledge in SQL server database development and testing Basic to intermediate knowledge in SSIS packages APPLY DIRECTLY FOR CONSIDERATION  Born digital, Axos Bank has reinvented the banking model and grown to over $15 billion in assets since our founding in 2000. With a broad and ever-growing range of financial products, Axos Bank is rated among the top 5 digital banks in the country! Axos Financial is our holding company and publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "AX" (NYSE: AX).  We bring together human insight and digital expertise to anticipate the needs of our customers. Our team members are innovative, technologically sophisticated, and motivated to achieve.  Learn more about working here!  Pre-Employment Drug Test  All offers are contingent upon the candidate successfully passing a credit check, criminal background check, and pre-employment drug screening, which includes screening for marijuana. Axos Bank is a federally regulated banking institution. At the federal level, marijuana is an illegal schedule 1 drug; therefore, we will not employ any person who tests positive for marijuana, regardless of state legalization.  Equal Employment Opportunity  Axos Bank is an E qual O pportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religious creed, color, sex (including pregnancy, breast feeding and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military and veteran status, marital status, age, protected medical condition, genetic information, physical disability, mental disability, or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws.  Job Functions And Work Environment  While performing the duties of this position, the employee is required to sit for extended periods of time. Manual dexterity and coordination are required while operating standard office equipment such as computer keyboard and mouse, calculator, telephone, copiers, etc.  The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee may encounter while performing the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.

desc: £40K  Remote working  Your new company;  Founded in 1928, they have a very strong foundation and nearly a century of expertise behind them  World leader in their field; they were the first in the world to offer this unique, technology driven solution which most railways in North America and the UK have since adopted  Showing no signs of slowing, this vacancy has become available due to their sustained and continued growth, driven by their experienced tech team, revolutionising ultrasonic rail inspection  Your new role;  Working very closely alongside the Senior Data Scientists and AI/ML Engineers as well as the wider Big Data team - learning from them and developing your own skills will be a daily benefit to this role  ML systems - from building to designing to testing  Development of business-critical solutions utilising data, statistical analysis & quant modelling  Validation systems - developing these to demonstrate performance  You;  Experience of labelling data, finding & storing learning data, characterising ML systems and interpreting & presenting confusion/error matrices  Python, Pandas, NumPy, sickit-learn, Matplotlib  Desirable;  Full ML process deployment  TensorFlow, Keras  ML algorithms  ML techniques  Git Repositories  SQL / NoSQL  Benefits;  Remote working  25 days holiday + bank holidays  Private medical  Life assurance (3x salary)  Healthcare cash plan  Want to know more?  Hit apply and we'll send over a full job spec!  In Technology Group Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

Direct message the job poster from Mail Newspapers Tashan Chong Kan Assoc. CIPD Talent Acquisition Specialist at Daily Mail | MailOnline | Metro | The i | Mail+ Data Analyst Location: Northcliffe House, London Position: Permanent Package Description In return for their energy and ideas we ensure our people are well rewarded. Our benefits package increases the longer you’ve been with us. Here’s what to expect: 25 days’ holiday (increasing by 1 per year up to a total of 30) Upon joining you will be automatically enrolled onto the Pension Plan at the minimum level of 5% employee contribution, 3% Company contribution. Life cover under the Pension Plan of up to 3x your basic salary. DMGT Discounts (for discounts on online shopping, vouchers and reloadable cards) Subsidised canteen Onsite gym (Northcliffe House only) Onsite nurse and GP clinics (Northcliffe House only) Our Employee Assistance Programme Discounted dining cards  Plus many other benefits….  Job Introduction The Data & Insight team works closely with the Product, Customer Strategy, Digital, and Circulation teams, as well as technical experts and all functions of the Marketing mix (loyalty, subscriptions, CRM) to enhance the business’ understanding of performance, improve its data and help deliver the Customer Vision. This vision is to know as much as we can about our customers and their behaviour, driving them to spend more time with, and more money with, the Mail brand.  The Data & Insight team is responsible for managing and developing the strategic use of our data and databases. It helps deliver the customer vision by using data and appropriate statistical methodologies to:  Understand Mail customers, their engagement and behaviours Identify key customers, why they are valuable, and support the customer acquisition and retention strategy Deliver analysis and insight which help drive new/existing revenue streams Track and interpret print and digital metrics across our newspapers and competitors Support decision making around product development, customer communications and marketing planning Provide evidence and insight to support the Customer Strategy, and help refine the approach and objectives of the B2C business going forward Help answer the wider strategic questions faced by the senior management team Identify solutions to data gaps and areas for database improvements  The Role As a Junior Data Analyst you will be working with data from multiple sources and producing analytical reports for a range of business units across Mail Newspapers’ marketing department and associated product teams. You will be dealing directly with stakeholders to support their analytical and insight needs, informed by your understanding of the business and commercial objectives.  You will be manipulating big numbers, and working with Excel, PowerPoint and SQL databases to produce daily, weekly and monthly reports, as well as helping to manage key data sources across the business. You will be responding quickly to answer new, adhoc requests as well working on longer-term solutions. You will be working with product and technical teams to help identify, test and implement new data capture for reporting.  To be successful in this role you will be excellent at working with numbers and data, and be curious about trends and conclusions. You will be highly perceptive, and eager to look for improvements, insights and efficiencies. You will have strong personal organisation and communication skills to help you manage your workload and relationships effectively. This role provides the right candidate with a great opportunity to develop their skills and experience across a range of data sources and applications, in a fast-paced and rewarding media environment. Main Responsibilities Define the key data and ensure timely delivery of accurate reports and updates Analyse regular data feeds, manage databases and deliver associated daily, weekly and monthly reports on performance across different business units Build daily, weekly and monthly analyses and reports using Excel or Powerpoint, and work on ways to streamline processes using advanced Excel and SQL Liaise with in-house technical teams to develop the customer database and integrate new insights or metrics into business dashboards and self-serve BI tools Take deep dives into the data to help the business learn of specific patterns and trends Undertake ad-hoc reporting and provide analytics back to the teams drawing conclusions from complex analysis Assist the Head of Consumer Data & Insight, Head of Circulation Performance, Senior Data Analyst in their work to help provide a proactive service to the business Person Specification At least one year’s experience in a data-heavy role Beginner or intermediate SQL skills, with some practical experience The ability to prioritise workload and work to tight deadlines The ability to draw insights from data and explain trends The desire to problem solve and find solutions Clear communicator, comfortable work with technical and non-technical teams dvanced Excel skills / MS Office experience (Outlook, Powerpoint) Experience in using business intelligence tools and dashboards such as PowerBI, Qlik or MixPanel would also be an advantage, though training will be provided.  About dmg::media dmg media’s brands deliver highly engaging, trusted content to millions of loyal customers around the globe, 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Together, Daily Mail, The Mail on Sunday, Metro, i, MailOnline, Mail Plus, metro.co.uk and inews.co.uk reach more than 11m people daily in the UK.* Globally, our brands reach 180m unique browsers every month.** In March 2021, the business acquired the world’s leading science title, New Scientist. dmg media’s newsbrands are expert at getting to the bottom of the stories most relevant to their readers. *PAMCo 1 2020 ** Omniture April 2021   Our Commitment We are committed to increasing diversity and maintaining an inclusive workplace culture. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of their ethnicity, race, gender, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. We are Disability Confident Committed. Please let us know if you require any recruitment documentation in other formats or if you require reasonable adjustments to be made during the recruitment process. Please be assured that any such information will be held separately to your recruitment application and will not be considered as part of the selection process.

“This role that you are applying for, will be working for KINTO-UK Ltd which is a Mobility Brand owned by the Toyota Group, offices located in Portsmouth. KINTO-UK share their HR function with Toyota Financial Services (TFS) in the UK, however the job being advertised will not be working directly for Toyota Financial Services”  Job Summary  To develop, maintain & support industry leading Business Intelligence solutions for KINTO, across a diverse range of BI technologies and platforms, but mainly focused on reporting in a MS SQL based reporting stack and Qlikview application development.  Key Responsibilities Investigate, report on, and support the resolution of business data quality issues, through reporting tools. Operational management of automated inbound and outbound data flows - monitoring logs and raising issues to stakeholders as appropriate. To work alongside the Qlikview/SQL Development Team and the Customer Reporting Team, delivering both internal and external reporting requirements (including feeds) using Microsoft SQL & Qlikview technology. To validate partner supplier invoices for various clients, generated from a variety of channels including electronic quoting products. To support the analysis and requirement gathering for new customer reports or changes to existing reports in conjunction with the Customer Reporting Team Leader, ensuring a reduction in reliance on manual processes, and delivering improved access to data insight for business stakeholders and customers. Resolution of service desk requests for new reporting requirements, amendments and issues all delivered within our agreed SLA. Transforming information requests into timely, clear and accurate analysis. To work closely with IS & Business teams to ensure the data is precisely specified, understood and consistent; and any integrity issues are identified and resolved  Requirements  Desired Skills Previous experience/training as a developer. Previous experience/training across MS BI Stack (MSSQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, T-SQL etc) Experience or training to work to an enterprise coding framework standard across multiple technologies in design, development and testing. Experience of/ training in, troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues, helping to track and identify root causes and identifying suitable solutions.  Benefits Bonus earning potential Hybrid working policy - 2 days from home each week 25 days holiday + 8 days bank holiday Great pension scheme starting at employee contribution of 4% with an employer contribution of 11%. This can flex to 6% employee contribution and 15% from the employer Life assurance scheme Discounts on different retailers Wellbeing hour each month Discounts on Toyota & Lexus cars Volunteer Days Wellbeing events Employee assistance programmes Free fruit in the office Free onsite car parking

This is a Kickstarter Scheme position (candidate must be on, or have applied for, Universal Credit).  Nix & Kix is one of the fastest-growing soft drinks brands in the UK. We produce a range of adult soft drinks that are infused with a hint of UK grown chilli for a natural pick-me-up.  We are a small London based company on a big mission to remove the boredom and stigma that surrounds soft drinks. We run a slick operation here at Nix & Kix HQ, and we’re looking for ambitious, hungry and enthusiastic Junior Data Analysts to join our Team!  Position Overview:  NIX&KIX are a soft drinks start-up with something a little different. Founded by Julia and Kerstin 5 years ago, they saw an opportunity to spice up the sector, quite literally!  All NIX&KIX drinks are entirely natural, low sugar, vegan and come with a unique cayenne addition providing that extra kick.  We are looking for a meticulous, resourceful and analytical individual to join the team to support our commercial team in analysing channel sales trends,  You will uncover and match data sets, and produce compelling reports for our team. You will be directly supporting the commercial, operations and marketing teams.  Key Responsibilities:  Data Analysis: Support sales team with reports generated with the provided software Analyse large, complex data sets to uncover trends and patterns Summarise and present data and insights to our clients and senior team  Data Mining: Generate data sets for the sales team  Requirements  Essential: Excel, personal computer  Desirable: understanding of CRM systems and familiarity with Google Data Studio  The ideal candidate will: Be extremely organized, adaptable and capable of effectively prioritizing workload Demonstrate critical thinking and resourcefulness Demonstrate a high level of attention to detail Be proactive  Most importantly, the candidate will have a specific interest in developing their skills in the food and beverage industry with an underlying understanding of what makes things tick in retail.  This is a Kickstarter Scheme position (candidate must be on, or have applied for, Universal Credit).
