desc: We are looking for a young professional who is passionate about data to join us in Brussels as a part of our ComLIMS Program. The ComLims Program (Communication and Laboratory Information Management System) consists of two internally developed web applications and a range of additional services (reporting services, data services, Business Intelligence services) which allow our internal customers, the Eurofins laboratories worldwide, to sell their services offered to Eurofins customers. The ComLIMS Program is at the heart of Eurofins' strategy of cross-selling and competence centres. Components of the Program and its data are used by most Eurofins applications, which makes the ComLIMS Program an essential part of ensuring efficient end-to-end sales, production processes and much more.  As a Junior Data Management Specialist, your role will be to manage the catalogue of Offers within our ComLIMS Program.  Responsibilities:  Maintain high levels of data quality and support data analysis; Manage internal customer (laboratory) data migration and/or data clean-up projects, as well as the daily customer requests according to business priority; Follow strict company guidelines and procedures for various customer requests (access management, data management, service requests...) for the review, approval and execution of such requests; Review incoming requests for quality and compliance; Support Editorial committee of internal marketing newsletter (proofreading, layout creation, subscription management); Perform ad-hoc data extraction by collaborating with Business Analysts and Software Developers.  Qualifications     Strong understanding of Excel is required; Knowledge of SQL is an advantage; Familiarity with Microsoft SSIS or Excel VBA is an asset; Knowledge of Microsoft SharePoint, PHP and WordPress is a plus; Critical thinking and detail-orientated skills; Fluent English communication skills (written/oral). Knowledge of another language is a plus; New graduates who meet the above requirements are highly encouraged to apply!  Additional Information  What We Offer:  Challenges within a multi-cultural and cross-regional team as part of the international and fast-growing Eurofins organization; A dynamic working environment with a good team spirit where personal development and growth are encouraged; Responsibilities for key applications of Eurofins; In a fast-growing group, successful team members are being offered increased areas of responsibility (within the Program and the Eurofins Group); Extensive on-the-job coaching; Attractive salary package with extra-legal benefits.

Direct message the job poster from ISO Natalia Stajuda Senior Recruiter at Verisk | Hiring Data Enthusiasts | .NET | ML | Frontend Company Description  ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!  At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.  Job Description  Verisk ISO in Krakow is a team of 30 passionate analysts.  We work on various Insurance Data Analytics projects. Depending on the team we are using SQL, Python or R. We keep developing new solutions for our clients and collaborate closely with our international colleagues. We work with analytic products at various stages of data lifecycle (planning, collecting, processing, analyzing, publishing).  Our managers: Kasia, Marek and Piotr are looking now to grow this amazing group of analysts. We hire people with broad analytical skillset with innovative mindset, who are ready to continue or start their career in data analytics.  We have a growing number of teams in this group.  Depending on the team, your responsibilities may include: Business Intelligence Actuarial Analysis Process Optimization / Lean Six Sigma Business Analysis ETL Analysis and Optimization Data Transformation Working In Data Analytics In ISO Means Creating, modifying, and executing computer programs to extract, transforming and summarizing data. Understanding and taking ownership of our business/data/analytics processes, and recommending improvements in data management, error identification, quality control, process automation, or analytic techniques. Presenting your analyses, ideas, progress and results to your manager and colleagues. Developing an understanding of the US P&C insurance business and Verisk Analytics’ business practices, products, and data sources. Assisting in building and maintaining proper documentation, procedures, and guidelines. Contributing to the creation of detailed project plans to ensure projects are completed on time. Qualifications  All of our positions require:  Practical Knowledge Of SQL And Mix Of Ability to analyze data from business point of view Python or R or SAS or Alteryx, Tableau or PowerBI is preferred. We will discuss during recruitment the specific teams and responsibilities, and work with you to find the best opportunity and position.  Additional Information  Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.  All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.  http://www.verisk.com/careers.html  Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.  Consumer Privacy Notice

The successful candidate will have duties shared as necessary between setting up spreadsheets, maintaining existing sheets, setting up and maintaining tools that will help improve the Team Leads’s workflow. This person will work on complex spreadsheet set ups, tool creations and reporting set ups. Resolve PS Helpdesk tickets related to Quality Control and other PS Tools Set up of spreadsheet formulas and scripts for current and upcoming processes within the Quality Department as well as other projects. Working with Google Data Studio to allow for better and more user-friendly reporting set up. Correcting workbooks and providing feedback to trainees in the Google Sheets training course. Assistance with maintaining existing spreadsheets Help with report and tool creations for projects and on a global level.  Track tasks progress using Jira and Agile Scrum methodology  Essential  Requirements High competency using Google software (particularly Sheets and Data Studio). Experience with programming languages such as Google Apps Script, JavaScript or Python Able to work autonomously. Able to think divergently. Be open minded and proactively reach to others for their ideas and suggestions. Ability to work effectively and decisively under pressure. Highly organized with the ability to manage to priorities and deadlines  Assets Experience with Sharepoint, PowerBI and Power Automate is nice to have  Benefits Competitive salary and benefits Fun working environment Working with the biggest names in the gaming industry

Direct message the job poster from ADP Kareem Goddard Talent Acquisition Business Partner - Lifion by ADP ADP is hiring a Junior Python Developer  Are you a technologist first and foremost who approaches every problem wearing that hat while going out of your way to champion secure development creativity and build diverse, engaged teams? Are you looking to join a dynamic, inclusive team environment with a culture of collaboration and belonging? Are you empathetic to client needs, the people you work with and internal partners motivated to drive success?  Well, this may be the role for you. Ready to make your mark?  In this role, you will work with Global Security teams, from Critical Incident Response Center, Fraud Prevention, Security Architecture, to Threat Intelligence, to create and drive a future vision for next generation SOAR solutions.  No two days are the same. You will work alongside Team Leads and internal Clients globally to build trusted advisor relationships. You will work on the ground with SMEs and our clients to identify the right mix of tools and techniques to translate client IT needs and future goals into a plan that will enable secure and effective solutions, optimize operational processes and enhance business intelligence automation.  You will partner with IT development & Product Management teams to build key enrichment & integration from ADP products and supporting platforms.  You will lead efforts to gather/define requirements to develop prevention, detection, and response capabilities within ADP Cyber security and Fraud prevention platforms.  Your clients and SME partners will look to you to provide security guidance, architectural support, and implement foundational solution configuration in support of our integrated SOAR application platforms and security objectives.  You will collaborate with Detection Engineers to design, build & maintain cyber & fraud alert catalogs.  You are keen on promoting the use of innovative new technology and best practices for evolving security objectives  You can present your ideas and your team's progress in a clear, professional manner on paper, in-person, on video calls, and over the phone.  You have solid experience analyzing and defining solutions, maintaining, and enhancing existing solutions, as well as, participating in the delivery of core projects.  You enjoy mentoring, brainstorming new concepts and providing guidance for your team members You can work with partners in IT, Ops and Engineering to provide support for troubleshooting Production issues  Our best developers are enthusiastic creators who stay current on new ways of optimizing SOAR processes and enhancing business intelligence automation. They're always looking for new ways to make tools better for our users.  To thrive in this development lead career, you'll need to be an expert in SOAR Development, coding in Python and SQL. You enjoy designing and configuring the implementation of solution designs to meet a client's functional requirements. You'll enhance existing SOAR solutions and fix issues within the day-to-day operations of SOAR platform that require a Developers' touch. You'll have a hands-on role designing the UI, including Dashboards, Reports, and User Access Control Frameworks, configuring Applications/ Questionnaires, Campaigns, Notifications, Package migration.  You'll need an understanding of leveraging API's to pull and push data from different data sources to update records in the SOAR platform.  Our internal Clients will look to you to analyze their Business & Functional Requirements to develop Technical designs and documentation, to provide your subject matter expertise for the development and management of SOAR applications.  You'll have experience working with internal Clients to analyze their Business logic to develop into process workflows, calculations, API integrations, configurations and troubleshooting functional issues.  You'll have experience with Access Control set-up and can manage their SOAR user accounts (e.g., bulk user uploads, user account creation) and train users to navigate the SOAR applications and provide technical support.  Like what you see? Apply now! Learn more about ADP at tech.adp.com  A little about ADP: We are a global leader in HR technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, HR, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. A global Best Places to Work, DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more, ADP has a deep commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. Learn more about ADP's commitment on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos  WHAT YOU'LL DO:  Here's what you can expect on a typical day in the life of a Python Developer at ADP.  Stand-ups. You'll start each day with a stand-up, working in a team to understand responsibilities, identify any issues, and communicate project priorities. Our Lead Developers do more than code/configure - they communicate the intricacies and problems at hand.  Configuration/coding. Working in two-week sprints, you keep up with timelines and Agile development & secure coding standards.  Variety of work. There is no typical day. You could be working on anything from client consultations, designing new cyber security alerts to delivering new features, system enhancements, or creating new services.  You're always learning new enhancements to optimize Cyber security and Fraud prevention processes, build better business intelligence and operating with a "figure it out" mission-focused mentality.  You're comfortable working with the latest SOAR tech that has never been used before. Inevitable challenges will arise, and we'll rely on you to look for a solution.  A college degree is great but not required. What's more important is having the skills and experience to do the job.  TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE:  Positive Self-Starter. You have an upbeat, persistent style and the ability to talk with internal clients without fear of rejection. You manage your time well, prioritize deliverables, and multi-task with the best of them. In addition, you can present your ideas in a clear, professional manner on paper, in-person, on video calls, and over the phone.  Proven Winner. You have an ambitious spirit and thrive under pressure, motivating you to not only hit development project timelines, but exceed them.  YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN:  Team collaboration. Courage comes from how associates are willing to have difficult conversations, speak up, be an owner, and challenge one another's ideas to net out the best solution.  Deliver at epic scale. We deliver real user outcomes using strong judgment and good instincts. We're obsessed with the art of achieving simplicity with a focus on client happiness and productivity.  Be surrounded by curious learners. We align ourselves with other smart people in an environment where we grow and elevate one another to the next level. We encourage our associates to listen, stay agile, and learn from mistakes.  Act like an owner & doer. Mission-driven and committed to navigating change, you will be encouraged to take on any challenge and solve complex problems. No tasks are beneath or too great for us. We are hands-on and willing to master our craft.  Give back to others. Always do the right thing for our clients and our community and humbly give back to the community where we live and work. Support our associates in times of need through ADP's Philanthropic Foundation.  Join a company committed to equality and equity. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions.

job_title: Junior Analyst Medical Data - Emergency Department Coder - Weekends
desc: Location  New York, New York  Shift  Weekends (United States of America)  Description  World-Class Clinical Coding  More than a job, we're offering the ultimate opportunity for clinical coding professionals. At New York's #1 hospital (U.S. News), you'll work closely with top physicians and documentation improvement nurses while employing the unique specialty coding model. There's never been a better time to join our team. A recent conversion to EMR across all five campuses is taking health information management to exciting heights.  Junior Analyst Medical Data ( Coder ) – Emergency Department  In this role the Junior Medical Data Analyst performs diagnostic and procedural coding for Emergency Department medical records. Utilizing medical records, you’ll review, abstract and apply appropriate diagnostic coding, facility level E&M coding, and APC assignment of Emergency Department patient records according to coding guidelines as applicable. You will review Emergency Department medical records to interpret documentation and assigns accurate coding for procedures in accordance with guidelines established within the Emergency Department. You will communicate with physicians appropriate to clarify documentation as related to APC or coding assignment. You will prepare abstract information in accordance with mandated hospital, state, and federal registry programs. Corrects and resubmits data from abstracts as identified through edit reports from said registries.  This is a Full time day position, (Tuesday - Saturday or Sunday to Thursday, 9:00 am to 5:00 pm shift, weekend hybrid position which will be located at our corporate office in Midtown Manhattan.  Preferred Criteria CCS, RHIA or RHIT Required Criteria College level courses or equivalent in anatomy and physiology, and medical terminology One year demonstrated ED diagnostic and procedural coding experience preferably in a computerized/electronic environment in an academic medical center Provide evidence of successfully completed coding course in ICD-10CM, CPT4, HCPCS, E&M and applicable grouper coding schemes Pass a skills assessment consisting of a representative sample of ED services at NYPH for all promotion/hires Join a healthcare system where employee engagement is at an all-time high. Here we foster a culture of respect, diversity, and inclusion. Enjoy comprehensive and competitive benefits that support you and your family in every aspect of life. Start your life-changing journey today.  __________________ #1 in New York, "America's Best Hospitals 2021-2022." - U.S.News & World Report 2021 "Employees' Choice Awards: Best Places to Work" - Glassdoor 2021 " Best Workplaces in Health Care & Biopharma" - Fortune 2020 "America's Best Employers in New York State" - Forbes 2020 "Working Mother 100 Best Companies" - Working Mother 2020 "Best Companies for Multicultural Women" - Working Mother 2020 "Best Workplace for Men in Nursing" - American Association for Men in Nursing Discover why we're #1 in New York and a best employer at: nyp.org/careers  NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital is an equal opportunity employer.

desc: Direct message the job poster from Lockton Companies LLP Adam Setterfield (Cert CII) Talent Acquisition Manager at Lockton Companies We have a new opportunity to join our In-House Legal Division as an integral part of the growing Data Protection team.  The purpose of this role is to support the Data Protection Manager in the ongoing management of the data protection framework, by ensuring that data protection requirements, risks, and issues across all businesses of Lockton International are appropriately identified and managed.  This is fantastic opportunity for Junior Data Protection Analyst with a couple of years’ experience in Data Protection/Privacy preferably within the Financial Services or Insurance sector.  Analyse and understand data protection risks across Lockton International Implement and monitor the effectiveness of data protection controls and processes. Assist the Data Protection Manager in maintaining an effective data protection framework and culture.  Role Responsibilities:  To check and validate any updates to the Records of Processing Activities (ROPA) through stakeholder reviews. Liaising with the business to obtain information on high-risk data processing activities for completion of Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs). Supporting the Data Protection Manager in the investigation and closure of incidents and potential personal data breaches. Support the Data Protection Manager in the fulfilment of Data Subject Access Requests Assist in the monitoring of the business’ compliance with Direct Marketing rules under the PECR. Conduct assurance reviews on relevant data protection controls and processes, ensuring their effectiveness. Assisting in the remediation of assurance findings with the relevant stakeholders and the Data Protection Manager. To build out the Record Retention Schedule working with the business and IT to maintain compliance with the associated policy. Support the Data Protection Manager with Ad-Hoc tasks and project work from time to time. Supporting the review of supplier due diligence responses. Completion of client due diligence requests. Helping to develop, update and embed data protection policies, guidelines, and standards within the business. Help provide advice and guidance to the business on data protection issues and queries when necessary. Support the delivery of strong data protection culture within the business through training initiatives and workshops. Create effective communications and awareness materials for delivery to the business  Candidate Profile:  Some experience in working in an analytical or risk-based role desirable Understanding or interest in relevant data protection regulations (UK GDPR/PECR) Ability to work independently and to reprioritise work to meet the needs of the business within a fast-paced operation. Experience using OneTrust desirable. Strong working knowledge of MS Office Word, Excel, Power Point. Desire and ambition to complete Insurance and Privacy/Data Protection qualifications.

Direct message the job poster from Spectrum Health Systems, Inc. Erica Schulman National Recuiter at Spectrum Health Systems, Inc. Location: Worcester, MA - Spectrum's Corporate Offices Salary: $60,000-$65,000 annually   The Junior Business Intelligence Developer role is to develop reports using the requirements from the various business units across the Spectrum Health Systems organization.  All custom report development projects must be carefully and thoroughly planned to provide the greatest opportunity for success. This position will focus primarily on using Crystal Reports against an Intersystem’s Cache database supporting the myAvatar electronic health record application from Netsmart, Inc.  Assist with set-up and maintenance of the EHR business logic and associated dictionaries.  This role will work closely with internal clinical, administrative and financial stakeholders within Spectrum.  The position will play a key role in the transformation of vast amounts of clinical data into meaningful information that provides key actionable insights.  Qualifications:  Bachelor’s Degree required in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Database Design Report writing experience preferably Crystal Reports 3+ years of SQL experience a plus Strong customer focus Maintain high standards of data integrity Strong communications (written and verbal) Highly functioning analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to manage multiple priorities and deliverables Successfully ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is essential Experience with EMR data and applications a plus Flexible work schedule to ensure dates and deliverables are preserved Strong written and oral communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills. Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products. Must be able to learn, understand, and apply new technologies. Experience in data visualization such as Tableau, Qlik or PowerIBI Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is crucial. Useful to have advanced knowledge of Excel and/or Power Query Strong Knowledge and understanding of EHR Billing Systems and EDI X12 a strong plus

Description  Job Description:  We are in search of an entry level BI Engineer to join our team based in supporting the contracts at the Social Security Administration.  Leidos is seeking an entry level BI Engineer to join a team supporting Data Modeling and Data Administration supporting the Social Security Administration (SSA), Data Administration Data Quality Branch (DADQB), located in Baltimore Maryland.  The DADQB a component within the Division of Enterprise Architecture & Data Administration (DEADA). The primary function of the DADQB is to promote quality and consistent data across the agency by aiding in the planning and development of systems.  The selected candidate will be responsible supporting the DADQB on the following: Working with OLTP/data warehouse modeling, and play key role in multiple projects and act as knowledge expert (Technical, Functional). Collaborate with Solution & Enterprise Architects, Business analysts, DBAs and others to understand business requirements Support complex discussions and engagements that may involve multiple project teams from client. Able to work independently with BA and PM to gather requirements, perform data discovery, come up with data model, and work with developers to design and implement ETL solutions. Work with ETL methodologies for supporting data extraction, transformations and loading processing, in a corporate-wide-ETL Solution. Working on data pipeline solution on large database environment (e.g. Greenplum/PostgreSQL). Data analysis, problem solving. Work with ETL tools and SQL database. Working with a team in information architecture, data architecture, data modeling, data governance, ETL design, data quality and BI-analytics. Working with a team designing relational data models, analytical data models and non-relational data models for OLTP and advanced analytic applications. Required Skills Some Experience in PostGreSQL / Greenplum database and working on data pipeline for non-relational data structure, NoSQL data model such as JSON on MongoDB, HBASE, Hive is a plus. Knowledge regarding BI Development, ETL Tools, SQL Some Data Analysis, troubleshooting, and problem solving Desired Skills Some experience working in large-scale cloud database environments is a plus. Some experience working on data pipeline for non-relational data structure, NoSQL data model such as JSON on MongoDB, HBASE, Hive is a plus Good communication skills and ability to convey complex topics through effective documentation as well as presentation. Familiar with machine learning and advanced analytic application development. Some ability to create dashboards in Tableau or Webfocus using various sources like database, CSV files, XL spreadsheets etc. Education & Qualifications Associates degree and 3+ years of experience in a training-related field or HS/GED degree and 5+ years of experience in a training-related field Must be able to obtain a Public Trust

Responsibilities  The Junior Database Administrator is responsible for implementation, maintenance, testing and support of firm-wide databases and applications, primarily related to Baker Tilly Time and Billing System (STAR). This includes analyzing, developing and managing requests for modifications and enhancements to the database structure for these applications. Also responsible for supporting the application development team with database changes, queries, and reports, as well as working with the Technical Services Team on maintenance updates to the database servers.  Primary Duties And Responsibilites Responsible for the infrastructure and architecture for all database systems and related subsystems. This includes the definition of backup strategies and maintenance plans, patch management procedures and disaster recovery procedures and processes. In addition, this role is responsible for system performance maintenance and data integrity. Responsible for the development of enhancements and modifications to the database systems used by the firm. This includes the development of custom level queries, SSIS packages, reports and actual system development work as needed, including enhancement estimates. Assist in Reporting team initiatives through identifying end user requirements, development, testing and support of reports, data warehouses and data analysis. Provide firm-wide support for all custom-built applications. Additionally, provide second level support for STAR. Fill in as primary support person as needed. Assist other Baker Tilly IT personnel with problem resolution as needed. This can include firm-wide issues, as well as region specific problems. Conduct briefings and demonstrations for users to enhance systems productivity. May be called upon to assist in the development of training coursework and materials as well as performing the actual training. Maintain technical knowledge by attending technical education, attending workshops, reading publications and pursuing technical certifications. Maintain and comply with quality service by following organization’s technological standards. Document procedures Research new technologies and applications that can improve the quality, performance or functionality of database applications used firm-wide. All other duties as assigned. Qualifications Bachelors degree required. 1 to 3 years of related work experience required. Bachelor’s degree in related field. SQL Server Administration. SQL programming/SQL Database. SQL Server Reporting Services. SQL Server Analysis Services. Experience in .NET programming (ASP.NET, VB.NET, C#). Experience with SQL Server Integration Services. #AT-LI1  #REMOTE  Overview  Baker Tilly US, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a leading advisory, tax and assurance firm, providing clients a genuine coast-to-coast and global advantage with critical mass and top-notch talent in major regions of the U.S. and in many of the world’s leading financial centers - New York, London, San Francisco, Los Angeles and Chicago. Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 148 territories, with 36,000 professionals and a combined worldwide revenue of $4.0 billion.  Many of Baker Tilly’s roles have the opportunity to work remotely. Please discuss with your talent acquisition professional to understand the requirements for an opportunity you are exploring.  Baker Tilly is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable federal, state or local law.

Our Client in the insurance sector is offering an excellent opportunity for a confident, outgoing Graduate who can  split his time between understanding the commercial aspects of the business, producing accurate and meaningful reinsurance reports and using your analytical skills to support the commercial teams  in maintaining and developing business.  KEY RESPONSIBILITES Produce accurate and meaningful reinsurance reports monthly. To perform regular quality checks on data To identify and analyze non-performing accounts/ loss making areas and propose solutions. Perform product benchmarking. Calculate IBNR, loss ratios, average costs, burn cost per policy. To help with underwriting and to identify and challenge non-standard underwriting decisions. Qualifications And Knowledge Degree in Mathematics with Statistics / Statistics / Actuarial Science. Graduate or 0–1 year experience in insurance. Advanced level in Microsoft EXCEL (Familiar with VLOOKUP/XLOOKUP, Pivot table, advanced formulas) Knowledge in Insurance would be an advantage. Knowledge in Excel VBA and R programming would be an advantage. Basic accounting knowledge (e.g., produce Profit and Loss reports). Your Profile Good analytical abilities Drive, self-motivation, and determination to achieve results Excellent interpersonal and communication skills A team player with a positive attitude Ability to use own initiative A self-learner committed to self-development

About Us  Staffigo is in the business of providing IT Consulting Services to clients in various industries in the United States - Healthcare (Payer, Providers & Clearinghouses), Finance & Banking, Retail & eCommerce. We are currently seeking exceptional entry-level talent for the below role.  Job Description Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions. Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies. Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems. Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings. Performing requirements analysis. Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts. Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management. Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports. Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff. Providing leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to junior staff. Allocating resources and maintaining cost efficiency. Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements. Performing user acceptance testing. Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance. Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures. Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements. Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users. Managing competing resources and priorities. Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.  Minimum Requirements Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any related field of study. No travel; no telecommuting. Job duties are project-based and performed on long-term assignments at various unanticipated sites within the U.S. which may require relocation at the end of each project. Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, v-lookups, charts). Experience using the relational database system, Oracle preferred. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Understanding of software development life cycle. Must know how to use Power BI or Tableau. Experience with hands-on and manual data tasks Excellent analytical skills. Ability to handle multiple projects under tight deadlines. Attention to detail and ability to follow instructions and written processes to deliver requirements.  We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. About Dataedo: We create an internationally recognized metadata software We are a product company. We develop and sell our solution. With a profit We have more than 400 customers, mainly in the USA and the UK. We work with big brands such as Disney, the LA Clippers, Fujitsu, Intel, the U.S. Department of the Treasury, and many more We are highly rated by our customers on Gartner Peer Insights (4,6) and Capterra (4,8) One customer reviewed our services: „This software has always given me what they promise and more" – this completely reflects our philosophy We’re a team of 30 people from Poland and the USA. We work 100% remotely. The core of the team is technical  About Junior BI/Data Engineer role at Dataedo:  We are looking for a data enthusiast to research various data technologies and platforms, and design, develop and test schema extraction connectors. This job is a great opportunity to get a broad knowledge of data and analytics technologies.  How do we work? Agile way. We release a new version of our product quarterly. We don’t like to waste our time on meetings but we know that some of them are necessary to get the work done. That’s why we have kick-offs, project (feature) reviews, and daily standups.  As a Junior BI/Data Engineer you will: Research and familiarize with various relational databases, no-SQL databases, big data technologies, cloud platforms, and/or BI tools Prepare sample data structures and environments Design metadata/schema extraction libraries (listing tables, columns, constraints, etc.) Write queries extracting metadata Test connectors Create technical documentation  Requirements  You’re the perfect candidate if you: Know how relational databases, data structures, and SQL work Have an understanding of basic concepts one of the following: no-SQL databases, big data technologies, Hadoop, BI tools Understand English (at the level of reading the documentation) Speak Polish fluently  The recruitment process at Dataedo:  Working task: we'd like to evaluate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Dataedo might be like.  Online Interview: you'll meet your future manager, Łukasz Preiss. We’ll explore your experience and skills, and you can see if Dataedo is the best place for you!.  Decision/offer: Congrats and welcome to Dataedo! An offer call will be arranged to discuss the contract details. We’ll be back with feedback no matter what the decision is.  Benefits  What we offer: 100% remote work Flexible working time (you can arrange your working hours the way you prefer) Salary: B2B 6,000 - 9,000 PLN net (26 days off inculded), CoE 5,000 - 7,500 PLN gross All necessary work tools such as laptop, additional monitor, and other accessories Private healthcare – no extra charge Team building events – we meet a few times a year for integration and have a chance to connect online every day

desc: Direct message the job poster from parsionate Ela Nayak Team Lead -Technical Consulting | Senior Technical Consultant | PSM | Data Enthiusiast Working at parsionate means being a Dataninja. Our promise to every team member: No boring daily routine in business, we live passion. Your idea counts and will be honored. We hire smart experts because we want their opinion. This work with experts inspires everyone in our team. Here you are always at the forefront of the digital pulse of time. Together we create growth and shape markets. Growth for our business and for you personally.  What you can expect: You are part of our development team and work based on the latest methodologies such as SCRUM and Kanban You install, configure and develop software around the data management applications of our customers Your development tasks include the implementation of frontend, backend, and integration solutions During the development process, you will be supported by a team of senior developers and system architects You can develop into an expert in a field of your choice  Your offering to us: You have enthusiastically completed a degree in the field of computer science, engineering, or a comparable education You are passionate about expanding your knowledge of software development in our projects You want to bring your good PHP or Java skills and the first experience with relational databases to parsionate You already have some experience with tools like Eclipse, Jira, SVN or Git, and Jenkins You are characterized by analytical and conceptual skills You are open, communicative, and a real team player Whether German or English, you move confidently on the floor  What we offer: A successful and highly motivated team Great projects with international customers Excellent development opportunities in a fast-growing company with great conditions Cooperation with experts in a flat hierarchy and short communication paths Personal space, assumption of responsibility, and implementation of own ideas Balancing family and career through flexible working hours and locations Much more than just a job!

Country  Bulgaria  Job Family  Operations  For over 80 years, GfK has been a reliable and trusted insight partner for the world’s biggest companies and leading brands who make a difference in every consumer’s life - and we will continue to build on this. We connect data, science and innovative digital research solutions to provide answers for key business questions around consumers, markets, brands and media. With our headquarters in Germany and a presence in around 60 countries worldwide, you benefit from our global company with a diverse community of ~9,000 employees.  Harnessing the power of our workforce, the greatest asset we have is our people. As part of GfK, you can take your future into your own hands. We value talent, skills and responsibility and support your development within our international teams. We are proud of our heritage and our future: Currently we are in the latter stages of a transformational journey from a traditional market research company to a trusted provider of prescriptive data analytics powered by innovative technology. This is only possible with extraordinary people and this is why we are looking for YOU to help create our future. For our employees as well as for our clients we pursue one goal: Growth from Knowledge!  Job Description  Junior Client Data Specialist  Mission of the role  The purpose of the role is to prepare and provide marketing reports to external clients, in accordance with pre-established methodology, deadlines and quality.  As a Junior Client Data Specialist, you will have the following key accountabilities: Preparation of marketing reports, based on the pre-entered data by going through various stages in the process Communication with local and global stakeholders on all issues, related to the preparation and transmission of the reports, as well as responding to any operational inquiries that may arise Monitoring reports’ quality, eliminating errors and malfunctions in the transmission process Assisting the teams responsible for the data-entry phase, in case of identified problems affecting the data Submitting the finalized reports in strict compliance with the agreed deadlines Now that you know what a Junior Client Data Specialist does, what skills, qualifications and experience do you need? Higher education in the field of: Economics, Marketing, Statistics, Data Management or other related area Very good level of English - B2 Administrative experience will be considered an advantage Ability to work with deadlines and set goals Attention to details and a high level of time management skills Very good communication skills Good computer literacy - work with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Join Our Team And Benefit From The Following Advantages Exciting work environment that brings people together Use of the latest digital technologies Initial and ongoing trainings to support your development Opportunities for personal and professional growth Competitive remuneration and bonus scheme linked to individual performance and company results Flexible working hours and home office 3 additional non-working days annually Food vouchers Health insurance Discount program with external vendors Eco friendly travelers are welcome to the office – parking places for bikers and free card for public transportation are available to all employees Variety of sport activities such as football and traditional Bulgarian dances Last but not least – GfK Sofia office is located close to the city centre and easily accessible from any point by public transportation – 47A Tsarisgradsko Shose Blvd All documents will be treated in the strictest confidentiality.  Only short-listed candidates will be invited for an interview.  С удоволствие Ви каним да се присъедините към екипа ни като:  Специалист изготвяне и предаване на маркетингови доклади  Цел на позицията:  Целта на ролята е да подготви и предостави маркетингови доклади на външни клиенти, в съответствие с предварително установена методология, срокове и качество.  Като Специалист изготвяне и предаване на маркетигнови доклади ще имате следните ключови отговорности: Изготвяне на маркетингови доклади на база на предварително въведени данни, като преминава през различни етапи в процеса на изготвяне Комуникация със съответните местни / глобални заинтересовани страни по всички въпроси, свързани с изготвянето и предаването на докладите, като отговаря на всякакви оперативни запитвания Следене за качеството на докладите, като се отстраняват грешки и неизправности в процеса на предаване При констатирани проблеми, засягащи отчитането на данните, подпомагане на екипите, отговарящи за тяхното въвеждане Предаване на готовите маркетингови доклади и следене за стриктното спазване на уговорените срокове Какви умения, опит и квалификация са ви необходими, след като вече знаете какво прави Специалист изготвяне и предаване на маркетингови доклади? Висше образование в сферата на: Икономика, Маркетинг, Статистика, Управление на данни или друго свързано с естеството на работа Много добро ниво на владеене на английски език - В2 Опит на административни позиции ще се счита за предимство Умение за работа с крайни срокове и поставени цели Внимание към детайлите и високо ниво на лична организираност Много добри комуникативни умения Добра компютърна грамотност – работа с MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Присъединете се към нашия екип и се възползвайте от следните придобивки: Опит в глобална организация, лидер в своята област Първоначално и последващо обучение Възможности за професионално и личностно развитие Работа в амбициозен и мотивиран екип Конкурентно възнаграждение и бонус програма, обвързана с личното представяне и резултатите на компанията Сумирано изчисляване на работното време и възможност за работа от вкъщи Три допълнителни неработни дни годишно Ваучери за храна Здравно застраховане Програма за отстъпки с външни партньори Достъп до едни от най-модерните технологии Безплатна карта за градския транспорт за всички линии и паркоместа за велосипеди Разнообразие от спортни инициативи като футбол и народни танци Последно, но не и по важност – отлична локация на офиса в близост до центъра на София с удобен градски транспорт – бул. Цариградско шосе 47А Високо оценяваме интереса към компанията и благодарим на всички кандидати за отделеното време.  Одобрените по документи кандидати ще бъдат поканени на интервю  We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal opportunity in employment which focuses on all of our employees reaching their full potential. At GfK we work collaboratively with our colleagues but offer a flexible working approach, including dividing our time between office & remote working as well as the opportunity to flex our working hours around team core hours.  We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit. We make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.  Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to get to know you!

job_title: Consultant Data junior H/F - Data & Analytics
desc: TON PROFIL De nature curieuse et engagée, les métiers du conseil, le développement de solutions et le monde de la Data t’attirent. Tu possèdes un diplôme d’une grande école d’ingénieur, tu parles couramment anglais, tu maîtrises certains langages et solutions. Nous avons des missions passionnantes à te proposer en 1er job, au sein de notre cabinet de conseil en management et technologie ! TES MISSIONS Si tu l’acceptes, tu interviendras sur des missions de : Définition de stratégies et de gouvernance data. Diagnostic de maturité data et élaboration du portefeuille de cas d’usage. Conception de solutions data et reportings. Pilotage de projets de transformation data. Exploration analytique des données, interprétation des résultats et élaboration de recommandations métiers. Mise en conformité règlementaire RGPD. Enfin, tu interviendras sur le développement de nouvelles offres, la contribution aux propositions commerciales, la participation aux actions de recrutement et autres événements. POURQUOI NOUS REJOINDRE L’équipe est jeune et dynamique, comme toi ! Les missions et secteurs d’activités de nos clients sont variés et te challengeront. Des experts techniques et métiers t’encadreront sur tes missions pour te permettre d’exprimer pleinement ton potentiel. Un cursus d’intégration et un plan de formation individualisé te sera proposé à ton arrivée.  En somme, nous te proposons une 1ère expérience très enrichissante avec une multiplicité d’opportunités pour ton développement et ton évolution de carrière. L’excellence, l’esprit d’équipe, la passion et l’engagement sont des valeurs que tu partages ? Alors contacte-nous dès maintenant.  Merci de fournir obligatoirement une lettre de motivation.  La société BearingPoint s’engage à respecter la loi n° 2004-1486 du 30 décembre 2004 contre les discriminations et pour l’égalité des chances. Les informations demandées au candidat concernent uniquement sa capacité à occuper l'emploi proposé et ses aptitudes professionnelles.

PERMANENT CONTRACT  We seek a passionate, and highly motivated Junior Data Analyst to support our Business and Data Analyst for Europe and Africa.  You will have close interactions with various teams (Development, Business Controlling, Finance, IT, Power Sales, COE…).spanning multiple countries (France, UK, Spain, Greece, Kenya…).   Main missions: Participate into gather internal needs in term of reporting and dashboards Collect internal and external data as needed Design dashboards and reports and conduct ad hoc analyses Ensure Data integrity and provide support on created Dashboards Update existing dashboards and reports periodically Work on existing dashboards automation   REQUIREMENTS You completed a degree in computer engineering, data analysis, economics or finance You have experience with a data visualization tool (PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, Periscope etc.) You are fluent in English (and ideally French) You are proficient with Excel Nice to have: you have familiarity with a scripting language (Preferred: Python) and SQL.   SOFT SKILLS You have strong analytical & data driven skills You are proactive, and have a problem-solving mindset You want to work in a fast-paced environment with exciting challenges to tackle You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills (oral and written) You are passionate about designing beautiful, practical, and insightful dashboards and reports

Esta Posição Tem Como Principal Desafio  Montagem de um data lake da empresa, inicialmente voltado para área de assinaturas, e envolvendo a parte de audiência de sites, dados de assinaturas, assinantes e dos aplicativos;  Desenvolvimento de pipelines de integração de dados da origem até o data lake e do data lake para outros sistemas da empresa;  Criar rotinas de limpeza, qualidade e transformação de dados para disponibilização aos cientistas de dados e time de BI;  Criar/ manter rotinas de governança de dados;  Auxiliar time de Produtos na criação de segmentações e produtos de dados;  Trabalhará também com projetos diversos.  ,  Formação completa em Exatas;  Conhecimento em banco de dados Oracle e bancos não relacionais;  Vivência na plataforma Linux;  Experiência com Data Integration, Google Big Query ou outras semelhantes;  Conhecimento em ferramentas de Engenharia de Dados;  Experiência com Google Cloud.  ,  Assistência Médica Co-participativa  Assistência odontológica  Auxílio-creche  Auxílio-internet  Convênios e descontos comerciais  Trabalho remoto  Vale-transporte

LIFULL Connect is a Global Marketplace Group that operates more than 250 sites across the property, employment, motoring, and fashion in 63 different countries and 24 different languages. Some of our sites operate under the Trovit, Mitula, Nestoria, Nuroa, Properati, and Fashiola brands. Our mission is to connect people and help them make some of the biggest decisions in their life.  We are an innovative and creative team, we look for team players, humble, self-responsible, curious, passionate, happy, proactive, and willing to roll up their sleeves.  Our team context:  Our team has a big challenge in the company that is to contribute to our culture of data-driven decision-making. We are owners to build and maintain the unified data analytics platform for Lifull Connect. We work with continuous delivery and minimum viable product. We are building it iteratively, learning, validating, and growing our platform by each use case. Ideally, we are looking for someone who is near our Barcelona or Madrid office. We are open to remote work, but, from time to time, we need to see each other in person.  We are looking for a Junior Data Engineer to join our Team. This is a great opportunity for those that would like to specialize in data engineering as you will have the chance to learn a lot!  What you will do: Maintenance, support, and evolution of the current data platform (AWS + DBT) Data ingestion into the data lake (StitchData and custom pipelines) Work closely with the data analyst, business, and development teams to help them to work with data  What we expect from you: 1-year previous experience in data engineering A team player with a positive attitude Eager to learn and not afraid of change. Passionate about data. Basic experience with Cloud Data Platform environments (preferred AWS). Basic experience with data pipelines and ETLs. SQL knowledge.  What we offer you:  The most important thing that we offer at LIFULL Connect is an environment where everyone can grow and make an impact. We have a big growth challenge ahead of us and we are willing to walk that path and achieve our objectives. We are firm teamwork believers and we like to push ourselves to do better while enjoying the journey!  Some of the things that will help you perform at your best (aka benefits & perks): A remote-first culture that will allow you to choose where you want to work from (your home or our office in Barcelona). A unique and challenging job driven by bold objectives. A lean, diverse and multi-regional company. Ongoing training & learning opportunities. Online English lessons for all levels. Private medical insurance. Flexible Payment Plan (Restaurant, Transport, Kindergarten).  Sounds like you? Then let's talk!  Powered by JazzHR  gMhShcD4Iz

Company Overview  Motorola Solutions is there for our customers when everything is on the line. In extreme moments — when a hurricane lands or when a fire breaks out. And in everyday moments — when a package arrives just in time for the holiday or when a child doesn’t miss the school bus home.  We unify voice, data, video and analytics in one integrated ecosystem to enable individuals, businesses and communities to work together in more powerful ways. To help people make better decisions, act confidently and be their best in the moments that matter. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions and connect with a career that matters.  Department Overview  Accounts Payable  Job Description  As Accounts Payable Assistant you will be responsible for:  ∙ Invoice scanning  ∙ Resolving issues of vendors and Motorolans  ∙ Ad-hoc requests assigned by Team Leader  Department Overview  Accounts Payable Department is responsible for all accounting services for the Motorola suppliers and employees. The Motorola Finance Center in Krakow is a part of our global network of Finance Operations Center (F.O.C.) which provides world-class finance, accounting, and purchasing services to all Motorola entities. It is a dynamic environment where your ideas and input will be valued and where you will do some of the best work of your life.  Basic Requirements  ∙ Good command of English  ∙ Detail-oriented  ∙ Good communication skills  Basic Requirements  Accounts Payable  Travel Requirements  None  Relocation Provided  None  Position Type  Experienced  Referral Payment Plan  Yes

The Junior Analyst is a key team member of the Digital + Analytics team. This role will develop and market those services across a portfolio of clients. The Junior Analyst will help advance the impact of analytics across Lippe Taylor as a strategic partner to our clients and will contribute to a culture of increase data literacy and data driven decision-making. The role will be actively across multiple projects and programs and will continue to work on innovative ways to report and measure results for our clients to better understand key insights that answer critical questions and will be able to communicate results quantitatively, contextually and with a storytelling mindset to various stakeholders. Responsibilities: · Assist in projects, data export, data aggregation, deck development, analysis execution, insight development and presentation to clients · Gather, aggregate social data for agency clients, including native platform analytics through Facebook, Sprinklr, and Shareablee · Assist in formulating actionable insights for client businesses from data to ensure integration with overall client strategy · Support quick turn exploratory analytics requests in social listening, survey development, audience analysis and search and SERP · Have knowledge of earned media measurement and be able to quickly learn proprietary methodologies · Help develop, program, and execute primary research utilizing Pollfish or similar consumer research platform · Participate in internal status meetings, as well as be comfortable client-facing and sharing reporting · Provide clients with understanding of consumers and performance, KPI indicators, and ongoing reporting and optimization recommendations across multiple lines of business · Manage recurring reporting and ad-hoc project timelines · Ensure data and reporting accuracy · Collaborate with multiple internal teams (i.e., Creative, Planning, Engagement, and Digital) to guide decision-making and ensure project accuracy · Serve as point of contact to clients for anything analytics related on reporting calls, recommendations, and day-to-day collaboration Qualifications: Demonstrated knowledge in a digital marketing agency or social media analytics team, developing, executing, and reporting on earned and digital media campaigns Must have 1-3 years of experience. Some knowledge of social media landscape, including emerging platforms and best practices Some experience using social listening tools (i.e. Brandwatch, Meltwater); audience segmentation (i.e. social media audience segmentation with third party platforms or manually) and dashboarding tools (Google Web Analytics) Strong knowledge of excel (power-user is preferred) Ability to drive business forward and willing to gather, maintain and report out on data Ability to demonstrate critical and analytical thinking Passion for, and interest in social and emerging media Strong organizational, presentation and interpersonal skills including the ability to juggle multiple assignments / clients and cope with stressful situations Ability to prioritize and handle high-volume detail work in quality fashion Be enthusiastic, flexible and willing to go beyond assigned duties Be a strong team player and able to work autonomously Bachelor's degree required  About you: Experienced: You have experience in public relations, communications, and creative storytelling, with a focus on Planning, in-house or agency. You are a disciplined team player who embraces opportunities to teach, learn and collaborate. You have worked with clients and on projects of varying sizes in terms of budget and complexity. You are excited to understand your clients’ roles in the context of the big picture of their industry and how Lippe Taylor can elevate their brand. You ask questions, know how to research and are resourceful in how you can best serve your team, clients, and career goals. You have high standards for your work and the value we drive; you remain accountable to yourself and your team. You are proactive and have worked on multiple projects at once, interacting across leadership, teams, and clients regularly. You are prepared to earn influence and drive success at every chance. Project Manager and Accountable: You understand the importance and value of your role as the driver of your work – for your growth, your company, and your team. You are organized and proactive in follow-up to ensure that all engines run smoothly. You know the value of being a team member that everyone can count on! Love of Storytelling: You understand that every client, every leader, and every audience have nuanced ways of telling and listening to messages and you are here to help! You understand what you need to ascertain to build the right messages, story flow and how to differentiate that story regardless of the medium or channel. Teacher & Mentor: You enjoy mentoring junior staff and developing their skills alongside yours. You’re able to take complex ideas, synthesize and reframe them for team members. You can be an advocate for team members while being fair. You’re comfortable delivering both positive and critical feedback honestly and with support. Our Commitment to you: Provide a safe and respectful workplace, that is diverse and inclusive in nature Always be available to listen to your needs, concerns, and feedback Help you articulate and achieve your goals Purposefully drive business that meets your passions Share best practices, industry news and innovations Give you the time you need to have wellness and mindfulness Lippe Taylor Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer

In EY diventi protagonista delle trasformazioni  In EY Consulting non troverai soltanto un lavoro, ma un’esperienza formativa che ti porterà ad essere il Trasformation Leader che stiamo cercando. Vogliamo essere la scintilla che fa avverare le tue ispirazioni e rende possibile il tuo successo. Per questi motivi ti offriamo tutte le risorse, le competenze tecniche specifiche e le community tematiche per sviluppare i tuoi interessi e le tue ambizioni.  Cerchiamo persone in grado di guidare trasformazioni complesse attraverso tecnologia, human e innovation, e capaci di coniugare conoscenze tecnologiche e visione del futuro.  Perché dovresti scegliere EY Consulting?  Perché qui puoi unire la tua passione per codici, dati e la tua creatività alla curiosità per la strategia di business e lo sviluppo di soluzioni d'avanguardia.  Da subito entrerai a far parte di team e settori diversificati, partecipando attivamente ai processi di trasformazione e di innovazione di aziende, società e Pubbliche Amministrazioni per creare un impatto sul Paese.  Costruirai la carriera che desideri grazie a percorsi di formazione su hard e soft skill, community e hub tecnologici, dove potrai quotidianamente provare, sperimentare e crescere.  The Exceptional EY Experience, It’s Yours To Build.  Opportunità professionale:  Siamo alla ricerca di Junior Consultant per il nostro team Technology Consulting su tutta Italia che vogliano cominciare al massimo la loro carriera con uno stage in EY e imparare a diventare esperte ed esperti di trasformazione.  Gli ambiti in cui potresti lavorare sono tantissimi: Il team Technology Consulting guida il cambiamento tecnologico e digitale per migliorare quello che ci circonda e costruire un Better Working World, grazie alle competenze di Cyber Security, Data & Analytics, Blockchain, Technology Transformation, Technology Solution Delivery e in partnership con i principali vendor tecnologici del mercato.  Quali competenze cerchiamo? Laurea in: Ingegneria, Fisica, Matematica, Statistica, Informatica ed Economia Capacità di operare in autonomia e in team Conoscenze informatiche dei principali applicativi Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point) Visione del futuro, pensiero laterale, giudizio, empatia, ingegno, adattabilità e creatività.  Cosa chiediamo:  Una forte voglia di cambiare il mondo, per il meglio. In EY diamo luogo ad una trasformazione, mettendo il nostro purpose - Building a better working world - al centro di tutto ciò che facciamo, e siamo convinti di poter contribuire alla trasformazione del Paese con una forte e precisa idea di futuro e di innovazione. desc: Employment Type  Permanent  Company  A large retail chain based in Cape Town  LOCATION:  Cape Town (Hybrid working model)  Job Overview  The Junior database administrator will work with a senior database administrator to design database infrastructure and monitor and troubleshoot database systems for our clients within the Company group.  Description Of The Position  In this career, your duties may include working to improve the performance and efficiency of data storage and access systems. Your responsibilities also involve server maintenance and the development of database security systems. The company usually expects the administration team to use their skills to meet the clients needs for data storage and access. You may also perform an analysis of backup procedures and make upgrade recommendations based on your findings.  The Primary Focus Of This Position Is To Install and setup databases Configure databases Monitor databases Backup and restore databases Ensure all database servers are backed up in a way that meets the business’s Recovery Point Objectives (RPO) Test backups to ensure we can meet the business’ Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) Assist developers with performance tuning Setup and deploy database object change scripts as requested from developers and third party vendors Document the company’s database environment Knowledge And Skills Good knowledge of database technologies Basic knowledge of relational databases Competencies Good time management skills Detail orientation Good administrative skills Stress tolerance Analytical abilities Attributes You want to join an energetic, focused and dynamic team. You have a can-do attitude and a strong work ethic to prove it Positive outlook on life End-user orientated/focused Enjoy having fun at work Qualifications Required Matric Tertiary qualification in IT Experience Required 1-3 Years’ experience as a DBA Advantageous Knowledge of MySQL and Microsoft SQL Server databases will be beneficial Please note : If you have not heard from us within 2 weeks, please consider your application unsuccessful.

In EY diventi protagonista delle trasformazioni  In EY Consulting non troverai soltanto un lavoro, ma un’esperienza formativa che ti porterà ad essere il Trasformation Leader che stiamo cercando. Vogliamo essere la scintilla che fa avverare le tue ispirazioni e rende possibile il tuo successo. Per questi motivi ti offriamo tutte le risorse, le competenze tecniche specifiche e le community tematiche per sviluppare i tuoi interessi e le tue ambizioni.  Cerchiamo persone in grado di guidare trasformazioni complesse attraverso tecnologia, human e innovation, e capaci di coniugare conoscenze tecnologiche e visione del futuro.  Perché dovresti scegliere EY Consulting?  Perché qui puoi unire la tua passione per codici, dati e la tua creatività alla curiosità per la strategia di business e lo sviluppo di soluzioni d'avanguardia.  Da subito entrerai a far parte di team e settori diversificati, partecipando attivamente ai processi di trasformazione e di innovazione di aziende, società e Pubbliche Amministrazioni per creare un impatto sul Paese.  Costruirai la carriera che desideri grazie a percorsi di formazione su hard e soft skill, community e hub tecnologici, dove potrai quotidianamente provare, sperimentare e crescere.  The Exceptional EY Experience, It’s Yours To Build.  Opportunità professionale:  Siamo alla ricerca di Junior Consultant per il nostro team Technology Consulting su tutta Italia che vogliano cominciare al massimo la loro carriera con uno stage in EY e imparare a diventare esperte ed esperti di trasformazione.  Gli ambiti in cui potresti lavorare sono tantissimi: Il team Technology Consulting guida il cambiamento tecnologico e digitale per migliorare quello che ci circonda e costruire un Better Working World, grazie alle competenze di Cyber Security, Data & Analytics, Blockchain, Technology Transformation, Technology Solution Delivery e in partnership con i principali vendor tecnologici del mercato.  Quali competenze cerchiamo? Laurea in: Ingegneria, Fisica, Matematica, Statistica, Informatica ed Economia Capacità di operare in autonomia e in team Conoscenze informatiche dei principali applicativi Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point) Visione del futuro, pensiero laterale, giudizio, empatia, ingegno, adattabilità e creatività. About Us  Staffigo is in the business of providing IT Consulting Services to clients in various industries in the United States - Healthcare (Payer, Providers & Clearinghouses), Finance & Banking, Retail & eCommerce. We are currently seeking exceptional entry-level talent for the below role.  Job Description Create, validate and send daily weekly, and monthly management reports to clients. Assistance with requests for non-standard reports and analysis for clients. Support management reporting by maintaining hierarchy information. Research and answer client's questions. Perform business-to-system analysis and troubleshooting analysis of complex management reports and business problems with guidance. In the report, development lifecycle supports impact analysis and project requirements definition. Transform client needs into functional requirements. With guidance, collect, analyze and document business requirements for project proposals including but not limited to process and data flow, user interface, security, and reporting requirements. Job duties are project-based and performed on long-term assignments at various unanticipated sites within the U.S. which may require relocation at the end of each project. Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, v-lookups, charts). Experience using the relational database system, Oracle preferred. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Understanding of software development life cycle. Must know how to use Power BI or Tableau. Experience with hands-on and manual data tasks Excellent analytical skills. Ability to handle multiple projects under tight deadlines. Attention to detail and ability to follow instructions and written processes to deliver requirements. The following attributes will also be highly advantageous: Excellent Written Skills Excellent Communication / Verbal Skills Advanced skills in Excel Astute and compressive understanding of analysing complex data and contracts Commercial mindset ERP Accounting system experience Inter-personal, clear concise communication and approachability skills are directly linked to your potential success within this role. Discover your full potential. At Tetra Tech, we are collaborating with industry-leading experts for a sustainable future for our world. We combine consulting and engineering with advanced analytics and technology to solve the world’s most complex challenges. Our innovation hubs across the globe will enable you to share ideas and best practices while growing your professional network. Wherever you are in your career journey, you will benefit from working with world-class engineers, scientists, and technical specialists.  Apply today and join the company that is Leading with Science®.  Your Role  We are currently seeking a Junior AI/Database Administrator for our Pickering, Ontario office. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Responsibilities Databases – design and implement a database to track and monitor a predetermined set of data points MS Access MSSQL, SQL, SQL Server Knowledge of Oracle in an asset Programming – utilize programming languages to create complex functions for use in databases VBA, VB.NET C++, Java is an asset Excel – track and monitor predetermined set of data points in a spreadsheet with greater than 1,000 rows or columns using macros, Visual Basic, and advanced formulas Word – creating, manipulating, organizing and formatting large, complex documents Powerpoint – creating, manipulating, organizing and formatting large, complex presentation Qualifications Recent graduate with University/College Degree completed or 4th year student 1 years of related experience in database operation – working or previous co-ops Previous AI experience is considered an asset Access – demonstrate proficiency in Access queries, programming/coding, form building and reporting Excel – advanced formulas, macro’s, advanced analytics(trending/splicing , graphing Word - Organize and format a large, complex document Powerpoint - Organize and format a large, complex presentation Must be able to work as part of a multi-disciplined team For more information on our company, please visit our website at www.tetratech.com. To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter on the Careers portion of our website at www.tetratech.com/careers.  We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Tetra Tech is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We invite resumes from all interested parties including women, minorities, veterans and persons with disabilities.  Tetra Tech is a VEVRAA federal contractor and we request priority referral of veterans for available positions.  EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability - No calls or agencies  Additional Information  A requirement of working for Tetra Tech is that you are at least 18 years of age and legally entitled to work in Canada. (A copy of a valid work permit may be required.)  If you are considered for the position, clearance on all applicable background checks (which may include criminal, identity, educational and security) and professional reference checks is required. Some Tetra Tech positions require an enhanced level of background assessment, which is dictated by law. These positions require advanced criminal record checks that must also be conducted from time to time after commencement of employment.  As this position may be serving clients that have COVID-19 vaccination requirements for site access, we will be confirming your eligibility to comply with this requirement.  About Tetra Tech  Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion-dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 450 locations around the world. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees—21,000 associates working together to provide smart, scalable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development.  Explore our open positions at https://www.tetratech.com/careers. Follow us on social media to learn more about our people, culture, and opportunities:  LinkedIn: @TetraTechCareers  Twitter: @TetraTechJobs  Facebook: @TetraTechCareers  Tetra Tech is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity, inclusion, and equity are among Tetra Tech’s core values. Throughout our history, the company has prioritized equitable inclusion of all people. All qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military or veteran status, gender, age, disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, genetic information and any other characteristics protected by the law. We invite resumes from all interested parties, including women; First Nations Metis and Inuit persons; members of visible minority groups; and persons with disabilities. Please visit our website at www.tetratech.com to see the array of diverse services and exciting projects we are currently working on.  We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.  Please no phone calls or agencies.  Additional Information Organization: 705 PWR

FDM is currently seeking numerous ambitious and driven candidates with the aptitude for tech to work as FDM consultants. We help people like you make their first step into business every day. Are you ready to make yours?  About This Role As a Junior Data Engineer with FDM, you will undergo industry specific training and continue your career journey as an FDM consultant by working for one of our globally recognized clients. Some common positions you could be working in include Data Engineer, Data Architect, ETL Engineer and more.  As a Junior Data Engineer, you will design, develop and test a large-scale, custom distributed data pipeline using the Java, Python and the latest Big data technologies. You will be a technology advocate and share expertise with other team members. You will be a key partner to the business and the rest of the team throughout the delivery cycle and will work through challenging and interesting problems.  No previous qualifications or STEM Field experience is required.  About the FDM Career Development Program The program begins with training in one of our career streams in business and technology that are in high demand in the job market. We will provide you with the industry-specific technical and professional skills you need in your chosen stream, after which you will start working as an FDM Consultant with our globally recognized clients.  Upon completion of the program, many see their journey with FDM culminating in an accelerated career progression, better placing them to apply for senior roles within the industry.  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree A strong aptitude for technology and the interest and drive to expand your technical skill set Able to commit to work for FDM for a minimum of two years working as an FDM consultant following the training period. Eligible to work in the US.  Benefits A chance to work for some of the most prestigious companies in the world. Opportunity to earn professional certifications related to your career path. Continuous career support and upskilling from FDM. Comprehensive and competitive benefits package. Access to a network of mentors and like-minded individuals. Relocation support (if necessary) Industry recognized paid training.  FDM Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, provincial or local laws.
