Are you looking to fit into a rewarding, client driven team? Engine Transformation are looking for an Apprentice to join our data practice. You will learn all about digital work across a variety of fascinating data projects, and help businesses and organisations to resolve their most critical business, technical, data and change challenges.  A typical day Solving a business problem using a hackathon which could be a wider Engine initiative Writing code and queries for day-to-day analytics and specific projects Learning database and data structures Defining problems and how to solve them Getting value from data and how to visualise results to present Delivering client analytical presentations Delivering reporting with insight and recommendations Completing a predictive model using machine learning to solve a business problem Data flows from source to destination and consolidation of data Learn about data pipelines, APIs, web service and data extracts Learn about Customer 360 view, CDPs and data warehousing Understand how to extract data from databases and use in multi-channel comms Learn to deliver an automated communications journey You must have GCSE English & Maths 4-9 (C-A*) or equivalent Skills Needed Problem solving Teamwork Initiative Attention to detail Organised and structured in approach The ability to prioritise and re-prioritise workload A positive and collaborative approach Ability to meet deadlines Strong communicators Proficient in using Microsoft Office tools, Word, PowerPoint, Excel Motivated and full of ideas Data and technology fanatics, who can show an interest in and understanding of recent trends and the benefits they could bring Able to build successful relationships Training provided  Data Fellowship Level 4  Being a Multiverse apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.  As part of your Multiverse apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to help you develop the 6 key competencies: well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.  Future prospect  After your Data Fellowship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. We have a new opportunity to join our In-House Legal Division as an integral part of the growing Data Protection team.  The purpose of this role is to support the Data Protection Manager in the ongoing management of the data protection framework, by ensuring that data protection requirements, risks, and issues across all businesses of Lockton International are appropriately identified and managed.  This is fantastic opportunity for Junior Data Protection Analyst with a couple of years’ experience in Data Protection/Privacy preferably within the Financial Services or Insurance sector. Analyse and understand data protection risks across Lockton International Implement and monitor the effectiveness of data protection controls and processes. Assist the Data Protection Manager in maintaining an effective data protection framework and culture. Role Responsibilities To check and validate any updates to the Records of Processing Activities (ROPA) through stakeholder reviews. Liaising with the business to obtain information on high-risk data processing activities for completion of Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs). Supporting the Data Protection Manager in the investigation and closure of incidents and potential personal data breaches. Support the Data Protection Manager in the fulfilment of Data Subject Access Requests Assist in the monitoring of the business’ compliance with Direct Marketing rules under the PECR. Conduct assurance reviews on relevant data protection controls and processes, ensuring their effectiveness. Assisting in the remediation of assurance findings with the relevant stakeholders and the Data Protection Manager. To build out the Record Retention Schedule working with the business and IT to maintain compliance with the associated policy. Support the Data Protection Manager with Ad-Hoc tasks and project work from time to time. Supporting the review of supplier due diligence responses. Completion of client due diligence requests. Helping to develop, update and embed data protection policies, guidelines, and standards within the business. Help provide advice and guidance to the business on data protection issues and queries when necessary. Support the delivery of strong data protection culture within the business through training initiatives and workshops. Create effective communications and awareness materials for delivery to the business Candidate Profile Some experience in working in an analytical or risk-based role desirable Understanding or interest in relevant data protection regulations (UK GDPR/PECR) Ability to work independently and to reprioritise work to meet the needs of the business within a fast-paced operation. Experience using OneTrust desirable. Strong working knowledge of MS Office Word, Excel, Power Point. Desire and ambition to complete Insurance and Privacy/Data Protection qualifications.

Recent advancements in underlying technology have finally made it possible for AI to impact clinical care and research in a meaningful way. Tempus' proprietary platform connects an entire ecosystem of real-world evidence to deliver real-time, actionable insights to physicians and healthcare organizations, providing critical information about the right treatments for the right patients, at the right time.  We are looking for Jr. Clinical Data Abstractors (JDAs) to join our rapidly growing clinical data team. JDAs will be responsible for reviewing clinical records, structuring key data elements and helping to ensure that clinicians have access to meaningful data and insights to treat their patients. This is an ideal position for someone with a scientific or clinical background who is interested in working at the crossroads of healthcare technology and data analysis to solve some of today’s most challenging medical questions. Learning knowledge; MS SQLServer, T-SQL, SSIS, PowerBI Knowledge in C#, R, Python, SSAS are considered an asset Familiar with relational and multi-dimentional modeling Solution-oriented and pragmatic, able and willing to propose new ideas Distinguish yourself by your strong knowledge of organizational skills, by your flexibility, your team spirit, your dynamism, your curiosity and your eagerness for learning and evolving Fluency in French and good understanding of English Strong data & logical analysis skills Familiar with advanced analytics (predictive analytics / machine learning) and the use of data analytics tools such as Python or R, visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Qlikview) Familiar with concepts like Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, ETL, traditional Relational Database Management Systems (e.g. SQL Server, Oracle), NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB) and Data Management processes Knowledge / experience or certifications in AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Services will be considered a plus We want to hear from you! In EY diventi protagonista delle trasformazioni  In EY Consulting non troverai soltanto un lavoro, ma un’esperienza formativa che ti porterà ad essere il Trasformation Leader che stiamo cercando. Vogliamo essere la scintilla che fa avverare le tue ispirazioni e rende possibile il tuo successo. Per questi motivi ti offriamo tutte le risorse, le competenze tecniche specifiche e le community tematiche per sviluppare i tuoi interessi e le tue ambizioni.  Cerchiamo persone in grado di guidare trasformazioni complesse attraverso tecnologia, human e innovation, e capaci di coniugare conoscenze tecnologiche e visione del futuro.  Perché dovresti scegliere EY Consulting?  Perché qui puoi unire la tua passione per codici, dati e la tua creatività alla curiosità per la strategia di business e lo sviluppo di soluzioni d'avanguardia.  Da subito entrerai a far parte di team e settori diversificati, partecipando attivamente ai processi di trasformazione e di innovazione di aziende, società e Pubbliche Amministrazioni per creare un impatto sul Paese.  Costruirai la carriera che desideri grazie a percorsi di formazione su hard e soft skill, community e hub tecnologici, dove potrai quotidianamente provare, sperimentare e crescere.  The Exceptional EY Experience, It’s Yours To Build.  Opportunità professionale:  Siamo alla ricerca di Junior Consultant per il nostro team Technology Consulting su tutta Italia che vogliano cominciare al massimo la loro carriera con uno stage in EY e imparare a diventare esperte ed esperti di trasformazione.  Gli ambiti in cui potresti lavorare sono tantissimi: Il team Technology Consulting guida il cambiamento tecnologico e digitale per migliorare quello che ci circonda e costruire un Better Working World, grazie alle competenze di Cyber Security, Data & Analytics, Blockchain, Technology Transformation, Technology Solution Delivery e in partnership con i principali vendor tecnologici del mercato.  Quali competenze cerchiamo? Laurea in: Ingegneria, Fisica, Matematica, Statistica, Informatica ed Economia Capacità di operare in autonomia e in team Conoscenze informatiche dei principali applicativi Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point) Visione del futuro, pensiero laterale, giudizio, empatia, ingegno, adattabilità e creatività.  Cosa chiediamo:  Una forte voglia di cambiare il mondo, per il meglio. In EY diamo luogo ad una trasformazione, mettendo il nostro purpose - Building a better working world - al centro di tutto ciò che facciamo, e siamo convinti di poter contribuire alla trasformazione del Paese con una forte e precisa idea di futuro e di innovazione.  Cosa offriamo: Ambiente di lavoro internazionale, all’interno di team diversi e multidisciplinari. Percorsi di formazione continua per valorizzare il tuo talento. Hub tecnologici avanzati in cui sperimentare la trasformazione Supporto di un Counselor, quale guida nella scelta delle esperienze più adatte alle tue ambizioni. Benefit e programmi di welfare aziendale. Tutti gli strumenti necessari per avere una carriera orientata alla crescita, alla sperimentazione e alla tecnologia più avanzata  Apri la tua carriera a nuovi scenari di crescita ed entra a far parte del team di EY Consulting.

Junior Data Engineer Denver Tech Center (hybrid remote flex - must be vaccinated to go on-site) Contract-to-Hire Pay Rate: $26/hr (70-80k conversion salary)  Skill Set Proficiency in backend Java development Experience with SQL Understanding of data and data mining as it relates to the needs of consumers Familiar with working in a linux environment and shell scripting for maintaining standalone applications Interest in DevOps and AWS Exposure to C++, Python, Java, PL/SQL, Scala, Shell Scripting, Containerization tools (Docker and Kubernetes)  Responsibilities Support 100+ legacy and new applications for video usage ($1B revenue) For the first 4-6 months, the Junior Data Engineer will learn about the data within the applications to then own coding features and do hands-on development Attend daily standups, grooming sessions, and agile ceremonies Gather data from customer API’s so care can assist customers Deploy serverless architecture in Kubernetes Provide day-to-day production support of data warehouse BI environment Identify the right way to use and leverage the data collected Create and document technical designs to achieve project requirements Work with analysts to understand and validate end-user requirements Participate in system and user acceptance testing tasks as assigned Responsible for sending reports to revenue assurance team, marketing team, advertisement team, etc.  Eight Eleven Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Combitech i Malmö, Helsingborg, Växjö, Jönköping och Linköping växer och vi är ett glatt team med olika kompetenser som nu vill bli fler. Vi har en stor inhouse-verksamhet där vi samverkar med andra kontor inom olika kompetensområden, så du kommer ha möjlighet att både sitta ute hos våra kunder men också att jobba med arbetspaket från våra kunder in-house.  På våra kontor finns både systemutvecklare, teamlead, projektledare, BI & AI experter. I teamet hjälper vi och stöttar varandra att nå våra mål. Det är en öppen och trevlig atmosfär på kontoret, och vi jobbar mycket med kunskapsutbyte, och att du som konsult ska kunna utveckla dig och lära dig det du är intresserad av.  Din roll som Data Scientist  Som data scientist utvecklar, förfinar och tränar du analysmodeller med olika tekniker. Det kan handla om statistiska och matematiska modeller, men också om maskininlärning och deep learning. Projekten handlar om allt från att bygga framtidens smarta industrier till att skapa ett hållbarare samhälle.  Du kommer att jobba i team med mer erfarna kollegor inom Data Engineering Data Science Data Analysis BI/AI Du har en teknisk utbildning inom Matematik, Matematisk statistik eller motsvarande och intresse av rollerna listade ovan. Du har också erfarenhet av programmering i t.ex. Mathlab, Python/Pandas eller liknande. Du är intresserad och driven, och kan behärska både svenska och engelska.  Rollerna ovan kan innebära arbete som omfattas av försvarssekretess. Därför krävs att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning gjord av myndighet.  Vi söker just nu juniora Data Scientist på flera orter i landet och avser att kombinera dina första två år på Combitech med det etablerade utvecklingsprogrammet ”Combitech Talent Program” och vi vet då att du får två givande år som du har med dig hela ditt yrkesverksamma liv.  Combitech Talent Program  Combitech Talent Program är utformat för att snabba på din resa från talang till erfaren konsult. Programmet anpassas till ditt kunduppdrag och innehåller flera delar från vårt kompetensutvecklingskoncept Combitech Grow. Steg för steg breddar du din kompetens och lär dig att lära av andras erfarenheter.  Programmet avslutas med examination i samarbete med KTH.  Programmet pågår parallellt med dina ordinarie konsultuppdrag under drygt två år och innehåller fyra olika spår: Fördjupad teknisk vidareutbildning Affärsmannaskap och ledarskap Utveckling i att se kundnyttan, presentera och argumentera för din sak och samarbeta Erfarenhetsutveckling. Vi lär oss själva förstå och sätta ord på erfarenheter, så att de kan spridas och användas av dina kollegor Låter det intressant? Hör av dig till oss eller skicka in din ansökan på direkten. Urvalet sker löpande. Välkommen till Combitech!  Kom och gör skillnad  Hos Combitech erbjuder vi, utöver spännande och utvecklande kunduppdrag, anställningstrygghet och förmånspaket, samtidigt som du får chans att växa i en företagskultur som uppmuntrar både personlig och professionell utveckling samt balans i livet.  Combitech GROW, vårt forskningsbaserade kompetensutvecklingsprogram, ingår som en naturlig del i din anställning. Att vi dessutom är ett stabilt växande och oberoende teknikkonsultbolag inom försvars- och säkerhetskoncernen Saab AB bidrar såklart också till dina utvecklingsmöjligheter.  Hos oss är du med och utvecklar teknikområdet för att möta kraven från framtidens digitala samhälle. Vi har exempelvis många spännande projekt inom digitalisering, autonomi, artificiell intelligens, cyber security och 5G-utveckling. Våra konsulter utvecklar också bland annat flygande hjärtstartare som räddar liv, system som ökar säkerheten på flygplatser och nya stridsflygplanet Gripen E som gör samhällen trygga.  Vill du veta mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss? Kolla in våra karriärsidor på vår webb!

About The Role  In this role you will be responsible for ensuring that financial documentation is retrieved and organized in a timely manner in order to support data conversion. This includes matching data points across systems to ensure documentation consistency and accuracy, data entry, indexing and uploading files.  Role based in Stellenbosch and new joiners will be expected to work from the office. Flexible working may be permitted after probation.  This is a great opportunity to join a vibrant, fast growing and dynamic Data Operations team that helps set the gold standard for research quality private capital data.  Key Responsibilities Digital archiving of various financial documentation Effectively navigate manager portals to ensure all documentation is processed accordingly Contribute to low risk administrative projects Perform audits and other quality control functions for the content set Comply with all documentation policies, standards and processes  Skills & Attributes Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive mindset Good communication skills (written & verbal) Highly organized and self-disciplined High levels of focus and the ability to work with and accurately process large volumes of documentation Positive attitude and desire to learn  Experience & Qualifications Undergraduate degree (all majors considered) OR 1-3 years of relevant work experience Familiarity with financial markets, accounting practices and private capital Working knowledge of MS Excel. A suitable work from home setup, in the form of a reliable internet service and a dedicated, properly equipped workspace.  Life at Burgiss  At Burgiss, you can expect: Competitive salary Medical aid Pension enrolment Group risk benefits Employee Assistance Program Tuition reimbursement Fun social and engagement calendar Corporate socially responsible employer Possibility of working flexibly from home and office (after probation)  About Burgiss Group  Burgiss is a global, market-leading provider of data and analytics solutions for investors of private capital. With over 30 years of expertise in private markets, we offer unrivaled data, analytics and transparency that enable asset owners, asset managers and financial intermediaries to understand, evaluate and manage private capital portfolios. We partner with more than 1,000 firms in 32 countries, delivering data that represents over $7.8 trillion in private assets.  With offices throughout Asia Pacific, EMEA and the Americas, we leverage our expertise and network to service our clients and focus on their varying needs across regions. Further information is available at www.burgiss.com .  At Burgiss, our mission is to deliver essential data and investment management solutions to help global investors build better private capital portfolios. To do this, we are building a global team of individuals representative of the clients we serve. We are striving to foster a diverse and inclusive environment where different cultures, backgrounds and viewpoints are welcomed and embraced. We recognize that advancing diversity and inclusion is a continuous commitment which connects us to our clients and communities.  Burgiss is an Equal Opportunity Employer, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals. We recruit, hire and promote into all job levels the most qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy (including unlawful discrimination on the basis of a legally protected pregnancy/maternity leave), veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our company.  Candidate POPI Consent  By the Candidate applying for this position and submitting any personal information to the Company, the Candidate unconditionally and voluntarily, consents to the processing of the submitted personal information for the purposes of: To assess your ability and suitability for the position/s. For your performance appraisal. Our management of any complaint, investigation, or inquiry in which you are involved. About Us  888 group is one of the world’s leading online gaming companies, established in 1997 and listed on the London Stock Exchange since 2005.  We own and develop our own state-of-the-art technology and products, that provide a fun, fair and safe online gaming experience to millions of players globally. Our marketing teams lead global campaigns using only the most cutting-edge online marketing methodologies.  888 is home to some of the best talents in the industry. We pride ourselves as an employer of choice to over 1,600 ‘8sters’ around the globe.  When joining us, you will enjoy a hybrid work model, combining in-office work with remote work (work from home) during the week.  About The Role  888’s Junior SQL Developer will join our Marketing Automation Developers team.  The team is developing tools that increasing the abilities of our B2C to bring our players the best offers at the right time (campaign and promotions).  This is done by writing advanced SQL (dynamic, performance, jobs) and develop automatic tools over the Data-Warehouse system.  In this position, you will gain exposure to the worlds of marketing, content, analytics, and technology (SQL, BI, Applications, Internal and External tools) while working in a multi-interface environments.  As a Junior SQL Developer at 888, you will be responsible for: Creating working processes with the marketing managers, understanding the needs and complexities in order to provide the relevant technological solutions. Develop new application features for our automatic marketing campaigns system. Maintain system multiple environments: Development, QA, Production. Report generation – using SQL-Server-Reporting-Services to create high-detailed and smart analytic reports. Optimize existing processes (a must) – performance tuning of existing campaigns while using SQL functionality and indexes. Supporting existing protocols – monitor, maintain and automate existing processes. This Job Is For You If You Have MUST +1 year experience as SQL-Developer on relational-databases systems (MySQL, MSSQL, Oracle). A degree in Industrial Engineering and Management/ Information Systems. English at a high level. desc: IMPORTANT!! We are doing full remote work. You have to pass an online coding test first to apply to our company. After you apply, follow this link: https://itemku.com/s/fresh There will be an online test. If you pass the online test, we will contact you soon. If you don't finish the online test, we will not continue your application. Welcome!  We are looking for a Junior Software Engineer with a strong sense of ownership and a passion to learn something new.  As part of the team, you will be given the chance to build and improve itemku, which is based on open-source technologies such as node.js, React, and Elasticsearch.  Successful candidates must also be innovative, flexible, self-directed, and able to design and write reliable, maintainable code.  Responsibilities Build interactive and accessible UIs for itemku using TypeScript and React. Implement APIs using Koa.js. Collaborate with diverse teams to plan, prototype, build, and maintain new features. Create test cases to assess product quality. Research web technology trends. Requirements Excellent understanding of Object-Oriented design and concepts, design patterns, data structures, and ALGORITHMS Excellent written and oral communication skills Be able to read and write in English Equipment for remote work: Laptop, monitor, headset and good internet What Will Really Excite Us (but Isn't Required) Fresh graduates in Computer Science or equivalent Hands-on development experience using JavaScript, ES5/6 Understanding of commonly used frontend framework (React, Vue, or Angular) Knowledgeable with node.js and its framework Passion and enthusiasm to learn new technologies

Are you a Junior Web Developer who wants to join the KPMG Future Analytics department? Do you have 1-2 years Web Developer experience with a strong understanding of content management and the web development process? Are you interested in joining a firm that delivers award winning training and opportunities for career progression? Whatever your reason is for wanting to look for a new job, joining the Future Analytics team in KPMG may be the best next step for your career.  Role  We are currently seeking to hire a Junior Web Developer for a permanent opportunity, based in Dublin. This is an exciting opportunity for a junior full stack web developer to join the team at KPMG Future Analytics and utilise their knowledge of principles, practices and procedures related to programming and application server operations to develop and maintain applications written in languages such as C#, Java, JavaScript, Python, SQL Server and ASP.NET. They will also be responsible for delivering and maintaining wordpress-based websites and CMSs.  This includes, but is not limited to, web front-end user interfaces, middle tier components/services and data interfaces. This position requires a combination of programming skills and aesthetics. Additional responsibilities include providing daily updates of status to the technical lead and following software development process guidelines. The candidate should have an understanding of content management systems and an understanding of the web development process, including design, development and deployment.  We ideally need you to have the following on your CV: Min 1-2 years web developer experience in HTML, JavaScript, Bootstrap/CSS, JQuery, and SQL databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL Degree level qualification in Computer Science, IT or Information Systems would be desirable Have worked with Wordpress in the past, related CMSs and theme adjustment/config Good understanding of front-end technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery Experience building user interfaces for websites and/or web applications Experience designing and developing responsive design websites Comfortable working with debugging tools like Firebug, Chrome inspector, etc. Ability to understand CSS changes and their ramifications to ensure consistent style across platforms and browsers. Expected to have knowledge of Bootstrap and Material UI Ability to convert comprehensive layout and wireframes into working HTML pages with responsive mindset Knowledge of MySQL, NoSQL – MongoDB Knowledge of how to interact with RESTful APIs and formats (JSON, XML) Proficient understanding of code versioning tools Some exposure to Hosting and Domain configuration Knowledge and have worked with ReactJS, NodeJS is a plus Knowledge of how to leverage APIs: SOAP/REST, Web Services Ability to create and translate wireframes into functioning responsive websites Additionally, it would be nice to have; Experience in UX/UI design Experience with AWS and/or Microsoft Azure ecosystem. Knowledge of Django, NodeJS, ReactJS, AngularJS. Knowledge of data modeling, relational database fundamentals. Exposure to ArcGIS, ArcSDE, QGIS, PostGIS/PostgreSQL, Carto, Leaflet, R. Your work will be varied. Below will be some of your core responsibilities: Build custom and responsive websites with provided design (asset) input Develop new user-facing features. Applicants must have a keen eye for detail, and be comfortable working in a fast paced, client focussed, creative environment Build reusable code and libraries for future use that are consistent across all browsers and platforms Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX design Assist back-end developers with coding and troubleshooting Stay up to date on emerging technologies Deliver on programming assignments, reporting to a technical lead Participate in software code reviews Work on integration testing with a senior developers and non-technical users Providing daily updates of status to the technical lead and following software development process guidelines Utilise knowledge of principles, practices and procedures related to programming and application server operations to develop and maintain applications written in languages such as C#, Java, JavaScript, Python, SQL Server and ASP.NET Other duties as assigned by the technical lead We Offer More Than Just a Career Opportunity An in-house award winning team of training specialists who will help you achieve your career goals Relocation assistance for those looking to move home to Ireland Team  is our planning, economics and research consultancy who specialise in the provision of data-driven advice to public and private sector clients. This newly-acquired Consulting team is currently engaged in several European projects funded under the Commission’s Horizon 2020 programme. Our team has managed and being part of 17 EC-funded projects.  Hard Work Is Rewarded At KPMG  We offer excellent remuneration packages at all levels. At this level the package includes an extremely competitive base salary, performance based bonus, and a KPMG flexible benefits package.  Diversity  We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Creating an inclusive culture where all our people achieve their potential is fundamental to our business. In addition, our employees have the option to avail of our flexible working policies/intelligent working arrangements. To learn more about diversity at KPMG, click  Our Values  Our Values guide our behaviours day-to-day, informing how we act, the decisions we make, and how we work with each other, our clients, companies that we audit, and all our stakeholders. They guide our thousands of extraordinary people to do what is right, learn and improve every day, think and act boldly, respect and draw strength from our differences, and do what matters.  Integrity: We do what is right.  Excellence: We never stop learning and improving.  Courage: We think and act boldly.  Together: We respect each other and draw strength from our differences.  For Better: We do what matters.  Apply  If you are interested in the above role, please submit a CV via the apply button. If you have any specific queries on the role, please contact Shauna Maguire via shauna.maguire@kpmg.ie  For an interactive insight into life at KPMG, make sure to follow us on social media! You can find us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and Snapchat at the following handle - @KPMGCareersIRL.  Please note we do not require Agency assistance for this role.  By clicking apply to this role your application will not only be considered for this position but your details will be stored on our database and may be considered for similar future positions that may arise. This means that the personal data contained in your application and provided to KPMG as part of the application process may be retained by us for up to 18 months from the date of your application and you hereby agree to that. If you do not wish your details to be stored on our recruitment database please email careers@kpmg.ie stating this and we will ensure that such information is not stored other than for the purposes of this application.

job_title: Product Support Specialist II/ Junior Data Analyst
desc: Work Location: San Francisco, CA  Hours: 40 hours  Headcount: 2  Position Description  Project Overview:  The research team at Google works on developing algorithms that make products and services more helpful, whether that be through sensing, machine perception, control systems, pattern recognition, or preference learning. These approaches depend on constructing high-quality data-sets for training and evaluation as we iterate on software or hardware design. The team is looking for a person who will work on the technical implementation (scripting), process (conduct investigations/studies/tests), and logistics (help with developing projects) for data collection efforts across the organization.  Overall Responsibilities: Participate in data collections to pilot protocols, test workflows, and assess device stability. Perform data collection tasks (conduct studies/tests) for algorithm and sensor development across products. Capable of performing data analysis on the collected data, both spot checking and with graphical data visualization. Study and subject coordination, including working with external vendors or third parties and mitigating risk. Experience with experimental design including hypothesis testing, piloting a protocol, and executing all steps of an experiment with rigor. Help develop new test setups and tools to meet the data collection needs of a variety of teams. Develop and configure/edit scripts to run for data collection. Continually improve development process to gain efficiency, remove obstacles, and simplify problems. This is a San Francisco based position. Top 3 Daily Responsibilities: Execute and monitor data collection tests with various sensors Plan and oversee collection and analysis of high-quality datasets Work with researchers, program managers, and engineers to define, plan, build, and debug tests Required Skills: BS in Engineering or related field Experience working with hardware Experience with Python or other coding languages Ability to collect data on the behavior of users and devices in a variety of environments, use cases, and situations Ability to perform manual testing, run scripts for monitored testing, and document experiments for early-stage product life-cycle development, proof-of-concept, and benchmarking Detail-oriented and ability to complete tasks/projects with set deadlines Ability to organize, multitask, and prioritize work in a fast-paced environment Proof of Covid-19 vaccination and ability to work in San Francisco and Mountain View as needed Nice to Have Skills/Not Required: Strong verbal and written communication Experience with data querying, visualization, and analysis tools Clinical or sensor technology research experience Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with a diverse range of people and job functions At least 1 year relevant work experience in healthcare, tech, research, or another related field Demonstrated experience with data collection in both lab environments and in homes

desc: A Bionexo é uma healthtech brasileira que há mais de 20 anos atua no modelo Software as a Service (SaaS) e oferece tecnologia de alta performance para a saúde. Com um portfólio de soluções digitais que automatizam toda a interação entre instituições de saúde e fornecedores, a Bionexo facilita a rotina de profissionais de vendas, suprimentos, de planejamento e também do ciclo de receita.  Nosso time conta com mais de 500 colaboradores espalhados pelo Brasil, Colômbia, Argentina e México e está em pleno crescimento. Somos experts em desenvolver soluções que trazem mais eficiência, transparência, inteligência e geram uma verdadeira revolução na saúde.  Por que ser #biolover?  Estar na Bionexo é fazer parte de um ambiente altamente colaborativo e de troca de conhecimento, além de ter autonomia para desenvolver projetos de alto impacto.  Aqui você é o protagonista da sua carreira. Vamos te dar todo suporte por meio de programas de gestão de desempenho, subsídio para cursos e uma cultura que valoriza colaboração e feedbacks, para que sua experiência seja incrível desde a sua chegada.  Diversidade & inclusão  Aqui você pode ser quem você quiser!  Na Bionexo, valorizamos olhares e experiências diversas que têm impacto direto nas nossas entregas diárias. Por isso não fazemos distinção de raça, religião, deficiência, gênero ou orientação sexual. E todas as nossas vagas também são destinadas a PCDs.  Modelo de trabalho Anywhere Office  Nos últimos dois anos, ressignificamos nossa relação com o escritório e o espaço de trabalho. Hoje, ser biolover é possível de qualquer lugar graças ao Anywhere Office, que valoriza a real necessidade da atuação presencial e prioriza a comunicação e colaboração digital entre os times. Nosso CEO conta mais aqui!  O Que Buscamos Para Essa Oportunidade Experiência com atendimento de suporte técnico de sistemas N2; Vivência com PL/SQL e análise de requisitos; Oracle Linux MCSA /MCTS Hadoop PostgreSQL HTML, CSS, JS e AJAX Sua Rotina Contará Com Atender chamados de N2 das soluções e/ou planos de baixa complexidade. Acompanhar o fila de chamados e priorizar atendimentos de acordo com urgência e impactos na utilização das plataformas pelos clientes. Levantamento de informações iniciais a provável causa de problemas ou padrões inesperados dos sistemas. Elaboração e manutenção sobre as plataformas suportadas. Realiza testes, identifica, analisa e relata BUGs (falhas) nas plataformas e atualização técnica de publicação para registro à equipe de desenvolvimento. Atua na integração entre as plataformas Bionexo e sistemas de ERP utilizados pelos clientes, garantindo compatibilidade para troca de dados entre os sistemas. Informações extras da base de dados da Bionexo para desenvolvimento de relatórios exigidos por clientes internos e externos. Ao se tornar um #biolover você terá vários benefícios: Contrato de trabalho em regime CLT Cartão de Benefícios Flexível Caju (Bandeira Visa) nas modalidades: alimentação, refeição, mobilidade, educação, cultura, home office e saúde; Assistências Médica e Odontológica para você e seus familiares diretos; Bônus anual; Seguro de vida; Licença maternidade / paternidade estendida; Auxílio-creche; Programa de Saúde Mental gratuito; Horário flexível e Day Off para comemorar uma data muito especial (seu aniversário); Possibilidade de atuar no modelo Anywhere Office (a depender da área); No dress code; Incentivo de Treinamento e Desenvolvimento para você fazer cursos e treinamentos e se manter atualizado. Política de Proteção a Dados e Informações  Ao enviar currículo e dados pessoais para participar do processo seletivo  da Bionexo, o(a) candidato(a) está ciente de que essas informações serão utilizadas para as análises e validações necessárias ao longo do processo de recrutamento e para contratação, se aprovado(a).  O titular autoriza ainda o armazenamento e compartilhamento dos dados curriculares com outras empresas do grupo Bionexo para que, caso surjam oportunidades aderentes ao perfil do(a) candidato(a), seu currículo possa ser contemplado.  A Bionexo garante todos os direitos do titular de dados pessoais, como previsto na Lei  Geral de Proteção de Dados (LGPD), e responderá a solicitações através do e-mail:  privacy@bionexo.com, garantindo o acesso, correção, eliminação ou portabilidade de informações, caso necessário.  O que queremos por aqui é simples: criar melhores conexões para uma saúde melhor e ser responsáveis pela transformação contínua do setor.  E aí, se identificou com esse desafio? Vem fazer parte desse time e se tornar um #biolover!

Direct message the job poster from Spectrum IT Recruitment Thomas Stickler Recruiting top IT talent across the UK 🚀🖥 We are looking for a Junior BI Developer to join a highly driven and team who are developing software products within the mobility and fleet management space. You will develop and maintain Business Intelligence solutions mainly focused on reporting in a MS SQL based reporting stack and Qlikview application development.  This role is open to junior/graduate candidates who are looking to start their career within BI development! You’ll be working in a fast-paced organisation with plans to be as globally recognised giving excellent career progression opportunities.  The company are based on the outskirts of Portsmouth but can offer 1 day a week home working + flexible working hours. The salary for this role is flexible DOE.  Responsibilities:  Investigate, report on, and support the resolution of business data quality issues Operational management of automated inbound and outbound data flows To work alongside the Qlikview/SQL Development Team and the Customer Reporting Team, delivering both internal and external reporting requirements To validate partner supplier invoices for various clients To support the analysis and requirement gathering for new customer reports or changes to existing reports in conjunction with the Customer Reporting Team Leader Resolution of service desk requests for new reporting requirements Transforming information requests into accurate analysis  Required skills:  Training within software development - this can come through a college course or self taught Background within an IT environment - this can be development, support etc Exposure to MS BI Stack (MSSQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, T-SQL) - ideal but not essential. This can be taught for the right candidate Excellent problem-solving skills Keen to learn!  This a fantastic opportunity for to join a fast-paced organisation with plans to be as globally recognised as their parent company, giving great career progression options.
