desc: Company Description  Traveloka is a technology company based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Founded in 2012 by ex-Silicon Valley engineers and aims to revolutionize human mobility with technology. Today we are expanding our reach by operating in eight countries and experimenting with new endeavors that will create a large impact in the markets and industries we touch.  Key Responsibilities : Complete month end closing on accurate and timely manner Provide analytical review to support variance for expense account on timely manner Prepare finalized workbook on timely manner Record expenses, accruals, prepayments Maintain fixed assets module Participate in monthly financial close process including account analysis Perform balance sheet reconciliations to ensure accuracy of balance sheet and reduce the risk of financial misstatement or financial exposure Create excel monthly files to support reporting and other team's need Support annual financial audit and any ad-hoc assignment as needed  Requirements : Accounting Bachelor Degree with 1-2 years of experience as accountant or auditor Excellent in Ms. office (esp. advance in Ms. excel) Experience working with ERP (Oracle is plus) Familiar with GAAP (IFRS is plus) Effective communication in English Ability to work under pressure and demonstrated ability to gather and communication data logically

We’re looking for a Junior Data & Research Analyst to join the team and help us organize and maintain our data. Our ideal candidate knows their way around data infrastructure and tools and can extract and share meaningful insights from mobile market data. They have great analytical skills, a love of gaming, and a desire to learn even more about the mobile gaming market. If this sounds like you, read on! You might just be the person we’re looking for.   In this role you will Analyze mobile market data and trends. Build and maintain dashboards for monitoring and reporting. Make sure internal teams have access to clean and trustworthy data. Support the team with accurate and insightful data and research reports throughout the game development process, from the early stages through to post-release. Play new games and dissect their features.  What we’re looking for Good analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyze significant amounts of information accurately and with great attention to detail. Understanding of data infrastructure. Passion for games and a curiosity about the mobile gaming market. Strong communication skills, with fluency in the English language (both written and spoken).  Your experience Basic knowledge of SQL and data-visualization tools, such as Excel, Tableau, and Power BI. Experience with data instrumentation and data collection is a plus.  What we offer Employment relationship with Ekipa2 d.o.o. (an Outfit7 subsidiary) for an indefinite period of time, with a six-month probationary period. Diverse work with exciting daily challenges, working as part of a young team in a fun, relaxed environment. The opportunity for personal and professional development. Participation in attractive projects.  COMPENSATION A compensation package will be constructed, consisting of base salary and participation in a profit sharing scheme.

Position:  Junior DBA  Location: Montgomery, AL 36104 (Onsite)  Duration: 06+ Months C2H  Position Description:  Junior DBA working in a team environment that will operate in all aspects of database design, security, and administration of SQL Server, including writing advanced SQL queries and stored procedures and working with SSIS to build and maintain ETL packages. Meet with business partners to understand requirements. Communicate with technical, applications and operational teams to ensure database integrity and security. Create design documents, develop and unit test code changes, and participate with users in UAT testing. Understand new and existing processes and produce methods to resolve issues. Manage database access across various user groups (internal and external). Assist in Database Design and Development. Create and maintain SSIS packages to import / export data and automate processes. Participate in the creation of development, staging, and production database instances, and the migration from one environment to another. Recommend and implement emerging database technologies. Recommend optimizations to existing application queries. Assist in data security monitoring. Support production databases after hours as needed.    Skills Required:  Strong communication and organizational skills. Ability to use problem-solving and analytical skills to take on challenging tasks. Desire and ability to learn and hone new skills. Able to work both independently and as part of a team.    Experience Required:  1-3 years of SQL Server Database Administration focusing on: Relational database Modeling and design. Installing SQL Server. Writing and analysing complex queries in T-SQL. Troubleshooting and problem solving of performance and other issues related to locking and blocking. Routine database maintenance such as backups, reorgs, and database recovery. SQL Server security and encryption methods. Developing, maintaining, and deploying SSIS packages. Developing T-SQL stored procedures, functions, views, and triggers. Working in a VSTS (Azure DevOps) and Agile environment.    Education Required:  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field; Or equivalent work experience.

Job Description  Data Processing Specialist delivers one of the processes necessary to create a database or report for our Client (top FMCG companies and retailers). The processes include validating the data, setting-up the database, coding products by providing characteristics and managing data samples.  Challenges That Await You Conducting processes that lead to a creation of a database according to the clients’ requirements. The processes include selecting and validating the data, products, checking their correctness in internal applications that do not require programming skills; Working as part of a multinational team and liaising with other European Nielsen Offices; Daily collaboration in virtual environment; Building knowledge and understanding of FMCG categories and markets in different geographies; Providing Customers with outstanding service – replying to inquiries, implementing change requests, solving issues; Striving for constant improvement by suggesting process changes and ensuring key performance metrics are met – on time delivery and quality. Your Profile  Qualifications Educated to degree level; Very good level of both written and spoken English is a must (B2); Computer literacy (especially MS Excel); Being a team-player with well-developed communication skills; With eye for the detail and paying attention to quality; Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; Can adapt easily to changes. Your Opportunity To Grow Being part of growing organization and working for top FMCG Clients; Working in multinational environment that ensures daily contact with English (15 languages are spoken in Warsaw office); Steep personal learning curve and extensive trainings starting from day one and buddy program; Variety of development paths. And On Top Of That Company culture encouraging open communication; Opportunities to volunteer in CSR projects; Brand-new, A-class building just next to the underground (Dworzec Gdański) and train station; Broad range of benefits: medical and life insurance, Multisport, welfare social found, additional holiday time, active sports communities. About NielsenIQ  Additional Information  NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.  NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

job_title: Analista Junior de Planejamento de Demanda | S&OP
desc: The Operational Planning Team provides Shopee Xpress with cost-optimal and flexible capacity solutions for our Sorting Centers & other operation sites, year-round and enabling the business to scale for seasonal peak demand increases.  Example:  Job Description: Consolidate all demand planning data & communications into a central role with a holistic view (short and mid-term) Unfold demand planning (mid-term) into actionable plans with SPX operational areas (including first mile, middle mile, sorting centers, and last mile), working closely with PPC teams and throughout SPX chain to monitor and ensure planned capacity Prepare peak season alignments and communications Be the owner of mid-term SPX volume plans (Demand guardian) and its continuous updates with Shopee, guiding SPX decisions on headcount hiring and capacity adjustments Work cross-functionally and build key relationships to ensure that decisions are made and actioned which will allow our operations to run as effectively as possible Help Shopee Xpress Planning team to identify opportunities to innovate and continuously improve organizational efficiency.  Requirements: Bachelor's degree from any major Fluent English Experience in logistics, supply chain, or retail. Planner role experience is a plus Experience with S&OP process and/or Forecast planning vs Capacity Excellent analytical skills, data-driven and detail-oriented Excellent written and verbal communication skills Fast learner with strong ownership Able to work in a fast-paced environment You should be comfortable with ambiguity and naturally curious Ability to work independently, with a high sense of accountability and organization

Direct message the job poster from Canopy Specialty Insurance Ben Tweedie Senior Insurance Analyst at Canopy Specialty Insurance Company Description  Canopy Specialty Insurance LLC is a best-in-class MGA that focuses on providing client and carrier partners solutions within the Commercial Property & Casualty insurance marketplaces.  Canopy is in the process of establishing a nationwide footprint through the hiring of underwriting teams and partnering with first class carrier and distribution partners.  Job Summary  Canopy is looking to hire an Junior Underwriter for its Professional Liability team. The Junior Underwriter will provide daily support to the Underwriters at Canopy’s Voorhees, New Jersey office, although partial remote working will also be available. The hire will gain first hand experience of the role of an underwriter with the plan for them to move into an associate underwriter position further down the line.  Job Description  Joining a fast-growing startup Managing General Agency (MGA), this position provides support to the Professional Liability team in underwriting and managing a book of business, assisting with processing new and renewal submissions, and training as a Professional Liability Underwriter. Responsibilities include reviewing applications, rating accounts into the underwriting system, processing binders and endorsements, servicing policies, reviewing historical loss information, and communicating with producers and carrier partners.  Responsibilities  Assist in the general underwriting process by collecting information and data from brokers. Work with underwriters and assist in underwriting, rating, pricing, and quoting of risks. Complete formal rating and documentation of bound business. Maintain renewal lists and follow up with producers for renewal information. Develop strong working relationships with producer offices. New, renewal, and endorsement processing including rating, binding, and policy issuance.  Qualifications and Criteria  Bachelor’s Degree, with a degree in Insurance and/or Risk Management preferred. 1-2 years insurance experience or a prior internship preferred. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with the ambition to quickly learn and develop. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong organizational and interpersonal skills, ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks, ability to meet established deadlines. Strong computer skills including proficiency in Microsoft Office (MS Excel, MS Word, MS Outlook). Excellent attention to detail. Team player and desire to grow and build relationships across the company.

Job Title - Data Co-ordinator / Junior Analyst Salary - £20,000 - £25,000 - Depending on experience Days of work - Monday-Friday Hours of work - 8.30-17.00 Location - Hybrid working – 3/2 rotating between Spalding and Home  Benefits: 25 days holiday + Bank Holidays Highly competitive rewards package including Group Pension Excellent career progression prospects across the Bakkavor group  Company Profile: We are the leading provider of fresh prepared food in the UK, with an international presence in the US and China. Our 19,000 employees operate from 43 locations, developing and producing innovative food for a wide variety of occasions and budgets. In the UK, we work with leading grocery retailers, focusing on their own label brands.  The Role: As a Data Coordinator / Junior Analyst, you will collect, consolidate and review data, to process monthly reports as required by the central Technical team. These reports include Food Safety, H&S, Environment and Responsible Sourcing internal reporting, and CFA Listeria reporting. You will work alongside the Data Analyst to provide timely, informative performance reporting, analysis and commentary that is focussed on highlighting and explaining trends, key areas of interest and opportunities - allowing issues to be identified and corrective action to be taken. In this busy and exciting role, you will assist with performance reporting and data analysis within the Central Technical & Finance FP&A team. Has the ability to manipulate and interrogate data and present information in a clear engaging way. The ability to communicate across the business to ensure effective timely reporting.   Accountabilities: >To ensure business data required for technical function reporting purposes in collected, consolidated, and reviewed on a weekly / monthly / quarterly / annual basis. >Co-ordinate to ensure all relevant inputs (site technical, H&S, Environmental, Responsible Sourcing, sales data etc) are collated, processed and reviewed with other functional stakeholders (central finance, procurement etc) to ensure consistent and timely reporting. >Maintain and improve the central SOP for data consolidation and reporting processes. Provide support for site stakeholders to improve source data accuracy / consistency. >True up reporting at month / quarter / year end to ensure robust verification of governance / performance reporting.  About you: You will have the ability to manipulate and interrogate data and present information in a clear and engaging way. The ability to communicate across the business to ensure effective timely reporting is key for this role.   Ideally you will have some exposure to a finance related role, with experience of data collection, reporting, analysis and use of office applications & business systems. If you are a keen and driven individual with excellent communication skills, a willingness to learn, strong attention to detail, computer literacy and the confidence to challenge behaviours at all levels - this could be the role for you.  What you can expect from us: When joining us you can expect a highly competitive rewards package including group pension, private medical insurance, and other flexible benefits - alongside excellent career progression prospects across the Bakkavor group.
Industries: Food and Beverage Manufacturing and Financial Services

desc: Direct message the job poster from Trialfacts Jess Kramer Finance & Admin Manager at Trialfacts Have Freedom Over When, Where & How You Work Rapid Growth in New and Existing Writing and Creative Skills Paid Holidays Whenever You Like Work with Awesome International Team Help Advance Medical Research  Hello— we’re Trialfacts, a remote entrepreneurial company, and without us, a lot of medical research would not be possible. We’re searching for a Copywriter to help our team solve our clients’ biggest problem. If you’re looking for a position where you can set your own hours, take holidays as you see fit, work remotely from home or anywhere in the world, and help medical research succeed, then please read on.  Today’s highly sophisticated medical system has added nearly 20 years of life expectancy, reduced infant mortality by 90% and maternal mortality by 99%. Polio, leprosy, smallpox, and tuberculosis are practically eradicated, even in the poorest countries in the world. More recently, medical researchers around the world have come together to create a variety of vaccines to combat Covid-19. There’s plenty of room for improvement, but a big part of what’s been achieved is due to new medications, medical devices, and understanding developed through clinical research.  Our clients – academic researchers and medical research organizations, are working hard to continue to develop treatments and devices, increase our understanding, eradicate sickness, and improve quality of life. Their biggest challenge is spending half of their time searching for and never being able to recruit enough of the patients required for their clinical trials.  Our company – Trialfacts, removes the biggest hurdle and frustration to conducting their research, by recruiting the patients and volunteers they require for their clinical trials, and many times thereby saving their research. We’re the only company in the industry to also do this in a predictable and reliable manner, by determining upfront exactly how many patients we can recruit, and backing that up with a money-back guarantee.  We're looking for someone who can:  Write — At Trialfacts, we recruit volunteers and patients for our clients’ studies through our website as well as social media channels like Facebook. To do that, we need eye-catching and informative web ads, video ads, landing pages, and social media ads for each study we recruit for. You’ll be responsible for creating the promotional material for each study. You’ll also write up the questions we will use in the online questionnaire to determine whether or not a patient or volunteer is eligible for a study. Describe — For each study, the client will provide us with official study documentation such as Protocols and Information Consent Forms. These documents explain what the study is about and what is required of the volunteer. However, they typically use a lot of medical jargon that is difficult for the layman to understand. It will be your job to read through these documents, absorb the important stuff, and use them to create informative, accessible, and appealing descriptions of the studies for the volunteers and patients. To keep our ads fresh and our audiences interested, we'll need you to think outside the box and come up with a variety of ways to tell the same message. Research — In order to write relatable, appealing copy that is received well, you'll spend time researching the audience - whether it be Type 2 Diabetics who want to lose weight or healthy volunteers or teenagers diagnosed with depression.   Collaborate — You will be working closely with the Recruitment Team to create the best possible promotional material. Specifically, Megan, our Recruitment Manager, will help guide and train you and Anass, our Paid Advertising Specialist, will work with you to test what copy is the most effective.  What’s in it for you:  Autonomy — We don’t have set working hours. We don’t have a leave application process (you can take paid holidays whenever you want). We don’t micromanage or babysit. You’ll be accountable to the rest of the team purely on your results and not on the number of hours spent working.  Our team is remote (we communicate via Slack, Basecamp and video conferencing software). We set our own hours based on what works for us and our clients. As long as you have a good internet connection, you can work from wherever in the world you choose.  Innovation — We’ve launched innovative patient recruitment strategies (e.g. our phone screening appointment system, researcher interviews, social media recruitment), and we’re constantly improving our service. We have developed a data-driven forecasting approach that provides predictability in a volatile industry. Our consistent, data-driven process has allowed us to be the first and only recruitment company to provide certainty to our clients via a money-back guarantee.  It’s our data-driven approach and continuous focus on innovative patient recruitment strategies that allows us to help our clients successfully reach their goals.  Impact — Trialfacts plays an extremely important role in contributing to medical research and driving humanity forward. Our clients—researchers working at universities, pharmaceutical companies, biotech companies, natural medicine companies, hospitals and medical practices—work hard to develop treatments and technology that cure diseases and improve quality of life.  Growth — As a member of a small team you'll be exposed to many areas of the business. You'll be given the opportunity to learn many new skills and experiment in many new areas, as well as progress and build on what you already know. We’ll encourage you to test out new creative ideas and expand your copywriting skills. You'll have access to courses and training programs of your choice, paid for by Trialfacts. Each quarter we’ll put in place a training plan to increase your skills, knowledge, experience, and responsibility.  Opportunity — As a small and innovative team we’ve done away with outdated corporate thinking like the physical office, micromanaging and bureaucratic leave processes, but we haven’t thrown the baby out with the bathwater. We offer a stable monthly salary. You will also be eligible for a quarterly team bonus and an annual salary review. You will have the opportunity to develop your career with the possibility to grow into positions of additional responsibility and/or leadership in the future. The future looks optimistic as we continue to improve and expand on our core service.  This position is for you if you:  Excel at written communication — from landing page and web ad copy to communicating with the team, being able to write well is a must for any Trialfacts position, but especially for yours. Being in a remote team, you must also be great at communicating and comfortable sharing your thoughts - whether it be in Slack or during a team meeting on Zoom. At times you will even use screenshare software (like Loom) to explain a concept or provide feedback. Are able to create compelling copy for promotional material — after synthesizing large amounts of information you need to be able to have a natural ability to be able to put yourself in the relevant person’s shoes to be able to create effective copy for web ads, video ads, landing pages, questionnaires and social media ads. You're excellent at summarizing the key points to communicate about a study. Are able to translate medical jargon into layman's terms— you're not intimidated by terms like 'stomach-emptying', anticoagulant, Borborygmi and Choledocholithiasis and are able to quickly explain them in simple language. Can write in American and Australian English — you're expected to know the difference and adapt your writing accordingly. Are highly organized — you'll be writing several promotional materials for various studies every week. If you're not highly organized and comfortable in a fast-paced environment, then you're not a good-fit for this role. Are flexible — in an entrepreneurial business we sometimes have to wear different hats. We're looking for someone who takes ownership and wants to help grow our company. If you're the kind of person who would rather sit back and say "that's not my responsibility" then please don't apply. Are tech savvy — you must be 100% comfortable with using online work tools like Slack, Basecamp, Pipedrive, Helpscout, Loom, Google Docs, and more. Love learning— we're a team that's driven by learning and improving. We're looking for someone who wants to learn and develop their professional skills, grow as a person, and constantly improve the service that we provide. Are results-driven— you will be coached and guided, but ultimately you will be responsible for your performance. Are looking for a full-time position— we’re experiencing growth and we need someone who can fully commit to Trialfacts and get up to speed quickly. We’re not looking for someone who has their own part-time business or freelancing career on the side.

Purpose of the Role: Delivery of data projects from client marketing databases  Responsibilities Technical ownership of client marketing databases Accountable for all assigned operational outputs and deliverables in a timely and accurate manner in accordance with agreed SLA’s Work on simple standardised development project tasks allocated by team leaders Responsible for internal communication on all assigned tasks and projects and escalation of potential issues or delays Follow more2 coding standards of SQL and keeping the scripts tidy at all times Responsible for developing and adhering to process and procedure Recommending enhancements to existing systems, process and new products delivering your findings to the team to ensure continuous improvement Have a good understanding of the functions of other teams and the impact it causes to them and the client during job delays Adherence to more2 policies and procedures  Requirements Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server and related technologies (including T-SQL programming) Able to interpret and run pre-defined processes/scripts Knowledge/understanding of relational database concepts Excellent Microsoft Excel skills A logical and methodical approach to work and problem solving Effective communicator with good written and verbal skills Highly organised with great attention to the detail Process and procedure oriented Team player Any additional experience in SSIS and SSRS is beneficial but not necessary  Behaviours A logical and methodical approach to work and problem solving Effective communicator with good written and verbal skills Highly organised with great attention to the detail Handle pressure situations with professionalism and persevere when faced with a difficult task Curious & Innovative Passionate & Driven Honest & Trustworthy Positive & Friendly A True Team Player  Why more2? We are the UK’s leading data analytics and marketing consultancy for multi-channel retailers. Combining a team of over 100 passionate data experts and marketeers, with best in class technology, we provide over 80 national and international retailers with invaluable insight, advice and actionable solutions to enable them to achieve and maintain profitable growth. Our teams span across data & innovation, strategy & insight, operational delivery and internal support.  Benefits - Annual Season Ticket Loan - Cycle to Work Scheme - Subsidised Gym Membership - Support for Professional Qualifications - Summer Day Out - Christmas Party - Loyalty Holiday - "Skint Nights" - social event once a month - Summer Working Hours - Enhanced Maternity Pay

Direct message the job poster from Edgard & Cooper Bieke De Waele Looking for a Husky that takes digging data seriously!  What type of breed are we looking for? 🐕 As a data analyst you will dig through piles of data and put it in a nice bowl to consume within the Data pack and beyond. The Data pack is developing solutions to improve the experience of our furry customers and make the best decisions for the business, one data point at a time. You will be responsible to enable data-driven decisions and innovations throughout Edgard and Cooper by cleaning and analyzing data to make great predictions. A data analyst has a good feeling of how the business works but mostly is very curious to get the most out of the information we have available through data manipulations and visualizations, setting up key metrics or interpreting data more deeply with machine learning. The data analyst also should be able to communicate the findings effectively and build good dashboards to support this.   What will be in your bowl? 🥗 You will do A/B testing evaluations and significance testing You will work on clustering and customer segmentation based on survey data and sales information You will develop tools to clean and interpret the data and use it for great applications You will experiment with new KPIs and figure out how we can make data-driven decisions To communicate your work, you will build dashboards   What skills & tricks should you bring? 🤹 You have a result-driven and hands-on mindset and prefer to work in an agile environment You have strong experience with SQL, python applied to data science and statistics Ideally you have a degree in a quantitative field such as (business) engineering or computer science It would be pawesome if you have previously work on BI applications You’ll thrive here even more if you have hands-on experience with A/B testing, building experiments You like to iterate quickly and try out new things!  Not sure if you tick all the boxes but our role truely excites you? Don’t let our job description hold you back, get applying!  Our benefits 🎁 💸 Competitive package inclusive of (include details): Meal vouchers Phone + laptop Ecocheques Hospitalization insurance 💰 Salary package that will reflect your built-up experience 🏋️‍♀️Gym access 🏔Company retreats to meet each other in person 👩‍💻 Flexibility to work from home 🐾 Pets at work so everyday is bring your pet to work day 🧆Unlimited Pet food for your furry friend whilst you are with us 🌟Volunteer Leave to contribute to a cause we believe in 🧠Wellbeing program access to qualified counselling 🏝️ 25 days paid holiday a year (including bank holidays & birthday holiday) 🍿 Team activities: appreciation days, wellbeing days, pawesome team buildings, Friday drinks, cat yoga and many more 🔋 Learning opportunities in a truly international environment that will give you extensive responsibility but also guidance as you need it.  Hiring Process 🕵️‍♀️ 📞 Phone screening (30mins) 🎯 Competency based interview (45mins) Ideal start date: What are your plans tomorrow?   Equal opportunities 🌈 We believe the strength of a pack comes from its diversity. So no matter who you are, where you come from, what you believe in or what your dreams are, we welcome you and look forward to receiving your application. Accessibility: Our HQ office and satellite sites are wheelchair accessible
Industries: Food and Beverage Services, Food and Beverage Manufacturing, and Manufacturing

location: Bergen op Zoom, North Brabant, Netherlands
desc: Direct message the job poster from Moore DRV Ayrton van der Reest Corporate Recruiter | Moore DRV | Werken in de echte economie | 📱06-29641255 📧 a.van.der.reest@drv.nl Ben jij data-minded en servicegericht? Wil jij Moore DRV een stap verder helpen door het geven van betere inzichten? Dan ben jij de kandidaat die wij zoeken voor de functie van junior data analist.  Jouw functie als junior data analist Als junior data analist ben je, in een team van drie collega's, medeverantwoordelijk voor het koppelen, organiseren en het ontsluiten van data, zodat collega’s hier effectief gebruik van kunnen maken. Je ondersteunt het team en collega’s bij het vertalen van nieuwe technologieën en digitale ontwikkelingen naar IT en data-oplossingen. Een greep uit jouw werkzaamheden:  Vertalen van vragen van de interne klant naar concrete data-analyses en visualisaties. Data extractie, transformatie en verwerking. Uitvoeren van advies- en ontwikkelopdrachten op het gebied van data-analyse. Laden van ruwe data en transformeren naar datamodellen. Ondersteunen van jouw directe collega's bij het uitvoeren van opdrachten.  Doordat er gewerkt wordt in een klein team biedt dit de mogelijkheid om je breed te ontwikkelen en zijn er korte lijnen met je collega’s.  Wat wij zoeken Als junior data analist beschik je over uitstekende communicatie- en sociale vaardigheden. Ook ben je klantgericht en ga je nauwkeurig en oplossingsgericht te werk. Daarnaast geldt:  Een (bijna) afgeronde bachelor en/of master opleiding. Ervaring met Qliksense en/of Power BI is een pre. Ervaring met SQL en SSIS is een pre. Ervaring met data-analyse en/of proces mining software. Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve en sociale vaardigheden. Je bent nauwkeurig, klantgericht en gaat oplossingsgericht te werk.  Werken bij de afdeling Finance & Control Moore DRV heeft verschillende vestigingen in Zuidwest-Nederland. Als onze nieuwe junior data analist in Bergen op Zoom werk je straks samen met 12 andere collega’s van de afdeling finance & control. In ons kantoor in Brabant wordt er niet alleen hard gewerkt, maar is er ook ruimte voor gezelligheid. Er worden geregeld gezellige personeelsactiviteiten georganiseerd, zoals een jaarlijkse barbecue en kerstdiner. Die laagdrempeligheid is ook kenmerkend voor onze afdeling. Wij zijn een open en professioneel team met veel verschillende specialisaties op het gebied van Finance & Control. Ga jij geen uitdaging uit de weg en kom je makkelijk met anderen in contact? Dan pas jij perfect in ons team én onze laagdrempelige organisatie!  Wat wij jou bieden als junior data analist  Een goed salaris Laptop en mobiele telefoon Pensioenregeling en bedrijfsfitnessregeling Onbeperkt aantal trainingen via de DRV Academie en deelname aan externe congressen Goede werk-privébalans Leuke uitjes met de personeelsvereniging  En niet onbelangrijk: je krijgt alle ruimte en ondersteuning om jezelf te ontwikkelen. Daarnaast houd je voldoende tijd over om te kunnen sporten en voor andere leuke dingen. Wil je je vakinhoudelijk of op persoonlijk vlak verder verdiepen? Dan regelen we de training die past bij je wensen. En wil je snel doorgroeien tot een hogere functie? Geef je ambities aan bij je mentor en stippel samen een route uit voor jouw verdere ontwikkeling.

Job Description  Position Description Junior DBA working in a team environment that will operate in all aspects of database design, security, and administration of SQL Server, including writing advanced SQL queries and stored procedures and working with SSIS to build and maintain ETL packages. Meet with business partners to understand requirements. Communicate with technical, applications and operational teams to ensure database integrity and security. Create design documents, develop and unit test code changes, and participate with users in UAT testing. Understand new and existing processes and come up with methods to resolve issues. Manage database access across various user groups (internal and external). Assist in Database Design and Development. Create and maintain SSIS packages to import / export data and automate processes. Participate in the creation of development, staging, and production database instances, and the migration from one environment to another. Recommend and implement emerging database technologies. Recommend optimizations to existing application queries. Assist in data security monitoring. Support production databases after hours as needed. Skills Required Strong communication and organizational skills. Ability to use problem-solving and analytical skills to take on challenging tasks. Desire and ability to learn and hone new skills. Able to work both independently and as part of a team. Skills Preferred Experience Required 1-3 years of SQL Server Database Administration focusing on: Relational database modeling and design. Installing SQL Server. Writing and analyzing complex queries in T-SQL. Troubleshooting and problem solving of performance and other issues related to locking and blocking. Routine database maintenance such as backups, reorgs, and database recovery. SQL Server security and encryption methods. Developing, maintaining, and deploying SSIS packages. Developing T-SQL stored procedures, functions, views and triggers. Working in a VSTS (Azure DevOps) and Agile environment. Experience Preferred Education Required Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field; Or equivalent work experience. Education Preferred Additional Information -Candidate will work onsite, full time. No remote work will be considered -In person interviews are preferred however will video interview for non-local -Ideally prefer for this position to convert to a merit position eventually, but we are being more flexible on this position to help us find a good candidate. Position would convert from contract at around $60K annually -Budgeted for 6 months with the goal of the candidate getting on the register within this timeframe. If it takes longer, contract would be extended. Job #: 22-08187

Cooder zoekt voor OneDNA een Junior Data Engineer in Utrecht voor €2500 - €4000 bruto per maand!  De vacature  Wij zijn op zoek naar junior Data Engineers die ervaring hebben met of ambitie hebben om (cloud gebaseerde) data driven oplossingen te gaan realiseren. Heb je een passie voor data en 1 of 2 jaar ervaring opgedaan met data oplossingen dan is het OneTalent opleidingstraject van OneDNA een mooie stap. Als (toekomstig) Data Engineer leer je processen te overzien en deze te vertalen naar oplossingen binnen (cloud) data platformen. Je werkt in teams om technische oplossingen te realiseren. Je vindt het leuk om nieuwe technologieën te ontdekken, verder te verkennen en deze te delen met je collega’s en opdrachtgevers.Wil je een carrière als Data Engineer en veel leren van ervaren collega's, dan is het OneTalent Data Engineer track een mooie stap!  Wat zijn je belangrijkste taken? Passie voor data en het vakgebeid data enginering ontdekken Realiseren van data pipelines Ontwerpen & ontwikkelen van data platformen (cloud georiënteerd) Kennisdeling binnen het (klant)team en je eigen OneDNA collega's Focus op je eigen ontwikkeling  Functie eisen Afgeronde HBO of WO opleiding Analytisch en pragmatisch Passie voor werken met data en hierin enige ervaring opgedaan De AZ-900, DP-900 of DP-203 certificeringen zijn onderdeel van het trainingsprogramma Initiële kennis van SQL en/of Python Kennis van data modellering en data logistiek is een pré Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, zowel in woord als geschrift.  Wat krijg je? €2500 - €4000 bruto per maand Teambonus Flexibele werktijden Volledige reiskostenvergoeding Tankpas Mobiel Laptop Pensioen Netto onkostenvergoeding Training Opleidingsbudget  Over OneDNA:  Wij zijn een club professionals die werken met passie voor het vak en voor onze klanten. Onze uitgangspunten zijn eigentijds: Flexibiliteit ten aanzien van het aantal uren Maximale aansluiting bij de klantbehoefte Waar mogelijk werken we thuis en beperken we de reistijden Wij maken indien nodig gebruik van flexibele kantoorruimtes verdeeld over heel het land. Onder andere in de regio Amsterdam, Apeldoorn, Utrecht, Den Bosch, Den Haag, Groningen en Rotterdam.  Heb je niet alleen passie voor het Data & Analytics vakgebied, maar wil je ook als consultant excelleren bij toonaangevende klanten? Dan bezit jij ons DNA!  Wij zijn OneDNA… welkom bij de club Opgericht in 2020 De gemiddelde leeftijd is 35. Werkzaam in 1 kantoor.

In EY diventi protagonista delle trasformazioni  In EY Consulting non troverai soltanto un lavoro, ma un’esperienza formativa che ti porterà ad essere il Trasformation Leader che stiamo cercando. Vogliamo essere la scintilla che fa avverare le tue ispirazioni e rende possibile il tuo successo. Per questi motivi ti offriamo tutte le risorse, le competenze tecniche specifiche e le community tematiche per sviluppare i tuoi interessi e le tue ambizioni.  Cerchiamo persone in grado di guidare trasformazioni complesse attraverso tecnologia, human e innovation, e capaci di coniugare conoscenze tecnologiche e visione del futuro.  Perché dovresti scegliere EY Consulting?  Perché qui puoi unire la tua passione per codici, dati e la tua creatività alla curiosità per la strategia di business e lo sviluppo di soluzioni d'avanguardia.  Da subito entrerai a far parte di team e settori diversificati, partecipando attivamente ai processi di trasformazione e di innovazione di aziende, società e Pubbliche Amministrazioni per creare un impatto sul Paese.  Costruirai la carriera che desideri grazie a percorsi di formazione su hard e soft skill, community e hub tecnologici, dove potrai quotidianamente provare, sperimentare e crescere.  The Exceptional EY Experience, It’s Yours To Build.  Opportunità professionale:  Siamo alla ricerca di Junior Consultant per il nostro team Technology Consulting su tutta Italia che vogliano cominciare al massimo la loro carriera con uno stage in EY e imparare a diventare esperte ed esperti di trasformazione.  Gli ambiti in cui potresti lavorare sono tantissimi: Il team Technology Consulting guida il cambiamento tecnologico e digitale per migliorare quello che ci circonda e costruire un Better Working World, grazie alle competenze di Cyber Security, Data & Analytics, Blockchain, Technology Transformation, Technology Solution Delivery e in partnership con i principali vendor tecnologici del mercato.  Quali competenze cerchiamo? Laurea in: Ingegneria, Fisica, Matematica, Statistica, Informatica ed Economia Capacità di operare in autonomia e in team Conoscenze informatiche dei principali applicativi Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point) Visione del futuro, pensiero laterale, giudizio, empatia, ingegno, adattabilità e creatività.  Cosa chiediamo:  Una forte voglia di cambiare il mondo, per il meglio. In EY diamo luogo ad una trasformazione, mettendo il nostro purpose - Building a better working world - al centro di tutto ciò che facciamo, e siamo convinti di poter contribuire alla trasformazione del Paese con una forte e precisa idea di futuro e di innovazione.  Cosa offriamo: Ambiente di lavoro internazionale, all’interno di team diversi e multidisciplinari. Percorsi di formazione continua per valorizzare il tuo talento. Hub tecnologici avanzati in cui sperimentare la trasformazione Supporto di un Counselor, quale guida nella scelta delle esperienze più adatte alle tue ambizioni. Benefit e programmi di welfare aziendale. Tutti gli strumenti necessari per avere una carriera orientata alla crescita, alla sperimentazione e alla tecnologia più avanzata  Apri la tua carriera a nuovi scenari di crescita ed entra a far parte del team di EY Consulting.

Work for an iconic organisation Permanent full time position Take the next step in your career in IT database administration  The Melbourne Cricket Club (MCC) has the public responsibility for managing one of the largest and the most successful stadiums in Australia and the world – the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). The MCG is more than just a stadium, it’s an Australian icon and a meeting place for generations past, present and future. The MCG is host to more than 70 major events and attracts over three million visitors annually.   Our purpose is to move Australia through the transformative power of live sport, entertainment and culture. Our values underpin how we operate and what we stand for as an organisation. This includes respecting the past whilst we shape the future; striving for excellence; lending a hand to others & and playing with pride, passion and purpose.  A great permanent opportunity has arisen for a Junior Database Administrator in the Applications IT team of the IT & Innovation department. Reporting to the Data Lead - IT & Innovation. The main focus in this role is that you will be supporting the Data Lead – IT & Innovation in managing MCC’s core databases and applications.  The main responsibilities of this role are: Install, configure and support databases and web based software Software implementation and upgrades, including testing, deployment and maintenance Software customisation and configuration Software documentation and process documentation Assist with software control and update procedures Fault isolation and troubleshooting Providing backup 1st Level support for a number of Business applications Problem solving of a highly complex and technical nature Deliver a high-level of customer satisfaction with attention to detail installing software packages, writing user manuals for customers as needed and refining installation procedures to increase efficiency.   To be successful in this role the core requirements & experience you will need to have is:  Experience in Microsoft SQL server database administration, minimum 1 year industry experience Recognised tertiary qualifications in computing or other relevant discipline or relevant experience Knowledge of relational database structures Sound verbal and written communication skills Commitment to providing high quality customer service   Other experience that would be beneficial:  Azure Data Services / Streaming services Experience with ETL processes Experience in providing first to third level support for end users in the effective and efficient use of software applications Ability to assist customers with problem solving and to provide support to customers of varying skill levels Demonstrated evidence in designing and delivering relevant training documentations / user guides etc Experience in Power BI   For a more detailed description of the role please click on the attached position description on the ad by clicking the 'Apply' button on this page.   Please note given the nature of this role, flexibility is a requirement as it includes working a number of event days, after business hours, weekends and public holidays each year.   If you would like to work for an iconic organisation, take the next step in your IT career and have the skills and experience outlined above, we would love to hear. You can do this by submitting your application including a cover letter, a current CV and complete the online questionnaire via the ‘Apply’ tab on this page.   Applications close Tuesday 26 April 2022. This ad maybe withdrawn prior to the closing date depending upon the volume of applications received.  ***Please note, agency submissions will not be considered for this position***  At the MCC we are committed to ensuring our team is inclusive and representative of the communities we live in. We encourage applications from suitably qualified and diverse candidates.  To ensure the safety and wellbeing of our staff and patrons, successful candidates will be subject to the COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination (Workers) Directions & required to be vaccinated in line with these Directions. If you have a relevant medical exemption, we will discuss your personal circumstances with you.  This role is subject to relevant pre-employment checks including National & International police checks, right to work in Australia & Victorian Working with Children checks.
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Spectator Sports

job_title: Analista de Segurança da Informação Junior - Cloud Security
desc: JOB DESCRIPTION  O PicPay é uma plataforma de pagamento criada para quebrar barreiras e eliminar burocracias. Nós existimos para melhorar a vida das pessoas e só conseguimos fazer isso porque temos pessoas fantásticas aqui dentro.  O que você vai fazer por aqui? Buscamos pessoas que sejam apaixonadas por construir aplicações distribuídas e de alta performance, escaláveis para milhões de novos usuários em todo o mundo e que suportem a melhor experiência de pagamentos.  Manda bem nos requisitos abaixo? Então essa vaga é pra você! :)  MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES  O analista será responsável por aplicar as diretrizes de segurança na nuvem através de políticas, para proteger os dados, aplicativos e serviços de infraestrutura do ambiente Cloud AWS.  Também apoiará a equipe na gestão contra ameaças e vulnerabilidades externas e internas relacionadas à segurança cibernética.  Conhecimento de soluções de segurança em "Cloud Pública AWS".  Políticas de Cloud Security - AWS Well-Architected Framework (Pilar de Segurança)  Data Securtiy and Compliance  Indentity and Access Management na Cloud  Tecnologias de Federação (IdP)  Privileged Access Management  Conhecimentos em IaC (Infrastructure as Code).  REQUIREMENTS AND SKILLS  +1 ano de experiência "Cloud Pública AWS e Segurança da Informação"  Diferencial: Conhecimentos em Web Application Firewall  Additional information  NOSSA MISSÃO É DEIXAR A VIDA DAS PESSOAS MAIS FÁCIL TODOS OS DIAS, E VOCÊ PODE FAZER PARTE DISSO! 🚀  Fundado em Vitória (ES) em 2012, o PicPay é uma empresa de tecnologia que nasceu para tornar a vida financeira mais fácil ao reinventar a forma como as pessoas lidam com dinheiro, fazem compras e se comunicam. Em 2015, a empresa foi investida pelo grupo J&F, um dos maiores conglomerados empresariais do Brasil.  Atualmente, como o super app brasileiro com maior número de usuários — 60 milhões —, o PicPay busca oferecer produtos e serviços para todos os momentos do dia a dia dos clientes, combinando os benefícios de cinco frentes em uma única plataforma: social, carteira digital, marketplace financeiro, PicPay Store e anúncios.  Nossa cultura é nosso filtro!  Nossos valores, são nossos guias para tomada de decisões. São eles: Atitude de Dono, Disciplina, Determinação, Disponibilidade, Simplicidade, Humildade e Franqueza.  Nossas crenças!  Somos uma equipe diversa conectada pelos mesmos valores, e para cumprirmos essa missão, acreditamos que a diversidade é fundamental nessa jornada. O respeito, a ética, a busca pela equidade e a valorização da pluralidade são elementos inegociáveis e fazem parte da prática do nosso dia a dia aqui no PicPay.  Nossos grupos de afinidades como o Afro (pessoas pretas), Inclui (pessoas com deficiência), Pride (LGBTQIA+) e Elas Que Lutem Juntas (mulheres), desenvolvem projetos e treinamentos recorrentes, além de ações estruturantes para que nosso ambiente tenha mais segurança e inclusão.  Por isso, nossas vagas estão abertas para todas as pessoas, independente de gênero, religião, etnia, deficiência, idade, orientação sexual ou qualquer outro fator.  E o mais importante! Nossa equipe é apaixonada pelo que faz, por isso somos PicPay Lovers. Vem fazer parte dessa jornada! 💚  Benefícios para os PicPay Lovers:  Saúde e Bem-estar: Além de Assistência Médica e Odontológica, oferecemos Seguro de Vida e o PicPay Acolhe, um programa que cuida de você e seus familiares, com apoio jurídico, social, psicológico e financeiro. E claro, não podemos esquecer da nossa parceria com a Gympass.  Somos flexíveis: Por meio de um cartão de crédito, bandeira Visa, você recebe seu saldo de Alimentação ou Refeição e Mobilidade, com a opção de escolher o melhor uso do seu saldo.  Estamos crescendo: Nosso modelo de trabalho é híbrido, ou seja, permite aos PicPay Lovers que atuem de forma presencial e remota.  Licença Paternidade e Maternidade: Sabemos que esse é um momento especial para uma família, e por isso oferecemos Licença Maternidade estendida de 6 meses, e de Paternidade também estendida de 20 dias.  Reconhecemos resultados: PPR - Participação nos Resultados do PicPay.  Nossa missão é deixar a vida das pessoas mais fácil todos os dias, e você pode fazer parte disso! 🚀  Fundado em Vitória (ES) em 2012, o PicPay é uma empresa de tecnologia que nasceu para tornar a vida financeira mais fácil ao reinventar a forma como as pessoas lidam com dinheiro, fazem compras e se comunicam. Em 2015, a empresa foi investida pelo grupo J&F, um dos maiores conglomerados empresariais do Brasil.  Atualmente, como o super app brasileiro com maior número de usuários — 60 milhões —, o PicPay busca oferecer produtos e serviços para todos os momentos do dia a dia dos clientes, combinando os benefícios de cinco frentes em uma única plataforma: social, carteira digital, marketplace financeiro, PicPay Store e anúncios.  Nossa cultura é nosso filtro!  Nossos valores, são nossos guias para tomada de decisões. São eles: Atitude de Dono, Disciplina, Determinação, Disponibilidade, Simplicidade, Humildade e Franqueza. Company Description  We are the leading global information services company, providing data and analytical tools to our clients around the world. We help businesses to manage credit risk, prevent fraud, target marketing offers and automate decision making.  We also help people to check their credit report and credit score, and protect against identity theft. In 2019, for the fifth consecutive year, Experian has been named to Forbes Magazine’s Top 100 list of the “World’s Most Innovative Companies.”  We employ approximately 17,000 people in 44 countries and our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland, with operational headquarters in Nottingham, UK; California, US; and São Paulo, Brazil.  At Experian, we are committed to building an inclusive culture and to creating an environment where people can balance successful careers with their commitments and interests outside of work. Our flexible working practices support our belief that this balance brings long-lasting benefits for our business as well as our people. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, and if this is important to you, we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.  Job Description  Contribute to the delivery of month/year end close activities by: Ensuring financial data is complete, accurate and all transactions are consistent with Experian’s accounting policies and IFRS Ensuring consistent financial data quality Owning selected balance sheet accounts and providing detailed, complete and informative balance sheet reconciliations/analysis Working closely and effectively with Experian’s Shared Service Centre Ad-hoc tasks and projects to support manager, team and business Ensure compliance with all regulatory and statutory requirements in the local market Analysis of transactional data to understand the key performance drivers of the businesses and translation of these trends into a tangible future impact on the business Qualifications Desire and ambition to work in Finance Good analytical and problem solving skills Good written and spoken English Strong stakeholder management skill Highly logical, numerate individual with an unfaltering attention to detail Technical accounting skills and proficiency with Excel Good understanding of financial management information Experience of general financial accounting in a multi-national business environment in accordance with IFRS Familiar with Shared Service Center or Offshoring environment University degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting or relevant numerate science Additional Information Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized strong team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time Social benefit package - life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, corporate discounts, Multisport card, and a Share options scheme Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation and 3 additional paid days for participation in Social responsibility events Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together  Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Position Description Junior DBA working in a team environment that will operate in all aspects of database design, security, and administration of SQL Server, including writing advanced SQL queries and stored procedures and working with SSIS to build and maintain ETL packages. • Meet with business partners to understand requirements. • Communicate with technical, applications and operational teams to ensure database integrity and security. • Create design documents, develop and unit test code changes, and participate with users in UAT testing. • Understand new and existing processes and come up with methods to resolve issues. • Manage database access across various user groups (internal and external). • Assist in Database Design and Development. • Create and maintain SSIS packages to import / export data and automate processes. • Participate in the creation of development, staging, and production database instances, and the migration from one environment to another. • Recommend and implement emerging database technologies. • Recommend optimizations to existing application queries. • Assist in data security monitoring. • Support production databases after hours as needed. Skills Required • Strong communication and organizational skills. • Ability to use problem-solving and analytical skills to take on challenging tasks. • Desire and ability to learn and hone new skills. • Able to work both independently and as part of a team. Skills Preferred Experience Required 1-3 years of SQL Server Database Administration focusing on: • Relational database modeling and design. • Installing SQL Server. • Writing and analyzing complex queries in T-SQL. • Troubleshooting and problem solving of performance and other issues related to locking and blocking. • Routine database maintenance such as backups, reorgs, and database recovery. • SQL Server security and encryption methods. • Developing, maintaining, and deploying SSIS packages. • Developing T-SQL stored procedures, functions, views and triggers. • Working in a VSTS (Azure DevOps) and Agile environment. Experience Preferred Education Required Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field; Or equivalent work experience. Education Preferred Additional Information -Candidate will work onsite, full time. No remote work will be considered -In person interviews are preferred however will video interview for non-local -Ideally prefer for this position to convert to a merit position eventually, but we are being more flexible on this position to help us find a good candidate. Position would convert from contract at around $60K annually -Budgeted for 6 months with the goal of the candidate getting on the register within this timeframe. If it takes longer, contract would be extended.

About Tesla And Tesla Energy’s Mission  In 2016 Elon released: The Master Plan, Part Deux. In this plan he highlighted the need to Integrate Energy Generation and Storage by creating stunning solar roofs with seamlessly integrated battery storage. Tesla Energy’s Installation team is in the operations arm of the business. The team installs high-quality energy products (Solar Roof, Retrofit Solar, Powerwall) across the United States. To achieve this, we use a combination of direct labor and sub-contractors and partner with certified installers and new home builders.  About Tesla Energy Quality  The Quality Department's core purposes are to ensure that the services we provide and the products we install meet the design intent so that people will love them and to reduce organizational spend by identifying and reducing inefficiencies caused by operations errors and product defects. We react to issues by containing, identifying root cause, and determining corrective actions to prevent recurrence while proactively identifying and mitigating risks to improve capability and capacity of operations through new methods, tools, or material.  Tesla Energy’s Installation Quality department supports the installation of residential energy products through the continual improvement of process and product quality and the systems that surround them. A successful candidate for this team must be a problem-solver at their core, have a strong quality and customer-focused mindset, and have the personal drive and stamina for relentless, continual improvement, both personally and professionally.  About Quality Data Science  The Quality Data Science team supports all branches of the quality organization (Install Quality, Business Quality and Quality Systems). The team supports everything from analytics requests, metric development, root cause analysis, predictive analytics, quality control testing and development and much more. Embedded within the Quality organization the Data Science team operates as a support mechanism to effectively solve problems and prevent quality issues from reoccurring.  Responsibilities Analyze installation, performance, and customer data to extract useful statistics and insights related to quality in order to drive meaningful improvements to our processes and customer experience Develop queries using SQL to aggregate and process data across multiple data sources Create ETL jobs to calculate key performance indicators Create high visibility dashboards to tell data stories and provide metrics about installation quality nationwide Work effectively with engineers, project managers, and technicians to conduct end-to-end analyses Interpret data, analyze results, and provide ongoing reports Monitor key product metrics, understanding root causes of changes in metrics Maintain existing data visualizations and develop enhancements as needed Drive underlying data systems improvement by working with key cross-functional stakeholders Perform data quality validations to ensure data creation is as per the business needs and expectations Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Essential Skills - Job Specific Expert in writing SQL and familiar with multiple data architecture paradigms (Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, Vertica, Presto, etc.) Strong knowledge of and experience with data visualization software (Tableau, PowerBI, etc.) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical tools/packages for analyzing datasets Technical expertise regarding data models, database design, and data mining techniques. Experience with Python, especially in a data analytics/science capacity where pandas/numpy are used heavily Exposure to "big data" technologies, particularly any part of a Spark, HBASE, Hadoop stack Strong analytical skills with ability to combine and find patterns across multiple datasets Strong attention to details and data accuracy Essential Skills - General Raises the Bar - We need top performers who raise the bar in our organization. When we hire new candidates, they should already be better than most employees in that role. We will often need to do this by being scrappy and challenging the status quo. Bias for Action - must have bias for action and be able to convert thought into execution quickly. People Centric - value people and their time. Demonstrate empathy and respect. Adaptive - Adapts to change, even when they may not be in favor of it. Someone who is collaborative and willing to take on new assignments and roles to benefit the business. Develops Others - Serves as a multiplier. Makes others around them better by helping them highlight their strengths and work on their weaknesses. Can serve as a mentor to more junior leaders and employees and develop them for roles of greater responsibility. Innovates - Find creative ways to simplify and look at our operation through a new lens. Not caught up on old ways of doing things. Has the ability to adapt and creatively work through problems and solutions that may not be their own. Thinks like an Owner - Willing to take risks, own outcomes, and learn from them. Humble and prioritizes the needs of the business over their own. Reasons from First Principles - Able to identify root causes and use data to drive decisions and change. Resourceful - Practices frugality. Is a scrappy leader who can do more with less. Curious - Seek to understand and show empathy. Have an insatiable thirst for learning and knowledge. Education/Experience BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, Engineering or related field. 3+ years working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst.
Industries: Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing, Motor Vehicle Manufacturing, and Utilities

job_title: Material Master Data Analyst (junior), Den Haag
desc: Our client is a dynamic, international organization in the region of The Hague and a leader in their branch. They are passionate about delivering the high-quality services to our (internal & external) customers. The team Supply Chain/Material Management is responsible to maintain the high standard of the core data that is essential to operations and helps other stakeholders to perform their tasks efficiently.  Therefore they are currently looking for a Material Master Data Analyst who can work full time/ 40 hours a week. After a short induction period, you can work remotely or in the office in The Hague if required. Please only respond when you master the English language at a good level. This is a temporary position for 6 months and the two interviews will be held online. Passionate about the data? Willing to help others to understand the data? Able to learn and adapt? Excited to face new challenges? Are you the Material Master Data Analyst we are looking for?! If so, please send your resume as soon as possible to guido.harsveld@x-­equo.nl  It is also advisable to follow me, Guido Harsveld, on LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/guido-harsveld-0132bb/), because I always publish new vacancies on my profile.  We also have a group on LinkedIn: X-EQUO Finance & Credit Management Jobs ( https://www.linkedin.com/groups/3899694) for all our new vacancies.  As a Material Master Data Analyst We Offer You a nice job within a close team; a workplace at a innovative, stable company that has been around for decades and is the specialist in their field; 25 leave days per year (at a full time employment); 8,33% holiday payment; commuting allowance (public transportation or € 0,19 per kilometer); StiPP Pension; courses, training opportunities, etcetera. This Material Master Data Analyst is responsible for, but not limited to, the following: Ensures material master data integrity in key systems (SAP & MSD 365) and to deliver high quality data; Assists with identifying and resolving discrepancies through appropriate choice of error detection & correction, process improvement and process control; Ensures the quality of material master data by working together with different internal stakeholders such as demand & planning team, product team, compliance team, finance team etcetera; Takes initiatives to improve the processes & work together with ERP team to test, validate & implement the solution(s); Analyzes & provides reports to both, internal stakeholders & external stakeholders. As a Material Master Data Analyst you will meet the following requirements:  Skills/Competencies Detail oriented: ability to analyze the details in data, interpret & skeptically evaluates it; Critical thinking: ability to discover certain pattern or issues in the data and to resolve them; Self-motivated: happy to take initiatives & able to set priorities to accomplish the tasks in timely manner; Communication skills: strong communication skills to participate effectively with other stakeholders. Preferred Education & Experience (a combination of education and experience is also possible) Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration or similar field; Minimum 1 year of experience in the field of Master Data Management. Preferred Qualifications Basic knowledge of any ERP software (SAP, Oracle etc.); Basic knowledge of any CRM Platform (Microsoft Dynamics 365, SalesForce etc.); Proficiency in Microsoft office suite specifically Excel is a must; Excellent written and verbal command of the English language. Getagged als: analyze, data, internal stakeholders, material management, process improvement, SAP, supply chain  5cd8a0b9cc68f9ffa4c9253553278a55wer
