desc: Role: Junior SQL DBA (Production)  Skills: SQL Server 2017 / SQL Server 2019 / Production DBA tasks  Salary: up to £32,000  Work Pattern - Remote - no time in office needed but meeting with the Senior DBA is helpful, greater Manchester area is ideal.  The Company  OSCAR are looking for a junior database administrator to join one of our favourite clients who are based in Greater Manchester, but the role can be almost completely remote. This is a traditional production SQL DBA position, and we are looking for someone who has some experience in the field but it certainly doesn't need to be much.  You will be working with a Senior DBA and have a great learning opportunity, but they are looking for you to come in and contribute immediately, you will get plenty of guidance but also plenty of visibility in the position  The role.  The company have a huge data lake and the team are responsible for delivering the right information to the right people at the right time, within a large organisation.  The position in a traditional production DBA role, looking after BAU performance of the database. The role may touch on SSRS / PowerBI but this is certainly not a requirement in any way.  We are looking for someone who is also happy to challenge what the developers say and think "is there a way we could do this better".  There is no-call rota for this position.  Responsibilities. Monitoring, updating and amending existing databases Creating and testing new database and data handling systems Assessing the quality of all production database releases ensuring company standards are followed. Installing, configuring and upgrading SQL Server across different environments. Responding to and resolving ad hoc requests as required to meet business and end user requirements. Monitoring, reporting on and maintaining the reporting activity and trends on the database servers and databases to senior management to enable a capacity planning strategy to be employed. Skills Required. Experience as a SQL DBA, ideally 1-2 years - something around there would be perfect. Benefits 33 days annual leave (including bank holidays) in addition to an annual leave purchase & sale scheme Pension Scheme & Life Assurance Discounts on their products and services. 1 day each year to volunteer for a charity of your choice Cycle to work purchase scheme Access to Perks at Work discount website Next Steps  If you a SQL DBA and you are looking to progress with an organisation that has a fantastic approach to work in a supportive and creative environment, then look no further - this is the role for you!  Interviews for this role will be held imminently. To be considered, please send your CV to me now to avoid disappointment.  Referrals  If this role isn't right for you, do you know someone that might be interested? You could earn £1,000 of retail vouchers if you refer a successful candidate to Oscar. Email: to recommend someone for this role.  Role: Junior SQL DBA (Production)  Skills: SQL Server 2017 / SQL Server 2019 / Production DBA tasks  Salary: up to £32,000  Work Pattern - Remote - no time in office needed but meeting with the Senior DBA is helpful, greater Manchester area is ideal.  Oscar Technology is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.  To understand more about what we do with your data please review our privacy policy in the privacy section of the Oscar website.

Combitech i Malmö, Helsingborg, Växjö, Jönköping och Linköping växer och vi är ett glatt team med olika kompetenser som nu vill bli fler. Vi har en stor inhouse-verksamhet där vi samverkar med andra kontor inom olika kompetensområden, så du kommer ha möjlighet att både sitta ute hos våra kunder men också att jobba med arbetspaket från våra kunder in-house.  På våra kontor finns både systemutvecklare, teamlead, projektledare, BI & AI experter. I teamet hjälper vi och stöttar varandra att nå våra mål. Det är en öppen och trevlig atmosfär på kontoret, och vi jobbar mycket med kunskapsutbyte, och att du som konsult ska kunna utveckla dig och lära dig det du är intresserad av.  Din roll som Data Scientist  Som data scientist utvecklar, förfinar och tränar du analysmodeller med olika tekniker. Det kan handla om statistiska och matematiska modeller, men också om maskininlärning och deep learning. Projekten handlar om allt från att bygga framtidens smarta industrier till att skapa ett hållbarare samhälle.  Du kommer att jobba i team med mer erfarna kollegor inom Data Engineering Data Science Data Analysis BI/AI Du har en teknisk utbildning inom Matematik, Matematisk statistik eller motsvarande och intresse av rollerna listade ovan. Du har också erfarenhet av programmering i t.ex. Mathlab, Python/Pandas eller liknande. Du är intresserad och driven, och kan behärska både svenska och engelska.  Rollerna ovan kan innebära arbete som omfattas av försvarssekretess. Därför krävs att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning gjord av myndighet.  Vi söker just nu juniora Data Scientist på flera orter i landet och avser att kombinera dina första två år på Combitech med det etablerade utvecklingsprogrammet ”Combitech Talent Program” och vi vet då att du får två givande år som du har med dig hela ditt yrkesverksamma liv.  Combitech Talent Program  Combitech Talent Program är utformat för att snabba på din resa från talang till erfaren konsult. Programmet anpassas till ditt kunduppdrag och innehåller flera delar från vårt kompetensutvecklingskoncept Combitech Grow. Steg för steg breddar du din kompetens och lär dig att lära av andras erfarenheter.  Programmet avslutas med examination i samarbete med KTH.  Programmet pågår parallellt med dina ordinarie konsultuppdrag under drygt två år och innehåller fyra olika spår: Fördjupad teknisk vidareutbildning Affärsmannaskap och ledarskap Utveckling i att se kundnyttan, presentera och argumentera för din sak och samarbeta Erfarenhetsutveckling. Vi lär oss själva förstå och sätta ord på erfarenheter, så att de kan spridas och användas av dina kollegor Låter det intressant? Hör av dig till oss eller skicka in din ansökan på direkten. Urvalet sker löpande. Välkommen till Combitech!  Kom och gör skillnad  Hos Combitech erbjuder vi, utöver spännande och utvecklande kunduppdrag, anställningstrygghet och förmånspaket, samtidigt som du får chans att växa i en företagskultur som uppmuntrar både personlig och professionell utveckling samt balans i livet.  Combitech GROW, vårt forskningsbaserade kompetensutvecklingsprogram, ingår som en naturlig del i din anställning. Att vi dessutom är ett stabilt växande och oberoende teknikkonsultbolag inom försvars- och säkerhetskoncernen Saab AB bidrar såklart också till dina utvecklingsmöjligheter.  Hos oss är du med och utvecklar teknikområdet för att möta kraven från framtidens digitala samhälle. Vi har exempelvis många spännande projekt inom digitalisering, autonomi, artificiell intelligens, cyber security och 5G-utveckling. Våra konsulter utvecklar också bland annat flygande hjärtstartare som räddar liv, system som ökar säkerheten på flygplatser och nya stridsflygplanet Gripen E som gör samhällen trygga.  Vill du veta mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss? Kolla in våra karriärsidor på vår webb!

Détail de l'offre  Informations générales  Entité de rattachement Nous sommes une ESN agile et un groupe international. A l'ère de la post-transformation digitale, nous mettons tout en œuvre pour que chacun de nos 27 000 collaborateurs puisse se renouveler perpétuellement, en vivant positivement son propre flow digital. Chacun d'entre eux peut ainsi façonner son parcours de carrière selon ses appétences, entreprendre de manière pragmatique avec ses clients pour un monde plus positif, innover localement dans 26 pays et harmoniser son investissement professionnel et son bien-être personnel.  Rejoignez Inetum. Vivez votre flow digital positif.  Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.  Description du poste Métier  Métier BS (Business Solutions) - Technique  Intitulé du poste  Ingénieur Data Junior  Contrat  CDI  Description De La Mission  Au sein de notre Business Unit Industrie 4.0, nous réalisons des projets d’intégration logicielle et de développement pour des clients industriels et télécom, dans les domaines IIoT, Big data, Cloud, SIG, réseau / sécurité...  Fort de la confiance de nos clients, nous renforçons notre équipe Data et nous recrutons un/une Ingénieur Data junior  Pour le compte d’un acteur aéronautique leader sur son marché, vous avez la charge de Développer des outils de traitements de données data visualisation, data wrangling, statistiques, machine learning Elaborer des modèles de prédictions afin d'anticiper les évolutions des données et des tendances Analyser des gros volumes de données de type, rédiger les rapports d’analyse Créer des tableaux de bord Assurer une veille technologique régulière sur les enjeux de collecte de données, et les évolution des plateformes de traitement. Profil  De formation Bac+5, vous avez une première expérience en data science, impérativement dans le secteur industriel. La connaissance des techniques de data mining & machine learning, des langages python / R / java et de Spark / Hadoop vous sera demandé dans l’exercice de votre fonction.  Votre esprit d’analyse et de synthèse ainsi de d’excellentes capacités rédactionnelles et d’élocution seront vos principaux atouts pour travailler en front chez notre client exigeant.  Vous avez une bonne capacité d’écoute et savez conceptualiser.  Autonome et impliqué, vous prenez volontiers des initiatives.  Cette mission nécessite une habilitation.  Au-delà de cette mission nous recrutons des profils juniors souhaitant grandir dans une structure à taille humaine.  Localisation du poste Localisation du poste  France, Sud-Ouest, 31 Haute-Garonne  Ville  Toulouse  Critères candidat Niveau d'études min. requis  Bac+5  Niveau d'expérience min. requis  Moins de 2 ans  Langues  Anglais (Professionnel)

Direct message the job poster from Ukuzimanya Guy Hendricks (LION) Owner at Ukuzimanya Junior BI Developer  Introduction  Looking for a proactive Junior BI Analyst/Developer to join the team. This role requires excellent client-facing communication skills; the primary purpose is to form part of the BI team to implement the analysis & insights produced by the business. The position is reserved for a forward-thinking candidate with excellent interpersonal skills, loyalty and the will to grow within the establishment.  Core responsibilities  • Troubleshoot performance problems and perform Database maintenance and performance tuning (Indexing, backups, query optimization) • Develop and automate data loads from multiple data sources via SSIS(ETL) • Design and development of reports and dashboards • Provide support to business functions • Evaluate and improve existing BI systems • Assist in troubleshooting reporting and data issues reported by the end users and provide timeous feedback on the progress of support calls until issues are resolved • Daily and Monthly update of reports Educational Requirements & experience needed: Grade 12 or Matric Equivalent A Bsc / Btech Degree in IT/ Computer Science and/or equivalent. Proficiency in SQL Database and the ability to query data and solve complex problems Advanced knowledge and experience with Pivots and PowerPivots Familiarity with BI technologies (Microsoft Power BI, SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), DAX) Knowledge of Microsoft Data tools: SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) Knowledge of most of Microsoft 365’s products, i.e. Teams, SharePoint, Word, Excel, etc Profile • Must be well spoken with good written communication skills • Must be dedicated and proud of their work • Ability to work within a team and / or individually on projects • Ability to teach one’s self and to pick up things quickly • Must be able to communicate effectively with business users on all levels • Attention to detail • Integrity • Consistency • Accurate diagnostic skills • Ability to work under high pressure • Strong attention to detail

Burgiss provides portfolio management software and data and analytics to asset owners investing in private capital. Our solutions streamline the investment process, provide transparency into portfolio holdings, and enable data-driven decisions. As an integral part of the private capital ecosystem, we continue to enhance our solutions by working with investors to meet their ever-changing needs.  Job Description  The Analyst is responsible for aggregation and reporting of underlying portfolio company investments of private capital investment partnerships. Data is compiled by the examination and analysis of direct fund manager reporting and other sources. This information is compiled on behalf of institutional asset owner clients, who use the information for transparency into portfolio composition and analysis of exposure and risk.  Responsibilities Detailed review and analysis of private capital partnership financial statements to compile and maintain specific holdings details Become familiar with a wide variety of methodologies of tracking investments, valuations, and proceeds Perform audit and other quality control functions for the content set Effectively communicate details of reporting and compilation methodologies in response to client-directed questions and requests Meet personal and team deadlines through collaboration with team members  Required Qualifications Detail oriented analytical mindset Results-focused self-starter Positive attitude and desire to learn Familiarity with MS Excel and MS Word Graduated or completing a bachelor’s degree within 3 months of hire All majors considered  Additional Qualifications Major in Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics, Technology, Mathematics are considered a plus Familiarity with financial markets, accounting, and private capital Familiarity with Excel macros, pivot-tables, VBA, MS Access, and database concepts

Junior Analyst -  We have a fantastic opportunity for a Junior Information Analyst to come work with a Private Healthcare Company who specialise in mental health, neurological and learning disability services.  You will join a highly skilled team and work alongside two other Junior and Senior analysts within the MI team. This role is perfect for anyone looking for a stepping stone to progress their career and improve their SQL and Power BI skills even further. This will be a 7-14 FTC in order to cover their current analyst who is on maternity leave.  We're keen to speak with anyone who has practical experience with SQL and SSRS - whether you've been in the industry a couple of years or if you only have 1 year of practical experience.  Their head office is based in Hertfordshire, however this is a fully remote role and no travel is required.  Role and Responsibilities - To help develop and administrate their Power BI Analytic Platform with guidance Overseeing the production of all reporting and monitoring tools Help drive improved decision making through the use of reporting tools  Skill-set Required - Practical experience with SQL and SSRS is essential (ideally over a years experience) Any experience with BI reporting tools would be highly beneficial - preferably Power BI, but also open to Tableau, Google Analytics or similar Experience working with SSMS is desirable Advanced Excel knowledge is highly desirable Experience with DAX would also be beneficial  This role is paying between �28,000 - �30,000 (depending on experience).  This is an urgent hire and therefore interviews are already starting to take place. If this sounds like something you could be interested in - APPLY NOW, or get in touch with us for further details!  Alternatively, if this isn't the right role for you, feel free to apply with a copy of your CV anyway and we can set up a call to discuss what roles you would be interested in.  Please Note: This is a permanent role for UK Residents only and does not offer Sponsorship. You must have the right to work in the UK with no restrictions.  I specialise in Microsoft BI, SQL Server and Azure Analytics recruitment here at Nigel Frank International, specialising in the placement of highly-skilled candidates in various IT positions (Engineers, Analysts, Architects, Consultants, Project Managers, Management etc.).  We're the proud sponsor and supporter of SQLBits, Power Platform World Tour, the London Power BI User Group, Newcastle Power BI User Group and Newcastle Data Platform and Cloud User Group. desc: FDM is currently seeking numerous ambitious and driven candidates with the aptitude for tech to work as FDM consultants. We help people like you make their first step into business every day. Are you ready to make yours?  About This Role As a Junior Data Engineer with FDM, you will undergo industry specific training and continue your career journey as an FDM consultant by working for one of our globally recognized clients. Some common positions you could be working in include Data Engineer, Data Architect, ETL Engineer and more.  As a Junior Data Engineer, you will design, develop and test a large-scale, custom distributed data pipeline using the Java, Python and the latest Big data technologies. You will be a technology advocate and share expertise with other team members. You will be a key partner to the business and the rest of the team throughout the delivery cycle and will work through challenging and interesting problems.  No previous qualifications or STEM Field experience is required.  About the FDM Career Development Program The program begins with training in one of our career streams in business and technology that are in high demand in the job market. We will provide you with the industry-specific technical and professional skills you need in your chosen stream, after which you will start working as an FDM Consultant with our globally recognized clients.  Upon completion of the program, many see their journey with FDM culminating in an accelerated career progression, better placing them to apply for senior roles within the industry.  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree A strong aptitude for technology and the interest and drive to expand your technical skill set Able to commit to work for FDM for a minimum of two years working as an FDM consultant following the training period. Eligible to work in the US.  Benefits A chance to work for some of the most prestigious companies in the world. Opportunity to earn professional certifications related to your career path. Continuous career support and upskilling from FDM. Comprehensive and competitive benefits package. Access to a network of mentors and like-minded individuals. Relocation support (if necessary) Industry recognized paid training.  FDM Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, provincial or local laws.

As a Junior Database Administrator , you will be joining a team supporting cPanel database portfolio. You will work with application developers, SREs and System administration team members to improve the efficiency, resiliency, production stability, automation, and reliability of cPanel’s database infrastructure. The team is responsible for architecture, upgrades, administration, performance and tuning, automation, and feature/function research and development for data model and database infrastructure.  Responsibilities: Installs and maintains the performance of database servers. Performance tuning of database systems. Sets and maintains database standards. Develops processes for optimizing database security. Manages database access. Installs, upgrades, and manages database applications. Diagnose and troubleshoot database errors. Recommends and implements emerging database technologies. Creates and manages database reports, visualizations, and dashboards. Creates automation for repeating database tasks. Strong knowledge of SQL and SQL server tools. PowerShell and Unix shell scripting skills, Advanced knowledge of database security, backup and recovery, and performance monitoring. Provides technical and operational database administration. Installs, maintains, develops and implements policies and procedures.  Qualifications: 3-5 years of experience Extensive experience with database technologies such as MySQL, MariaDB, PostGreSQL , or Other. Strong understanding of relational and dimensional data base performance and data modeling. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to regularly learn and adopt new technology. Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge. Experience with Cluster ing & High Availability Experience with working in Linux and Windows Server environments. Experience with cloud services (AWS, Microsoft Azure) a plus. Experience building centralized data warehouse.  In return for all the above, we offer the following: Competitive Salary Full Health, Vision, and Dental coverage Flexible Spending Account Free on-site lunch Paid Vacation Tuition Reimbursement Casual Working Environment 401K Matching  EEO Statement  At our company, we take great pride in our diverse and talented workforce. We recognize that our continued success as a company depends largely on the collective strengths of our employees.  cPanel provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy, childbirth, physical disability, mental disability, age, military status or status as a Vietnam-era or special disabled veteran, marital status, registered domestic partner or civil union status, gender (including sex stereotyping and gender identity or expression), medical condition (including, but not limited to, cancer related or HIV/AIDS related) or sexual orientation in accordance with applicable federal, state and local law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to hiring, placement, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Privacy is taken seriously at cPanel, Inc. Information submitted is kept internally and not shared with third parties.  Alternatively, you can apply to this job using your profile on one of the following sites:

Junior IT Analyst Baltimore, MD (Hybrid)   As a Junior IT Analyst, you will be a part of the technical services team responsible for upgrading a legacy data management system. As the Junior IT Analyst, you would be responsible for configuring and building full-stack IT systems and resources. You will also work with the guidance of a Senior Technician on designs and implementations.   If you are interested in continuing your development career within an enterprise environment, please apply below!  Responsibilities: Building, configuring & supporting the integration of a full stack of IT systems/resources that include but are not limited to: Active Directory Security information & event monitoring system Endpoint protection Network access control IP address management Linux system management Assisting and coordinating the integration of the above systems with the OSI system Building and deploying workstations and other equipment to various sites/control systems   Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Computer science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field Knowledge or experience working with virtualization tools such as VMWare is a plus Knowledge or experience working with backup & storage technologies (NetApp is a plus) Knowledge or experience working with Linux Effective written and oral communication skills   What’s in for you…? job_title: Junior Data Entry (Systems Analyst) - Early Childhood Education (Head Start)
desc: JUNIOR DATA ENTRY (SYSTEMS ANALYST)  REGION ONE SUPPORT CONTRACT  THIS IS NOT A REMOTE POSITION- THIS POSITION IS IN BOSTON, MA  STG International is seeking qualified Junior Data Entry (Systems Analyst) candidates to work full-time to support the Office of Head Start Region I Regional Office located in Boston, Massachusetts.  The Jr. Data Systems Analyst will be responsible for the following tasks: Support data entry, HSES uploads, and report/form creation for the Region One Grantee ACCESS database. Maintain tracking of monitoring concerns outside of regularly scheduled Aligned Monitoring. Complete monthly enrollment and issues reports for Program Specialists. Maintain shared calendars and coordinate events for the Regional Office. Develop reports, correspondence, and presentations to include spreadsheets, Work documents, and PowerPoints, as assigned. Generate, review and upload Funding Guidance Letters into HSES for Grantees. Complete annual review of PIR, revision to PIR Analysis Report and creation of PIR Reports & Analysis for Program Specialists. Complete T&TA Review Summary Report for Program Specialists based on review and analysis of grantee self-assessment, CLASS and PIR data, as well as, their annual T&TA Plan. Serve as Federal Timekeeper including distribution of weekly timesheets for all staff and verification of ITAS data for the Regional Program Manager. Participate in special projects as assigned by Project Manager and/or Regional Program Manager (i.e. pre-reading of Change of Scope applications, paneling for competitive grant application, participate in follow reviews with Program Specialists, etc.). Serve as a back-up for Funds Planning Grant Actions. Required Skills  Ideal candidate will have the following minimum qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in human services, business, or related field; experience may be substituted for education. Minimum Education: AA/AS in related field with at least two (2) years’ experience at a high level administrative position Advanced level experience with Microsoft Products: Work, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, ACCESS, Explore; ability to use current webinar technology and audio conferencing Strong organizational skills and the ability to track multi-faceted projects over an extended period of time Ability to prioritize and manage workloads and deadlines Ability to maintain a professional demeanor at all times, including maintaining confidentiality Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly, both orally and in writing Ability to work successfully in a team environment Ability to be flexible in response to changing needs and priorities of the office Required Experience  Preferred qualifications include: Working knowledge of the current laws, regulations & policies that govern Head Start/Early Head Start Demonstrated knowledge of and experience with the administration of federal grants Demonstrated knowledge of and experience with Early Childhood programs, with a preference for Head Start/Early Head Start programs Experience with access database and Power BI is a plus STG International, Inc (STGi) is a workforce solutions company providing comprehensive healthcare delivery, Head Start and management consulting services and human capital solutions help our clients. Our services and solutions help our clients sustain and enhance their operations to better accomplish their mission.  STGi offers a competitive benefits package which includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k with company match and a generous PTO policy.  STG International, Inc. is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

Direct message the job poster from Western Union Renuka Pardeshi Global Talent Acquisition at Western Union Junior Associate, Solution Engineering – Pune, India  Want to do work on a massively global scale with a FinTech company that is poised to revolutionize the industry? Want to join our growing team and help shape our company’s digital capabilities and revolutionize an industry? Join Western Union as Junior Associate, Solution Engineering.  Motivated by our values: purpose driven, globally minded, and trustworthy & respectful  We’re a FinTech that’s using insight from customers and colleagues worldwide to improve financial services for families, small businesses, multinational corporations, and non-profit organizations. We’re a team of over 8,000 employees serving 200 countries and territories. We believe when money moves, better things happen.  Better requires process discipline and simplification  You will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipelines. You will work on data extraction, transformation, and loading to the data lake. Also, you will be responsible for integrating data from different sources and building DataMart for business stakeholders. You will use your expertise in Supporting ongoing projects and creating data tools for the data analytics team will be additional responsibilities you need to own.  This is the job for you if you have 1.5 years of experience in ETL or “big data” Data pipeline design, development, and maintenance. You have experience in working with Big Data ecosystem tools such as Spark, NoSQL, etc. Along with skills in writing SQL queries, shell scripts, and small programs in java or python. You have the willingness to learn and work on new Data integrations tools and reporting tools. Knowledge of Cloud computing services such as AWS, cloud data warehouse Snowflake, and Matillion is preferred.  Join us, and let’s connect the world  Western Union is transforming its business and shaping the financial services sector by driving quality, convenience, and customer service to new levels of excellence. It’s an exciting time for our organization, as the largest cross-border money transfer operator, trusted by millions of consumers around the world. If you’re ready to unleash your potential to help drive change through bottom-up innovation, apply now.  We’re a company on the move, and we want our people to grow and develop. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as a great salary and benefits package.  We are passionate about our diversity. Our commitment is to provide an inclusive culture that celebrates the unique backgrounds and perspectives of our global teams while reflecting the communities we serve. We do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, political affiliation, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or veteran status.

Descrição  Descrição da Área  A área de Business Analytics tem o propósito de resolver problemas de negócio complexos por meio de métodos quantitativos. Em outras palavras, a equipe de Business Analytics utiliza técnicas de estatística, algoritmos, e métodos estocásticos para modelar problemas, e utiliza dados internos e externos para criar soluções. Após isso, o produto e o conhecimento gerados possibilitam a conduções de ações para melhoria dos negócios.  Nossa equipe é o braço de consultoria interno em analytics, digitalização e inovação para o negócio, colaborando com parceiros de Infraestrutura de Dados, Engenharia de Dados, Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento, Produção, Controladoria e Vendas. Estamos em busca de um candidato que traga um pensamento estruturado, um viés para a ação, experiência em projetos técnicos, boas habilidades de comunicação e um espírito de colaboração.  O Que Você Fará Auxiliar o Cientista de Dados principal em suas atividades durante o ciclo do produto; Auxiliar no desenvolvimento de modelos quantitativos, alavancando o aprendizado de máquina e técnicas avançadas de análise de dados; Suportar as plataformas técnicas para nossos mecanismos algorítmicos funcionarem em escala; Usar dados para melhorar a maneira como tomamos decisões e, finalmente, aprimorar a experiência do cliente e gerar lealdade; Documentar e comunicar as melhorias desenvolvidas pela equipe. O Que Você Precisará Formação acadêmica em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia, Estatística, Matemática ou outras áreas afins; Conhecimentos básicos em aprendizado de máquina, como regressão linear, árvores de decisão, random forest, deep learning, etc.; Conhecimentos em algoritmos e lógica de programação; Desejável conhecimento em alguma linguagem de programação orientada a objeto, ex.: Python; Viés para resolução de problemas com foco no cliente e nos objetivos de negócios; Desejável vivência em um ambiente de desenvolvimento de software; Idioma: português fluente exigido. Fluência em inglês e/ou espanhol será um diferencial; Mobilidade: vontade e capacidade de viajar nacional e internacionalmente conforme necessário; Disponibilidade para residir em São Paulo ou trabalhar em regime de home office.

Linux scripting a plus Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to work within a team in a fast paced environment BS, MS, or PhD in technical field or pertinent industry experience TransMarket Group is an equal opportunity employer. This is going to be your job  On behalf of the Valuestream Service Assets within Asset Management, we are looking for a Junior SQL Developer within the Data Management change team. The team Data Management is at the heart of the Value Stream Service Assets and responsible for the development of the core master data management solution. Data from our system is used throughout the Asset Management organization. Quality is therefore key during development and the testing phases.  You will have a wide range of activities as a Developer in which you participate in various (large) change projects. During these projects you will get involved within several facets of the domain. Your main focus will be participating in the development and maintenance activities of our 2 Markit EDM instances.  You are motivated to process the requested business changes in the smartest way, but also want to be a sparring partner for the team and product owner in terms of design of technical solutions and longer term vision. You have good problem solving skills, are able to think out of the box and have a proactive attitude.  You are an enthusiastic team player that will mainly develop and test, but will also support the business analysts and support the business in their needs. You like working in a dynamic and changing environment and you are eager to bring in new ideas.  You will be located in Amsterdam or Heerlen.  This is what you offer  The Junior SQL Developer we are looking for is solution oriented and always sees opportunities. You take ownership and responsibility by nature and you have a pragmatic attitude. We would like you to be result oriented without losing sight of quality. You: Have a degree (bachelor or master) in Computer Science, Software Engineering or any other relevant area. Have experience in SQL server, specifically in PL/SQL. Are willing to keep up with new developments in programming languages and have a good understanding of IT infrastructures. Clear interest in financial markets is a plus. Have highly developed communication skills and can easily communicate in English and Dutch (both verbal and in writing).  This is where you'll work  We offer you a salary of € 3.479 - € 4.968 based on a 40 hours working week and attractive terms of employment with a focus on flexibility. A guaranteed year-end bonus of 8.33% Ample attention to your vitality and personal development Hybrid working: at home and in one of our superb offices And of course a well organized pension.  For pension provider APG, pensions are about people, life and how we live together. Through careful asset management, pension administration, communication and advice, APG wants to help build a decent future in which we share our well-being and prosperity honestly and sustainably. For present and future generations. For today, tomorrow and beyond.  APG is committed to serving 4.7 million people in the Netherlands. That explains the importance we attach to reflecting Dutch society. To that end, APG strives for an inclusive work environment in which everyone can be themselves and their unique qualities are embraced.  Choosing APG means choosing a job in which you contribute to a bright future. Don’t delay, apply today!

WE ARE  SoftServe is a place where people have everything they need to pursue their passion.  Our US-based client is one of the world’s largest restaurant companies. Our client is building out a strong development team to help them deliver a brand new omnichannel Node.js microservice-based eCommerce Platform for 50,000+ restaurants all around the world. Client's dynamic eCommerce Platform team is rapidly growing as they optimize their digital ordering channels and technology innovations to create competitive advantages for their restaurants around the globe. While this is a backend position, there is an opportunity for a full-stack contribution.  YOU ARE A holder of a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution or relevant experience Possessing a vast background in all data-related things Proficient in Informatica Cloud Data Integrator (PowerCenter experience in lieu of CDI is allowed), or similar ETL tool Professional in SQL (Snowflake is a big plus) Knowledgeable of AWS data platform development experience Having experience in Python for transforming data or executing PySpark preferred, or similar data framework (i.e. Scala, Java, .NET, etc.) Aware of scalable, serverless functions Accustomed to orchestrating complex task flows across a variety of technologies  YOU WANT TO WORK WITH  An exciting opportunity to Be a high-level individual contributor to our decision sciences team Apply coding expertise, best practices, and guidance in Informatica, Snowflake, and AWS utilities Collaborate with other data engineers and analysts to harden, scale, and parameterize code Contribute to the design of scalable data integration frameworks to move and transform a variety of large data sets Offer support for solutions that are in production, and enhance code for performance efficiency and changes to upstream or downstream systems  TOGETHER WE WILL Help our client build software to make team members more productive and customers — happier Work in a very collaborative environment Care about your individual initiatives — we are open to them, just come and share your ideas Support your technical and personal growth — we have a dedicated career plan for all roles in our company Get certifications in cutting-edge technologies Have access to experienced specialists willing to share their knowledge

Job description:  Full time  Are you ready for new challenges in an international and innovation-driven environment where you can make a difference? Apply and join our team, be curious, learn, grow, and develop your career together with us. We promise: you are in for a special ride!  The location of the role is in: Vienna (Rotterdam is an optional location)   About the job  Your main task as a team is setting up and improving IT-supported algorithms and processes on our SQL-server. Your strong SQL skills (additional Python and BI skills would be an advantage) will enable the strategic pricing team to maintain and develop SQL driven processes; you will support our sales force with relevant information, mainly with our key deliverable: the “Price List”.  In addition, your tasks will include  Working with the content of our used data and information, improving our processes or possibly developing new ones according to our business needs. Ensuring and improving the data quality of our steering relevant KPIs and information (e.g., price fulfillment, price and profitability development). Taking part in the development of new pricing approaches and price market segmentation. Being part of our pool of experts for all data management relevant topics in the “Strategic Pricing” team. About You  You are a strong communicator with a collaborative attitude. With your great enthusiasm and creative mindset, you bring new ideas to the table, not only as an individual but also together with your colleagues. You work well in cross-functional teams and are not afraid to take responsibility and make decisions. With your hands-on mentality, structured approach, and analytical skills, you proactively seek to improve the status quo. You see change as something positive, can adapt quickly and you like to courageously help shaping the future of RHI Magnesita.   What we expect from you in terms of  Education  A bachelor’s degree in business administration, finance, risk management or similar  Languages  English – Proficient/Fluent  German/Portuguese will be considered an asset  Work Experience  1-2 years of relevant professional experience   Why you should work for RHI Magnesita  You will perform in a customer focused environment. We live innovation and appreciate an open and pragmatic way of working. From our leaders we expect to drive our further transformation, to engage our people and to give direction. RHI Magnesita is a company where you can be yourself and where not only your resume and experience, but also your personality counts. We aim for global consistency in compensation policies, but also consider local common practices. RHI Magnesita is committed to support its employees through various means to enable the best possible performance.  We offer  Attractive remuneration packages including global bonus programme Local benefits such as public transport annual pass (Wiener Linien), our own RHI Magnesite Café on site and daily meal allowance for numerous eateries (Europlaza) A variety of health offers (sponsoring of sports events etc.) Possibility of up to 50% home office (depending on the position) incl. allowance. The potential annual gross salary for this position is € 50,000 on a full-time basis. We value your education, skills and experience and will make sure these are reflected accordingly in your final set salary.  Sounds like you?  Please apply online – we are looking forward to your application. Please make sure to submit your application documents in English. Due to data privacy reasons applications via e-mail or through external agencies cannot be taken into consideration. Should you have any questions about this position, please contact us at: talent.europe@rhimagnesita.com.   At RHI Magnesita everyone is welcome and encouraged to apply. We evaluate applications based on required qualifications and regardless of gender identity, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, disability, age, sexual orientation, marital or partnership status. At RHI Magnesita we appreciate the value of diverse teams.  About RHI Magnesita  We are the acknowledged technology leader in the refractory industry. Our company is defined by people. We are committed to diversity and know that multiple approaches, perspectives and backgrounds fuel creativity and innovation. It is our aspiration to build a workplace culture where everyone feels valued, engages, and can enjoy a truly inclusive environment and the diverse voices of our employees are heard. We foster a collaborative culture that cherishes ideas and determination to add value for our customers. Our leadership style encourages open-mindedness, reliability, pragmatism, and innovation.  Find & follow us: www.rhimagnesita.com  LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube

job_title: ¡Únete como Junior en Fraud Prevention and Financial Crime!
desc: El equipo de Fraud Prevention and Financial Crime … ¡quiere conocerte!  ¿Y tú?... Te contamos:  Somos Risk Advisory España,formado por más de 2.000 profesionales queayudana las organizacionesatomar decisiones de manera inteligente para prevenir y tratar riesgos en procesos tecnológicos, financieros y no financieros, de negocio y operaciones.  ¿Qué buscamos? ¡Que te apasione trabajar con modelos predictivos, como scoring o clustering, así como en análisis de datos (Data Mining, Phyton, SQL)! Estudiantes del último curso o graduados de la rama técnica: Ingeniería Informática, Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas, etc. Nivel alto de inglés. ¡Trabajamos con equipos internacionales! Disponibilidad inmediata Tenemos oficina tanto en Madrid como en Barcelona! Durante tu día a día, te encargarás, entre otras cosas, de... Explotarás lo máximo posible el sistema a partir del análisis de datos y de la operativa de negocio de los clientes, para que éste sea más preciso en la detección de conductas sospechosas. Asesorarás al cliente en la definición de los procesos que deben seguir durante la investigación de la actividad sospechosa en su compañía. Llevarás a cabo tareas de construcción de arquitectura de datos, así como el análisis de los mismos, utilizando herramientas de inteligencia de negocio (BI), explorando datos para descubrir patrones (Data Mining) y utilizando modelos predictivos (Predictive Modelling) o aprendizaje automático (Machine Learning). Definirás y desarrollarás aplicaciones que ayuden al cliente a medir y gestionar toda la información que aportan las herramientas de prevención de fraude y demás crímenes financieros. Qué te ofrece Deloitte:  Formar parte de un equipo líder en la revolución tecnológica. Con un alto compromiso con nuestros clientes y la sociedad. Fomentamos la diversidad, integridad y generosidad como algunos de nuestros valores.  Cultivamos carreras y apostamos por la excelencia de nuestros profesionales, ofreciendo: Plan de Carrera y Formación continuo e individualizado. Desarrollo en proyectos punteros e innovadores con empresas líderes. Amplia política de Flexibilidad. Participación en Programas de Acción Social y actividades culturales. Salud y Deporte. Seguro médico, así como, servicio fisioterapeuta y médico en la oficina, Runners Club , etc. ¿Te sumas a crecer personal y profesionalmente con nosotros? Haz clic en “solicitar” y… ¡crezcamos juntos!  ¡Pincha aquí para conocer más sobre nuestro equipo de Fraude  What Impact will you make?

About Dataedo: We create an internationally recognized metadata software We are a product company. We develop and sell our solution. With a profit We have more than 400 customers, mainly in the USA and the UK. We work with big brands such as Disney, the LA Clippers, Fujitsu, Intel, the U.S. Department of the Treasury, and many, many more We are highly rated by our customers on Gartner Peer Insights (4,6) and Capterra (4,8) One customer reviewed our services: „This software has always given me what they promise and more" – this completely reflects our philosophy We’re a team of 30 people from Poland and the USA. We work 100% remotely. The core of the team is technical  About the Junior SQL Developer role at Dataedo:  You’ll join our Development Team to help us in the R&D part of developing our product. Your role will be fulfilled with researching and testing SQL databases, and connectors. We’re looking for someone who likes searching for new solutions and is open to learning new things.  How do we work? Agile way. We release a new version of our product every quarter. The development process is well organized. We start with a kick-off meeting with Development, QA, and Product Team to discuss new features. Jira is the tool that helps us manage our daily tasks. We work with an agile methodology, using kanban. We try to reduce meetings to a minimum, but we still have project reviews and daily standups. We care about the quality of our code and application thanks to code reviews and the support of the QA team.  As a Junior SQL Developer, you will: Develop and maintain our inhouse data warehouse (MySQL) Create reports and analytics with SQL and Power BI Research and maintain new metadata connectors for our product Help us optimize and maintain the performance of our product Have a real impact on the architecture of the developed solutions  Requirements  You’re the perfect candidate if you have: Good knowledge of SQL and database query optimization methods Openness to learning and R&D activities in different data sources Knowledge of GIT Ability to share responsibilities with another programmer At least a passive understanding of English Fluent spoken and written Polish Good self-organization skills  It’s also nice if you have: Some knowledge of C#  The recruitment process at Dataedo:  Working task: we'd like to evaluate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Dataedo might be like.  Online Interview: you'll meet your future manager, Łukasz Preiss. We’ll explore your experience and skills, and you can see if Dataedo is the best place for you!.  Decision/offer: Congrats and welcome to Dataedo! An offer call will be arranged to discuss the contract details. We’ll be back with feedback no matter what the decision is.  Benefits  What we offer: 100% remote work - we have no plans to return to the office Flexible working time - you can arrange your working hours the way you prefer Salary: B2B 6,000 - 9,000 PLN net (26 days off included), CoE 5,000 - 7,500 PLN gross All the necessary work tools, such as laptop, additional monitor, and other accessories Private healthcare – no extra charge Team building events: there are a lot of occasions to meet your team live (company retreat, Christmas Party) and connect online - virtual Kitchen every day, Update Meeting every month, and online integration Opportunity to develop your skills – experienced team, regular 1:1’s with your manager, and a development plan that’s tailored to your needs Possibility to join successfully bootstrapping startup in the most important market – data. It is a unique opportunity to grow your career!

Who We Are  Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.  Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.  We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.  What You Will Be Doing  With the support of a senior consultant, you will have the opportunity to carry out various projects independently and in collaboration with Artefact’s teams of experts: Strategy, Activation, Analytics, Data, Creation.  At the agency or at the client’s premises, the consultant is a true project manager. The diversity of your missions will allow you to be as close as possible to customer issues, to acquire a real knowledge of data and to quickly develop your skills.  Your Missions Will Include  Graduated from Business school or Engineering, the most important qualities in our eyes are intellectual curiosity, autonomy and dynamism.  We are looking for profiles with the double hat “business” and “data”, with at least 1 years of experience, ideally in a digital marketing consulting firm (agency, advertiser, advertising network, media, cross-functional missions), and in the use of BI tools or data analysis.  With a good technical knowledge, you already have a first understanding of digital technologies (Tracking, Machine Learning, RTB, Big Data, Platform as a Service,…).  What We Are Looking For  Graduated from a business school (desired), the most important qualities in our eyes are intellectual curiosity, autonomy and dynamism.  A first knowledge of digital marketing (within a start-up, agency, etc.) or consulting (Strategy, Management, IS), will obviously be valued.  Why you should join us Artefact is the place to be: come and build the future of marketing Progress: every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn Culture: join the best team you could ever imagine Entrepreneurship: you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won’t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry! Come join us!  #FR

desc: Starting salary of 55,000 USD per annum in a zero-tax environment.  Fast progression for strong performers.  Job location: Dubai, UAE  About us:  Cobblestone Energy is a proprietary trading firm that specializes in the wholesale electricity market across Europe. Electricity is fundamental to the world's economic activities. We trade enough electricity every day to power a small country, and in doing so, we help to address the mismatch between electricity generation and consumption.  Job Description  At Cobblestone Energy we are on a mission to build the most advanced European electricity trading and analytics platform, with our technology being used by our teams of commercial traders to create significant value. We are looking for enthusiastic and resourceful developers who are passionate about building exceptionally reliable and performance data processing solutions. You want to help the commercial team make data-informed decisions, have a curious mindset, and are motivated to understand our business better. Developing a strong domain knowledge of our industry over time is key to long term success in this role.  If you have excellent programming skills, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for developing and improving applications utilizing cutting edge technologies, then we would like to meet you.  What we offer in this role Competitive remuneration, with fast progression for strong performers. A challenging but exciting, open, and fun work environment. An opportunity to work with remarkably talented colleagues. Vast growth potential in every aspect. 15% target bonus with further upside. Employee share scheme participation International relocation support Opportunity to be embedded within a commercial team for those with strong commercial interest  Responsibilities Write software applications and programs for backend/frontend purposes. Analyse programs and apps to improve their features and functionalities. Test & debug programs and fix any reported bugs. Collaborate with the tech team to improve the performance, efficiency, and scalability of our tools.  Requirements BS/BE in Computer Science/Computer Engineering. Programming experience of 1 to 2 years in Python language. Expertise in at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask ...). Experience of 1 to 2 years in front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS, JQuery, JS, ...etc. Knowledge of APIs and webservices. Knowledge of Relational Databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server ...) and SQL language. Knowledge of NoSQL databases is a plus. Knowledge of AWS is a plus / Knowledge of data visualization tools, mainly Tableau, is a plus. Ability to work in a team environment. Strong problem-solving skills and analytical skills. Resilience and a determination to succeed. Independent thinkers with growth mindset. Must be passionate, self-motivated, and able to learn quickly. Strong sense of integrity. Personal values that match our company values.

desc: Direct message the job poster from Puerto Rico Medical Defense Insurance Company Marie A. Peña-Monserrate Corporate Executive Assistant OBJECTIVE AND GOALS Compile, summarize, and analyze financial and operational data into reports that are organized, clear, and presented in concise manner and in accordance with reporting deadlines. Assist in the preparation and filing of reports to Office of the Insurance Commissioner. Ensure accurate and appropriate recording and analysis of assets, liabilities revenues and expenses. RESPONSIBILITIES Accurately and timely prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual GAAP and Statutory reports. Verify accuracy of lawyers’ invoices by footing, cross footing or recomputing them. Investigate discrepancies. Classify lawyers’ invoices by categories, then input data into file name claim’s checks. Assist in the development of existing reports and/or design and build new reports in Excel to meet user needs and maintain consistency and accuracy. Timely preparation of financial reporting, including tables and charts. Assist in the preparation of annual budget, other forecast report, and supporting worksheets. Assist with the monthly, quarterly, and year end close activities and ensure they are accurate and timely prepared. Prepare and review month end journal entries. Identify and communicate any issues that affect the accuracy of the accounting records. Document all cancellations in Monthly’s Cancellation Reports Ensure that cash amounts in general ledger reconcile with bank balance by timely preparing bank reconciliation. Provide support during external and regulatory audits through analysis and compilation of information. Assist in special projects and analytical projects as directed.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILILTIES REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s degree in business administration, majoring in accounting and/or finance. Experience in insurance accounting, preferable. Proficient in of Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. Knowledge of Sage 50 (Peachtree). Proficient in data entry. Comfortable with math and calculations. Maintain a high level of accuracy in preparing and entering financial information. Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks. Detail oriented, professional attitude, and reliable. Must have strong work ethics and confidentiality. Knowledge of accounting principles, standards, laws, and regulations Good listening and communication skills. Ability to speak and write in English and Spanish; bilingual. Must be well organized. Interact with other employees in a professional manner. Maintain effective relationship with them. Critical Judgment. Ability to meet deadlines and complete work on schedule. Good Team Player. Availability to work beyond regular work hours. Ability to provide recommendations to improve operations and financial reports.  PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS Position requires sitting for long periods of time. Position requires having close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing large amount of data. The ability to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects up to 30 pounds.  WORKING CONDITIONS Ability to work under pressure. Schedule ability (at least 40 hours weekly). Work will be interacting with a computer at least 90% of the schedule. May be requested to work overtime hours during month-end or year-end close procedures or special projects The preceding job description has been designated to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification and job nature. It is not intended or designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Hide

An established Fin-tech business are looking for a recent graduate or Junior SQL BI Developer to join their team. In this fast-paced role, you will be collaborating with our team of experienced BI Developers in numerous ongoing projects as well as assisting with the general day to day maintenance of the Data Warehouse and providing ad hoc Analysis. Essential Experience/Skills of our Junior BI Developer: Recent degree level graduate or A/Level Higher Education in a numerical/analytical/technical subject or experience in a similar role. Basic Understanding of Excel - SUMIFS, VLOOKUPS, Pivot Tables, Index Matching. Highly Analytical mindset. Attention to detail. Ability to analyse and review data and feedback with findings. Great communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced SME, under pressure and to tight deadlines. Willingness to learn and develop. Advantageous Experience/Skills of our Junior BI Developer: Understanding of T-SQL,DAX,VBA. Previous experience using SQL Server. Previous experience using Power BI Previous Experience in a Junior BI Role. The role is offering a salary of up to £25,000 in addition to strong training opportunities, and a hybrid working patters – with occasional travel to the Stockport office needed (circa once per week).

About Us  Staffigo is in the business of providing IT Consulting Services to clients in various industries in the United States - Healthcare (Payer, Providers & Clearinghouses), Finance & Banking, Retail & e-commerce. We are currently seeking exceptional entry-level talent for the below role.  Job Description Strong skills in data profiling, mapping, data modeling, and data governance. Includes query data repositories to determine Source to target mappings, data quality, completeness, and transformation rules for merging into target repositories Strong skills in Informatica, Informatica Data Quality, Information Analyzer, and IBM data architect, Erwin is a big plus. Strong SQL skills Hands-on experience in creating/updating conceptual, logical, and physical data models to satisfy business requirements. Complex data integration and extraction/transformation/load processes (ETL) should be understandable and explainable. Should be able to collaborate with the business to establish the scope of data-centric or support projects. Should be capable of reviewing the Project Initiation Document and the Reference/Domain Value Mapping. Should be able to identify Pain points impacting data capabilities by working with Business and Architects Should be able to develop a program/project-specific Data Analysis strategy. Should be proficient in source-target data mapping, S/T record building/join conditions, transformation writing, and data lineage building. Should be able to conduct Peer Reviews. ETL/Test questions, output file validation, and defect analysis should all be supported. Should ensure data analysts (and other data leads, as necessary) are following standard work and best practices.  Requirements Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any related field of study. No travel; no telecommuting. Job duties are project-based and performed on long-term assignments at various unanticipated sites within the U.S. which may require relocation at the end of each project. Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, v-lookups, charts) Experience using the relational database system, Oracle preferred Excellent oral and written communication skills. Understanding of software development life cycle. Must know how to use Power BI or Tableau.  We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. Direct message the job poster from SpotHero Maria Luna Tech Talent Partner @ SpotHero! Who we are: At SpotHero, we work as a team to empower people to get everywhere, easier! We’re rapidly growing with the mission of bringing the parking industry into the future through technology. Drivers across the nation use the SpotHero mobile app and website to reserve convenient, affordable parking in advance, on-the-go or through their connected cars, and parking companies rely on us to help them reach new customers while optimizing their business. We connect the dots with cutting-edge technology, delivering value to both sides of this exciting, evolving marketplace. We’ve been quite busy, take a peek at some of our recent announcements.  SpotHero is seeking a Junior Analyst to help the organization make data driven decisions! This position is responsible for synthesizing data and building visualizations that tell stakeholders the story behind the data.  What will you do: Develop reports and tools using our Business Intelligence tool (Looker) to help operationalize data and make insights visible Participate in data management process reviews, development and updates, and / or creation of associated documentation as defined in the project plan and scope Assist in the preparation of analyses for external partners and/or internal stakeholders Partner with various business unit stakeholders to identify what data is needed to complete requests, determine if we have the necessary data, and work with members of the analytics team to operationalize it Transform complex analytical results into simple & succinct stories and feel comfortable presenting them Leverage historical data to inform the future by building reporting and analytical tools to quantify impact of initiatives and efforts of stakeholders Lead the daily trending analyses of our KPIs  Who you are: Analytical - Examines information methodically and in detail to solve problems or complete tasks. Collaboration - Process of working with multiple individuals to complete a task or achieve a goal. Communication - Communicates effectively and efficiently both verbally and in writing. Confidentiality - Keeps private information secure and ensures account access levels are appropriately set. Detail Oriented - Pays attention to details and learns to understand causes and not just effects. Efficient - Ability to work and identify processes with the least amount of waste (time, materials or other resources) possible. Execution - Seeing projects through to completion and meeting deadlines. Financial Acumen - Having a solid understanding of what drives the company’s profits and expenses and how key financial metrics are used. Independent - Not relying on another’s authority. Initiative - Ability to assess and initiate things independently. Intellectual Drive - Always eager to learn something new and share with their team or colleagues. Operations/Process-Minded - Focuses on the tasks that are completed day-to-day to ensure strategic goals are able to be achieved in the most efficient and scalable way possible. User-Focused - Ability to take complex analysis and develop business insights from the perspective of how it will be understood and used by a user.  What you bring: 1-2 years of experience in an analytical role Experience working in a BI reporting tool (Looker preferred) Proficient in SQL with a desire to continue to enhance technical skill set and grow within the organization  Systems/Tools: BI reporting tool (Looker preferred), GSuite, Airflow,  Seeking candidates in: Chicago, IL, US Toronto, ON, CAN  What we are offering: Career game changer – A truly unique experience to work for a fast-growing startup in a role with unlimited potential for growth. Excellent benefits – In the US we cover up to 95% of Medical Premiums, 50% of Dental and Vision Premiums, company sponsored Life Insurance, 401K + company match, learning budget, and generous parental leave. In Canada we offer Medical (prescription drug and paramedical coverage), Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, STD and LTD. Flexible unlimited PTO policy and great work/life balance – We value and support each individual team member. Annual parking stipend – we help people park! The opportunity to collaborate with fun, innovative, and passionate people in a casual, yet highly productive atmosphere. Our award-winning culture has received recognition from Built In’s 2021 Moxie Awards, as a 2021 Best Places to Work in Chicago, Top Company Culture by Entrepreneur, 2022 Best Places to Work in Chicago by BuiltIn, and recipients of the Best Company Culture, Best Company for Women, and Best Company for Diversity awards from Comparably!  At SpotHero, we Respect Fellow Drivers by providing an inclusive interview experience for everyone, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process. Please let our team know of your need when you apply or as you begin interviewing with our team.  SpotHero is an equal opportunity employer. We know that a diverse workforce is the strongest workforce, and are committed to building and supporting an inclusive environment for all.  PLEASE NOTE: This position is ineligible for visa sponsorship. To be considered for this role, you must be legally authorized to work in the US or Canada and not require sponsorship for employment now or in the future.

We Are Looking For  A new team member for one of our Munich based portfolio companies which provides a meeting place for shoppers and product experts. They aim to bridge the gap between the offline and online retail world by bringing the kind of curated, face-to-face advice from the offline world to the E-Commerce sphere.  What will keep you challenged?  Working on launching an end-to-end data product. This includes data collection, data transformation, data operation and processing, and data visualisation.  Developing consistent tracking and data acquisition  Integrating multiple data sources across our tech stack (product, marketing, etc.)  Defining and standardizing new data collection processes for use in future operations and insight generation  Deriving insights through comprehensive analyses & reports for various teams (product, customer success, marketing) and enabling them to act upon  Which traits contribute to your success?  Good understanding of how data moves through our systems, including how it is transformed, stored, visualized and enriched. Plus points for being able to code and query databases.  Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills with an affinity for gathering and analysing data  Experience in data gathering with SQL, Google Analytics and Firebase Analytics  Experience in data analysis and visualisation using tools like Tableau, PowerBi, Qlik or similar  Knowledge of tools like BigQuery, Amplitude, Segment, Mixpanel, Heap, Mode Analytics is a plus  An entrepreneurial mindset with a keen interest in start-ups and technology displayed through deep knowledge and, if applicable, previous work experience in a start-up or tech company  Effectively work in an independent, structured and goal-oriented manner  Fluency in English (German is not required)  Please note that we are looking for support in the Berlin or Munich office of our portfolio company. Eligibility to work within the EU is required as well.  What To Expect Working With Our Portfolio Company  Make a true impact in the Marketplace & E-Commerce industry by joining a highly innovative and disruptive technology company  Well equipped and modern office in the heart of Berlin and Munich.  Transparent culture with flat hierarchies where every person is highly valued  Enjoy the opportunity to pursue steep career development during the company's exciting launch phase  Thrive from an inspiring, creative, and diverse environment with amazing and smart colleagues from all over the world  Having fun together as a company with regular team events  Getting challenged and developing your professional skills by taking over responsibilities, and a guaranteed steep learning curve from day one  Possibility for home office and flexible working hours to balance your work and private life  Being part of an instant network within the Project A family with access to regular events, knowledge sharing, and meetups  Do you want to be part of our portfolio company's success story?  We are looking forward to your online application.

desc: Direct message the job poster from Head Resourcing Kevin Feely IT Recruitment in Scotland, 23 years in (still learning), I recruit permanent roles across all levels in IT, Business Change, and Digital space - if… Graduate / Junior Developer – SQL – Permanent - Edinburgh Head Resourcing is working with a respected investment management organisation in Edinburgh that is looking to recruit a Graduate Developer or a Developer with commercial experience that is looking for their first move. In this role you will be responsible for providing technical development skills in the creation of a range of business solutions, covering all areas across the software development lifecycle from analysis, design, construction, testing, installation, through to modification and support. You will also work alongside external vendors / partners that will deliver solutions – ensuring that solutions meet the data and analysis business needs of the customers across the business. Responsibilities: - Design, build and test solutions that meet the needs of the business users - Take responsibility for support calls or small requests that have been assigned, maintaining systems to perform in a reliable, scalable and robust manner - Carry out investigation, analysis and documentation of business problems in terms of functions and processes, and the information and systems they use - Maintain good levels of communication with other members of the team, the wider business and 3rd party suppliers - Ensure business users and senior staff are kept up-to-date with progress and manage expectations - Participate in small projects, delivering tasks to agreed deadlines under the direction of a Project Manager, Business Systems Analyst or Senior Analyst/Programmer. - Organise, prioritise and schedule own workload and ensure any issues are escalated appropriately. - Contribute to good levels of motivation and morale within the team, ensuring the team works harmoniously with the rest of the team and the business at large. - Keep abreast of technologies and new developments in the industry Essential: - Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent (or comparable work experience) - Microsoft SQL Server - Experience in manipulating complex data sets - Experience working with a programming language such as C#, Python, Java, or JavaScript - Understanding of development or project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Prince etc.) Desirable: - Any knowledge of the investment management industry Benefits: - Excellent salary and benefits package - Opportunity to learn new technical skills in a supportive and collaborative environment - Central Edinburgh based with good transport links and option to have a hybrid WFH / Office location
