Learn More About EY  At EY, our purpose is Building a better working world.  The insights and quality services we provide help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all our stakeholders. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.  In a world that’s changing faster than ever, our purpose acts as our ‘North Star’ guiding our more than 300,000 people — providing the context and meaning for the work we do every day.  We help digital pioneers fight data piracy; guide governments through cash flow crises; unlock new medical treatments with data analytics; and pursue high quality audits to build trust in financial markets and business.  In other words, working with entrepreneurs, companies, and entire countries to solve their most pressing challenges.  Primary Purpose Of This Role  In Consulting, we are building a better working world by transforming businesses through the power of people, technology, and innovation. Transformation harnesses the core drivers of change to create long-term value and places humans at the centre, leverages technology at speed and enables innovation at scale.  EY Namibia is seen as one of the leaders in technology consulting. As one of our technology consultants, you will be working with clients to improve the competitive advantage of their operations through assisting them with new technologies in the form of comprehensive data analytics and process automation.  What You Will Be Doing Learn to understanding about the different businesses in the Namibian and international landscape. Analyse client data to make comprehensive analysis and predictions. Conduct in depth diagnoses of the client’s processes and the automation thereof to recommend and implement improved changes. Solving logical problems, to help clients improve accuracy and efficiencies. Assist the external and internal auditors to extract, transform and load client data onto EY Data Analytics tools. Consistently maintain an up-to-date knowledge of new technology improvements in the field of Data and Automation. Work closely with clients to build and maintain long term relationships.  What We Require BCom Honours Degree is required. A degree in Engineering or Data Analytics, or equivalent, will be an added advantage. Experience with Microsoft Power Bi or SQL will be an advantage. Process understanding and automation, skilled in RPA software will be an advantage. A basic understanding of accounting principles. Strong logical and problem-solving skills. An affinity for Information Technology Systems. High degree of emotional intelligence. Business analysis, awareness, and commercial focus.  What We Offer Above market remuneration, including benefits. Additional paid leave days. Study opportunities including a generous amount of study leave. A registered Training Office for CA’s and ACCA’s to complete articles. EY Mobility Programs, allowing employees to work around the world. An opportunity to obtain your MBA in Technology and Environmental Studies for free.  EY Namibia is an equal opportunity employer, therefore persons from previously disadvantaged groups and with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Junior Analyst (earlier Senior Data Associate):  As a Junior Analyst, you will assist onshore team with document retention, regulatory reporting and quality control; assist with special projects/initiatives, as needed. With some seasoning, you also will be expected to conduct thorough analysis of Collateralized Loan Obligations (CLO) transactions.  Responsibilities Assist the onshore team with document retention, regulatory reporting and quality control Own ancillary tasks including administrative and streamlining of the ratings workflow Have a mindset to bring about process efficiencies and ideate automations Take ownership of the tasks with focus on quality and accuracy of the deliverables Demonstrate strong learning curve  Requirements Bachelor’s degree, CFA candidates preferred A high level of proficiency and comfort with working on Microsoft Excel Strong English-language skills, particularly writing 0-2 years of relevant financial data experience Strong organizational and time management skills  Morningstar is an equal opportunity employer  About Us  DBRS Morningstar is a global credit ratings business, currently with 700 employees in eight offices globally. Formed through the July 2019 acquisition of DBRS by Morningstar, Inc., the ratings business is the fourth-largest provider of credit ratings in the world.  DBRS Morningstar is committed to empowering investor success, serving the market through leading-edge technology and raising the bar for the industry. DBRS Morningstar is a market leader in Canada, the U.S. and Europe in multiple asset classes.  DBRS Morningstar rates more than 2,600 issuers and 54,000 securities worldwide and is driven to bringing more clarity, diversity of opinion, and responsiveness to the ratings process. DBRS Morningstar’s approach and size provide the agility to respond to customers’ needs, while being large enough to provide the necessary expertise and resources.

job_title: Consultor(a) Júnior Data & Analytics (com foco em Audit Data Services)

desc: Starting salary of 55,000 USD per annum in a zero-tax environment.  Fast progression for strong performers.  Job location: Dubai, UAE  About us:  Cobblestone Energy is a proprietary trading firm that specializes in the wholesale electricity market across Europe. Electricity is fundamental to the world's economic activities. We trade enough electricity every day to power a small country, and in doing so, we help to address the mismatch between electricity generation and consumption.  Job Description  At Cobblestone Energy we are on a mission to build the most advanced European electricity trading and analytics platform, with our technology being used by our teams of commercial traders to create significant value. We are looking for enthusiastic and resourceful developers who are passionate about building exceptionally reliable and performance data processing solutions. You want to help the commercial team make data-informed decisions, have a curious mindset, and are motivated to understand our business better. Developing a strong domain knowledge of our industry over time is key to long term success in this role.  If you have excellent programming skills, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for developing and improving applications utilizing cutting edge technologies, then we would like to meet you.  What we offer in this role Competitive remuneration, with fast progression for strong performers. A challenging but exciting, open, and fun work environment. An opportunity to work with remarkably talented colleagues. Vast growth potential in every aspect. 15% target bonus with further upside. Employee share scheme participation International relocation support Opportunity to be embedded within a commercial team for those with strong commercial interest  Responsibilities Write software applications and programs for backend/frontend purposes. Analyse programs and apps to improve their features and functionalities. Test & debug programs and fix any reported bugs. Collaborate with the tech team to improve the performance, efficiency, and scalability of our tools.  Requirements BS/BE in Computer Science/Computer Engineering. Programming experience of 1 to 2 years in Python language. Expertise in at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask ...). Experience of 1 to 2 years in front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS, JQuery, JS, ...etc. Knowledge of APIs and webservices. Knowledge of Relational Databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server ...) and SQL language. Knowledge of NoSQL databases is a plus. Knowledge of AWS is a plus / Knowledge of data visualization tools, mainly Tableau, is a plus. Ability to work in a team environment. Strong problem-solving skills and analytical skills. Resilience and a determination to succeed. Independent thinkers with growth mindset. Must be passionate, self-motivated, and able to learn quickly. Strong sense of integrity. Personal values that match our company values.

Direct message the job poster from o9 Solutions, Inc. Nicole Reich TA Team o9 Solutions | MSc Environment and Society Studies Be part of something revolutionary...  We have a vision—leverage the power of data and artificial intelligence to help companies make better, faster decisions. Not just to improve P&L but the health of the planet, too. We believe that our AI-powered o9 Digital Brain is the most valuable platform for enterprises to help drive supply chain agility, revenue growth, and optimal financial performance and that better decisions for companies equal a better outcome for the planet.  But we also have a vision for our people. We want to work with the most talented, committed, and driven individuals to drive our transformative approach to delivering client value—our number-one mission at o9. In return, we’ll provide you with a nurturing, entrepreneurial environment where you'll be consistently supported, encouraged, and challenged to reach your highest professional potential.  About the role...  The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.   Responsibilities  Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production Generate actionable insights for business improvements  Qualifications  Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.) At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL) Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)  What we’ll do for you…  Competitive salary Tech tools: Complementary Mac or PC laptop. Enjoy yourself: Unlimited paid time off. Get social: When we work from home, we play from home with fun after-work activities like Friday Socials. If you’re in the office, feel free to join these events in person. Flat organisation: With a very strong entrepreneurial culture (and no corporate politics). Support network: Work with a team you can learn from and every day. Diversity: We pride ourselves on our international working environment.  Employee Testimonial…  What I like most about o9 is that I get to work with some of the smartest people in the industry. Every day is a new opportunity to learn and grow. At the same time everyone is friendly, helpful and fun to be around.  How the process works…  Apply by clicking the button below. You’ll be contacted by our recruiter, Iris who’ll fill you in on all things o9, give you some background about the role and get to know you. They’ll contact you either via video call or phone call - whatever you prefer. During the interview phase, you will meet with Sr. Data scientist for 60 minutes. The recruiter will contact you after the interview to let you know if we’d like to progress your application. You will next meet our Data Scientist Lead for 60 min. Time to meet our Hiring manager finally. Our recruiter will let you know if you’re the successful candidate. Good luck!  More about us…  With the latest increase in our valuation from $1B to $2.7B, o9 Solutions is one of the fastest-growing technology companies in the world today. Our mission is to digitally transform planning and decision-making for the enterprise and the planet. Our culture is high-energy and drives us to aim 10x in everything we do.  Our platform, the o9 Digital Brain, is the premier AI-powered, cloud-native platform driving the digital transformations of major global enterprises including Google, Nike, Walmart, ABInBev, Starbucks, and many others.  Our headquarters are located in Dallas, and we have offices in Amsterdam, Barcelona, Madrid, London, Paris, Tokyo, Seoul, and Munich.  o9 is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants of diverse backgrounds and hires without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, age, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Coupa Software (NASDAQ: COUP), a leader in business spend management (BSM), has been certified as a “Great Place to Work” by the Great Place to Work organization. We deliver “Value as a Service” by helping our customers maximize their spend under management, achieve significant cost savings and drive profitability. Coupa provides a unified, cloud-based spend management platform that connects hundreds of organizations representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC with millions of suppliers globally. The Coupa platform provides greater visibility into and control over how companies spend money. Customers – small, medium and large – have used the Coupa platform to bring billions of dollars in cumulative spend under management. Learn more at www.coupa.com. Read more on the Coupa Blog or follow @Coupa on Twitter.  Do you want to work for Coupa Software, the world's leading provider of cloud-based spend management solutions? We’re a company that had a successful IPO in October 2016 (NASDAQ: COUP) to fuel our innovation and growth. At Coupa, we’re building a great company that is laser focused on three core values:  1. Ensure Customer Success – Obsessive and unwavering commitment to making customers successful. 2. Focus On Results – Relentless focus on delivering results through innovation and a bias for action. 3. Strive For Excellence – Commitment to a collaborative environment infused with professionalism, integrity, passion, and accountability. Responsibilities: Apply existing knowledge and internal best practices to classify, build out and maintain master data and metadata in the Company’s CRM system. Ensure you swiftly respond to tickets or required changes. Use multiple data sources, in hierarchical order, to ensure the highest level of data accuracy. Support multiple departments with various data related projects. Ensuring adherence to data governance best practices and the Company’s policies. Required Qualifications: Good communication skills, with the ability to work with employees based in the US and globally Working experience of minimum 1-2 years as a Data Admin/Data Steward Standard user of Microsoft Excel Experience working in Salesforce or other CRM applications Preferred Qualifications: Previous experience in a Sales Operations, Business Data Management or Data Quality domain Experience working in Salesforce or other CRM applications Soft Skills: Methodical – orderly or systematic in thought and behavior Investigative – ability to quickly and accurately research unknown accounts, using context clues and information available online to identify accurate account details Analytical – ability to analyze significant amounts of information with attention to detail and a high level of accuracy Perpetual – capability to work on a repetitive task for a long period of time without compromising quality of work At Coupa, we have a strong and innovative team dedicated to improving the spend management processes of today’s dynamic businesses. It’s our people who make it happen, and we strive to attract and retain the best in every discipline.  We take care of our employees every way we can, with competitive compensation packages, as well as restricted stock units, an Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), comprehensive health benefits for employees and their families, retirement and savings plans with employer match, a flexible work environment, no limit vacations for exempt employees, non-exempt employees are on an accrual basis for PTO, catered lunches…And much more!  As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Coupa is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.  Please be advised, inquiries or resumes from recruiters will not be accepted.

Excellent communication and presentation skills. Demonstrable self-leader, comfortable with performing within a dynamic environment. Confident, articulate, self motivated, determined, energetic Experience in data management is a distinct advantage. For an immediate interview, please click the apply button below.

En EY, tendrás la oportunidad de construir una carrera tan única como tú. Con el apoyo de un entorno global y una cultura inclusiva y tecnológica, conseguirás ser la mejor versión de ti mismo. Queremos contar contigo como una voz única, como alguien que aporta, y con la perspectiva de ayudar a EY a ser mejor. Únete a nosotros y construye una experiencia única y un mundo mejor para todos.  La oportunidad:  Desde EY Consulting nos hemos adaptado a la naturaleza de los sectores, a las nuevas necesidades que tienen nuestros clientes y los acompañamos en su transformación digital. Somos innovadores, ágiles, colaborativos y alineamos objetivos de estrategia de negocio con las nuevas tecnologías.  Uno de nuestros pilares es transformar el negocio a través de nuevas tecnologías e innovación atrayendo y cautivando el talento excepcional.  EY Consulting nos dividimos en dos grandes áreas: Business Consulting y Technology Consulting. Desde Business Consulting realizamos proyectos de estrategia de negocio, optimización de procesos y gestión del cambio. En Technology Consulting desarrollamos soluciones vinculadas a las áreas de Big Data & Analytics, Cyberseguridad, SAP, Automatización de procesos de negocio (RPA, NLP…), entorno Cloud, etc.  Actualmente buscamos un Consultor Junior Business Intelligence & Analyics con experiencia en el área de BI para la gestión técnica de proyectos vinculados a implantación de herramientas de almacenamiento de datos y visualización de información en entorno internacional.  Funciones: Ejecución de proyectos a partir de requerimientos funcionales y soporte a la planificación técnica realizada por sus responsables directos. Análisis de necesidades desde un punto de vista tanto técnico como de modelado de información y visualización de esta. Ejecución de pruebas técnicas y soporte a las pruebas funcionales del desarrollo que realices. Mantendrás contacto con los equipos funcionales para asegurar que ganas conocimiento del negocio del cliente y así poder adaptar implementaciones en las distintas áreas de negocio a procesos, necesidades y casuística particular.  Requisitos: Formación: Grado/Licenciatura en Ingeniería informática, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física o ramas afines. Valoraremos positivamente Masters de especialización en Big Data y/o analítica avanzada y sistemas de reporting avanzado. Experiencia de, al menos, 2 años desarrollando las funciones descritas en entornos de alta complejidad y proyectos con impacto a nivel internacional. Necesario aportar nivel avanzado de SQL y modelado de datos. Nivel de inglés requerido: avanzado. Mentalidad ágil y orientada al crecimiento: Buscamos personas innovadoras, que sean capaces de trabajar de una manera ágil y con capacidad de adaptación en un mundo en constante cambio. Curiosidad y orientación a objetivos: Buscamos personas que sean capaces de ver oportunidades en vez de retos, que se hacen las mejores preguntas para buscar las mejores respuestas y, de esta manera, construyen un mundo mejor. Inclusividad: Buscamos personas capaces de adaptarse a distintas perspectivas, que las busquen y las valoren a la hora de trabajar en equipo, para generar seguridad y confianza. Capacidad de trabajo en equipo, proactividad e iniciativa, orientación al cliente.  Competencias positivamente valoradas: Conocimientos de programación en R o Python así como conocimientos de entornos cloud ( Google Cloud, AWS, Azure). Se valorará positivamente experiencia en herramientas de Machine Learning, IoT o Big Data. Se valorará positivamente conocimientos de SAP BW/4HANA, SAP HANA, SAP SAC. Aportar disponibilidad para viajar.  Qué Buscamos:  Aumentar el valor de nuestro equipo de Technology Consulting para, de esta manera dar un mejor servicio a nuestros clientes y ayudar a la transformación digital en un entorno cambiante y dinámico.  Qué ofrecemos: Aprendizaje continuo: Desarrollarás la mentalidad y las habilidades para enfrentarte a nuevos retos. Tú defines el éxito: te proporcionaremos herramientas y flexibilidad para que puedas llegar a las metas propuestas. Liderazgo transformacional: Te daremos la confianza y formación para que puedas crecer y llegar a ser un buen líder. Cultura inclusiva y diversidad: Cada persona es única y tiene algo que aportar, te daremos voz para ello; toda idea es importante.  ¿Crees que esta puede ser tu nueva oportunidad? Si quieres unirte a nosotros, no dudes en hacernos llegar tu candidatura.  La experiencia en EY es excepcional; constrúyela  EY | Building a better working world EY existe para construir un mundo de trabajo mejor, ayudamos a nuestros clientes, personas y sociedad a crear un valor a largo plazo para generar valor en el mercado. Gracias a los datos y la tecnología, tenemos equipos en más de 150 países generando confianza y ayudando a los clientes a crecer, transformarse y operar. Trabajando en Auditoria, Consultoría, Tax, Estrategia y Transacciones, los equipos de EY se hacen las mejores preguntas para encontrar nuevas respuestas a complejos problemas en los que se encuentra nuestro mundo a día de hoy.

company: Centrum pro výzkum energetického vužití litosféry

location: Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires Province, Argentina
desc: Les traemos una oportunidad desafiante para unirse a una compañía de servicios de tecnología - con una portfolio global destacable - como Java Jr en nuestro equipo de desarrollo de Proyectos de Nuevas Tecnologías (PNT) para diversas importantes empresas de distintos rubros.  CONNECTIS (miembro del Grupo Getronics) es una compañía que ofrece soluciones en tecnologías de la información en América Latina y Europa. En Argentina, tiene una sólida posición donde destaca la fortaleza de su equipo humano y su importante cartera de clientes estratégicos, que la convierten en empresa líder en Consultoría IT.  Propósito Del Equipo  Somos PNT, el equipo de desarrollo de Getronics Argentina. Llevamos adelante proyectos de software para grandes clientes. Nuestra meta es ser socios estratégicos de nuestros clientes, descubriendo productos, diseñando y construyendo soluciones que mejoren la calidad de su negocio.  Dependiendo de las necesidades alojamos las soluciones en la nube, siendo responsables del ciclo completo de vida del producto (desde la conversación con el cliente para descubrir sus necesidades, hasta la puesta en producción y mantenimiento final).  Estamos en pleno crecimiento, buscando incorporar nuevos miembros a nuestro equipo de desarrollo para poder encarar nuevos proyectos de distintos clientes.  Somos un equipo muy unido, con muchos años trabajando juntos; formamos un ambiente super colaborativo y abierto donde todos tenemos espacio para preguntar, equivocarnos y aprender.  Nuestros valores nos los tomamos en serio. Buscamos la superación desafiando las cosas que hacemos, aprendiendo técnicas y tecnologías que nos abran nuevas oportunidades. Somos proactivos. Nos encanta debatir e intercambiar ideas, pero somos resolutivos cuando es necesario avanzar. Estamos comprometidos con nuestras relaciones y acciones, lo que nos permite actuar y realizar cambios. Queremos compartir todo lo que aprendemos, tanto entre nosotros como en la comunidad de desarrollo (¡qué sería del desarrollo sin StackOverflow ni el software libre!). Y a diario, todos los días, en cada instante, le ponemos buena onda a todo lo que hacemos.  Como equipo adherimos al Manifiesto Ágil, y actuamos en consecuencia. Usamos Scrum como marco general de trabajo, aplicando prácticas de Extreme Programming (como Pair Programming, TDD, historias de usuario y más). Formamos desarrolladores full-stack, que puedan no sólo resolver un producto en todos sus aspectos técnicos, sino también poder crecer los aspectos blandos para relevar y descubrir oportunidades con el cliente.  Aplicamos técnicas de coaching, conformación de equipos y feedback continuo para que cada persona pueda alcanzar su máximo potencial, pueda superar desafíos y afrontar nuevas metas, cada vez más desafiantes.  Entre nosotros realizamos mini-charlas técnicas durante la semana, sobre distintas herramientas técnicas que vamos aprendiendo y aplicando en distintos proyectos. Ah, y cada tanto sale una hackathon general con tema libre!  ¿Y de tecnologías? Montones. Usamos las últimas versiones de Spring Framework (y sus derivados, como MVC, Batch, Data, Integration, etc), JPA y Hibernate, Apache Camel, JUnit, Apache Cordova, HTML/CSS/JS, Vue.js (y necesitamos incursionar en Angular), y pila de frameworks más.  Responsabilidades Interactuar con los clientes y usuarios para realizar el relevamiento de los requerimientos, realizando propuestas que mejoren el negocio del cliente. Diseñar soluciones técnicas que se adapten a las tecnologías y ambientes del cliente, y que permitan un buen mantenimiento del producto. Codificar e implementar los requerimientos, usando las mejores prácticas de programación de mercado. Testear con herramientas automatizadas y asegurar la calidad de los entregables. Desplegar la solución en los distintos ambientes donde sea necesario instalar la solución de software. Aprender y compartir al equipo nuevas tecnologías y técnicas de desarrollo y gestión de software. Experiencia En  Buscamos a nuevos integrantes que se estén iniciando en el desarrollo de software (especialmente usando Java), que tengan ganas de sumarse a un equipo inquieto, en constante cambio y crecimiento.  Necesitamos que tengas capacidad de expresión clara, muchas ganas de compartir lo que sabés y aprender del resto. Ah, y que el aprendizaje continuo sea parte de tu filosofía de vida.  Por las características del puesto, es necesario que tengas conocimientos básicos de Java, y tengas en claro los conceptos del paradigma de programación orientado a objetos. Valoramos por supuesto los frameworks y otros lenguajes que hayas usado.  En la presentación, nos resulta útil que sepas HTML, CSS y JavaScript (los 3 sospechosos de siempre).  Allá abajo en los datos, nos resulta útil que conozcas SQL y uso básico de bases de datos relacionales (nos encanta MariaDB/MySQL, pero también usamos PostgreSQL, Oracle y SQL Server),.  En Resumen Conocimientos de la orientación a objetos Conocimientos iniciales de Java (clases, interfaces, herencia, etc) Conocimientos iniciales de HTML/CSS Conocimientos iniciales de SQL Además, Nos Resulta Muy Valioso JUnit React / Vue / Angular Bootstrap Educación  Necesitamos que tengas muchas ganas de aprender, por distintos medios y canales (formación formal en institutos o facultades, cursos presenciales, cursos online, tutoriales, libros, etc). La formación continua es parte de nuestro espíritu.  Taller De Ingreso  Organizamos un mini-taller de ingreso donde, en equipo, resolvemos un ejercicio. Durante el taller aprendemos sobre buenas prácticas de programación, Spring Framework y otras tecnologías.  Beneficios  OSDE para vos y tu grupo familiar.  Día de cumpleaños libre.  Acceso a plataforma de E-Learning (Udemy)  Un espacio informal y cómodo  Espacio para la auto-capacitación con objetivos personales y “techies” internas Disponibilidad para viajar: No  Disponibilidad para cambio de residencia: No

As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.  Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

About Accenture:  Accenture is a leading global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries,we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services - all powered by the world's largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 674,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com  About Entity:  Corporate Functions—including Human Resources, Finance, Legal, Marketing Communications, and Workplace Solutions-- powers Accenture’s people across industries and functions to keep our business leading in the New. Join the heart and soul of Accenture, partnering with our extraordinary people to bring innovation into every organization. Job description: JOB SUMMARY  The candidate to work closely with all internal Ecosystem stakeholders on the Data Science projects. We use data science as a mean to increase knowledge at a fast pace, blending classic statistics with machine learning. The Junior Data Engineer will support the Data Science team to transform data into a format that can be easily analyzed. They should have expertise in developing, maintaining, and testing infrastructures for data generation & architecting solutions for data scientists that enable them to do design & build data science driven business solutions  Key Responsibilities  Support the Senior Data Engineer to  Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture  Assemble large, complex data sets  Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using relevant technologies like SQL, AWS ‘big data’  Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing the data science driven business solutions  Basic Qualifications  Graduation/post-graduation in computers/Engineering from a reputed institute.  Essential Qualifications  Have experience with databases administration, ETL  Have experience in SQL, Python, and data prep  Experience in supporting global clients or internal stakeholders in data science projects.  Experience of working across multiple geographic borders and time zones.  Professional Qualifications  Good spoken and written communication skills: able to deal confidently, tactfully, and appropriately with people of different disciplines and at all levels of the organization.  Comfortable working within a large and complex environment with multiple stakeholders and interest groups.  Collaborate effectively with the rest of the team to achieve common objectives. OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU:  You’ll benefit from our network of global communities and collaborative culture that will help you build technical and functional skills and capabilities. And because we serve more than 40 industries globally, you’ll have the opportunity to develop valuable industry-specific expertise. o The scale of our capabilities and client engagements—and the unique way we innovate, operate and deliver value—will give you the opportunity to deepen your existing skills even as you help create the latest technology trends. o You’ll have access to leading-edge technology. CALL TO ACTION: If you have a desire to help the world’s leading companies and governments, now’s the time to join the world’s largest and most diversified group of technology, business process and consulting professionals. Be part of a dynamic team of collaborative experts, and help us improve the way the world works and lives.

job_title: Consultor(a) Microsoft en Data & Artificial Intelligence Junior o sin experiencia para Minsait (An Indra Company)
desc: ¿Quieres trabajar en Minsait (Indra) con consultor de soluciones de Data & AI de Microsoft?  Minsait es la compañía de Indra líder en transformación digital y Tecnologías de la Información. Una empresa con presencia global (+148 países) con alta especialización y capacidad para integrar el mundo core con el mundo digital. Una compañía líder en innovación y en transformación digital.  Minsait es el lugar donde lo esencial es el núcleo, y nuestro núcleo son las personas. Personas que impulsan el futuro, que abren nuevos caminos y que cambian las reglas del juego. Porque en Minsait, quien deja huella hoy y mañana, eres tú.  Resumen de la posición  Buscamos tu talento para desarrollar el rol de Consultor(a) en Data & AI (Artificial Intelligence) para tecnologías Microsoft. Personas dinámicas, proactivas y con ganas de superar todos los retos, tanto recién graduados como profesionales con poca experiencia.  Siendo, tras un proceso de formación y certificación en tecnologías Microsoft, el/la responsable, por ejemplo, de: diseñar e implementar la gestión, el monitoreo, la seguridad y la privacidad de los datos. De utilizar los servicios cognitivos, el aprendizaje automático y la minería de conocimiento para diseñar e implementar soluciones de inteligencia artificial de Microsoft.  Actuando siempre como enlace entre los usuarios, el equipo de implementación para promover la utilización de soluciones dentro de los clientes.  Requisitos  La oportunidad de desarrollarte en el sector tecnológico es hoy. Por favor aplica si: Eres recién graduado en carreras tecnológicas y/o ingenierías, ciencias o afines. Tienes un nivel de inglés intermedio (B2) Se Valorará Conocimientos y Experiencia Previa En Formación/especialización en tecnologías de Data & AI (Data analytics, científico de datos, etc) Experiencia en proyectos usando tecnologías de Data & AI (Microsoft, AWS, Google, IBM, etc). Disponer de alguna certificación oficial en tecnologías Microsoft. Disponer de alguna certificación oficial en tecnologías proveedores Cloud (AWS, Google, IBM, etc) Beneficios Posibilidad de trabajo remoto. Plan de desarrollo y carrera. Plan de formación continua el cual incluye formación y certificación obligatoria en tecnologías Microsoft. Incorporación a proyectos estables y en clientes de referencia. ¿Quiénes somos?  Modern Talent Hub es una plataforma de empleo y certificación patrocinada por Microsoft, concebida para que los profesionales de TI de todos los niveles de experiencia puedan acceder a trabajos con partners de Microsoft en América Latina.  Consideraciones sobre esta oferta  Modern Talent Hub integrará tu hoja de vida al programa, permitiendo que tu perfil pueda ser evaluado y considerado por nuestro equipo de Recursos Humanos para este u otros proyectos. Por eso es indispensable que tengas tu perfil completo y actualizado.

About Us  Synergistic IT is a full-service staffing and placement firm servicing client in America for the past 12+ years. We are dedicated towards fulfilling the IT needs of our clients. From staffing to full implementation of projects we provide the highest quality IT Services. We Intend to deliver exceptional student outcome. We don't just help you secure a tech job but build a solid career in technology.  Job Description  Roles and Responsibilities Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion. Helping develop reports and analysis. Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalisation. Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing. Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements. Desired Candidate Profile Degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, IT or any equivalent degree. Basic knowledge of MySQL & Python Should be able to do data visualisation using Tableau or Excel. Excellent English communication (both oral and written) and reading comprehension skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail. Ability to prioritise and work under tight deadlines. Fast learner, able to master new concepts, theories, ideas, and processes with ease. Willingness to work beyond traditional working hours/days as required by the business. The person should be open to learning and take new responsibilities. Education Requirement: -  Bachelors, Masters in Computer Science/ Computer Engineering/ Information Systems/Information Technology/ Electrical Engineering/ Mechanical Engineering.  Benefits On Job Technical support E- verified Filing of H1b and Green card Full time position Candidate who are missing the required skills, might be provided an option to enhance their skills, so that they can also apply for the role and can make a career in IT industry.  If you do respond via e-mail, please include a daytime phone number so that we can reach you. In considering candidates, time is of the essence, so please respond ASAP. Thank you

Cette startup compte bien révolutionner la MedTech et elle cherche son Data Engineer !  ENTREPRISE  Créée en 2016 cette startup s'est lancé sur le marché rapidement et a tout de suite convaincue. Proposant un SaaS permettant de gagner en efficacité, elle s'adresse à des clients B to B sur le secteur de la MedTech (la tech dans la médecine). Son impact positif sur la société ne fait pas de doute et l'entreprise continue de se développer. Aujourd'hui, après 3 levées de fonds plusieurs dizaines de millions d'euros et un statut de leader du marché assumé, ils sont prêts à conquérir l'ensemble du marché de la santé prédictive !  L'équipe, composée de 150 passionnés, cherche aujourd'hui un (ou une) Data Engineer motivé et dynamique pour les rejoindre !  POSTE  L'équipe technique et produit est composée de 100 personnes organisées en features teams de 6 à 10 personnes. Tu rejoindras l'équipe Data qui s'occupe de toute la partie pipeline de données et dashboards mais également data science pour toutes les applications. Tu pourras donc, si tu le souhaites, apprendre et te familiariser avec les pratiques de mise en place de pipeline et les outils de gestion d'infrastructure. Tu auras notamment pour missions : L'optimisation du code en place et la montée en version Le développement de nouveaux dashboards La mise en place de pipeline de données  Voici un aperçu de l'environnement technique : TypeScript, Node.js, Angular 13, Redux, ReactiveX, Python, PostgreSQL, AWS, Azure, Docker, Terraform, Kubernetes, ELK, méthode agile...  PACKAGE  Salaire compétitif Mutuelle 50% Titre de transport 50% Assurance prévoyance Tickets restaurants 9 jours de RTT Plusieurs jours de remote  LES +  Gros enjeux de scalabilité et vraie prise de responsabilité Locaux géniaux et tout neufs Top ambiance et événements réguliers avec l'équipe   PROFIL  Tu as une première expérience en CDI sur un langage back-end ou en tant que Data Engineer Tu as déjà travaillé sur des projets complexes Tu es très bon en algorithmie Ton diplôme ? Peu importe, on veut des passionnés
Industries: Software Development and Wellness and Fitness Services

desc: £40K  Remote working  Your new company;  Founded in 1928, they have a very strong foundation and nearly a century of expertise behind them  World leader in their field; they were the first in the world to offer this unique, technology driven solution which most railways in North America and the UK have since adopted  Showing no signs of slowing, this vacancy has become available due to their sustained and continued growth, driven by their experienced tech team, revolutionising ultrasonic rail inspection  Your new role;  Working very closely alongside the Senior Data Scientists and AI/ML Engineers as well as the wider Big Data team - learning from them and developing your own skills will be a daily benefit to this role  ML systems - from building to designing to testing  Development of business-critical solutions utilising data, statistical analysis & quant modelling  Validation systems - developing these to demonstrate performance  You;  Experience of labelling data, finding & storing learning data, characterising ML systems and interpreting & presenting confusion/error matrices  Python, Pandas, NumPy, sickit-learn, Matplotlib  Desirable;  Full ML process deployment  TensorFlow, Keras  ML algorithms  ML techniques  Git Repositories  SQL / NoSQL  Benefits;  Remote working  25 days holiday + bank holidays  Private medical  Life assurance (3x salary)  Healthcare cash plan  Want to know more?  Hit apply and we'll send over a full job spec!  In Technology Group Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

Avaus Marketing Innovations is the leading data and marketing technology agency across the Nordics, turning your data into business results, at speed. Having a 15 years background in data-driven marketing and sales across B2B & B2C industries, our future growth will be heavily driven by applying smart data and analytics for our clients. Currently we operate from four locations, Helsinki, Stockholm, Munich and Gdansk by 120 experts. Our vision is to become the leading actionable marketing data-asset provider in Europe by 2025. To achieve our vision we need many more talented Avausian joining our forces.  What does success look like?  You have been an active contributor to successful client deliveries across B2B and B2C accounts You have been an active contributor to the Avaus Factory methodology and the asset library we have You are recognized as an industry expert in increasing automation levels and data utilization in the sales and marketing domain The team will evolve to have a unique position in terms of talent attraction and competence development  What do we offer  A platform for accelerating your career - being part of the entrepreneurial team and learning how to grow a business in the front row, but within a well established business A learning path where you get to leverage the Avaus best practices developed in our Swedish Data & Analytics team and build a success story in Finland Career advancement opportunities based on your interests and ambition - let us know what you would like to achieve in your career and we will build the path together!  Our key recruitment principle is to hire people based on their strengths, not lack of weaknesses.   The Data & Analytics business unit focuses on three key focus areas:  Advising clients in data strategy related questions Building world-class actionable marketing data-assets providing competitive advantage Helping clients to create insight and action in everyday business.  Currently you have in Helsinki approximately a dozen colleagues across expertise in the areas of customer & online behavioral data, data engineering and data science. In Stockholm you have additionally twice as much Avausian in the Data & Analytics field to collaborate with.  Qualifications for the role:  We believe you have an analytic and problem-solving mindset along with good communication. You are business and result-driven, thrive in teams where you get an opportunity to contribute and collaborate. You also have the ability to discuss technical questions with a non-technical audience and a strong interest in digital marketing. Besides your personality, we would also like you to have;  Bachelor’s degree (or higher) within a relevant field (e.g computer science, mathematics, physics) alternatively 1-2 years of relevant work experience Programming experience (Python, Java or similar) Experience with relational databases (SQL) Knowledge of data modelling concepts Fluent in Finnish and English  Apply as soon as possible since positions are filled on the go as we find well matching talent with criterias defined within this role description.  For additional questions or requests, please contact Mikael Montonen -Team Lead for Data & Analytics: mikael.montonen@avaus.com or +358405537092.
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Advertising Services, and Business Consulting and Services

desc: Qualifications Degree in a technical subject, e.g. computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus Programming experience in either Python or R Outstanding records of academic and professional achievement Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills Strong record of leadership in an academic, professional, or extracurricular setting Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment Ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively - both verbally and in writing - in English; local language is advantageous Willingness to travel What You'll Do  You’ll work in teams of typically 3 - 5 consultants (incl. data scientists and data engineers), playing an active role in all aspects of client engagement, which includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations.  In this role, you’ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.  Junior analytics associates receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on their teams. This support includes a partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career as well as more formal training in your first few years. Additionally, you’ll receive guidance and support from your local office and practice in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.  The role of junior analytics associate with McKinsey Digital differs from our regular junior associate position in that you will be taking a hybrid role of both a management consultant and a data scientist. This will signify working on projects focused on analytics and leveraging programming to conduct more advanced analyses.  Who You'll Work With  You’ll work with McKinsey Digital in Stockholm. This group brings together the best of McKinsey’s digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses.  As part of this group, you’ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and strategy to agile, cloud, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. You’ll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm.  You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-technology topics.  Our office culture is casual and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Business Consulting and Services

desc: Divize Strategy&Consulting společnosti Accenture pomáhá řešit problémy klientů tím, že vyvíjí na míru vyrobená analytická řešení. V oblasti AI se stanete odborníky na vizualizaci dat a interpretaci výsledků analytických modelů.  Popis pozice  Jako analytik ve společnosti Accenture budete vytvářet stěžejní postupy, které napomáhají dodávat služby a analytická řešení firmám a inovují tím jejich portfolia.  Co můžete očekávat  Aplikace matematických a analytických postupů na opravdová businessová řešení  Vývoj analytických řešení využívající prediktivní modely, optimalizaci a data mining pro mezinárodní klienty v různých odvětvích  Vaším cílem bude vyřešit klientův problém a zefektivnit fungování jeho služeb pomocí nových technologií a/nebo dodavatelů služeb  Požadujeme  Vysokoškolské vzdělání - bakalářského nebo magisterského stupně, ideálně technického směru  Plynulou znalost českého/slovenského jazyka a velmi dobrou znalost AJ  Analytické myšlení a schopnost strategického plánování  Zkušenost se zpracováním dat a jejich analýzou  Znalost následujících toolů výhodou: Python, Matlab, Mathematica, R, MS SQL/Oracle, SQL, Hadoop Nabízíme  Pracovní příležitost v mezinárodní, dynamické firmě  Nadstandardní tréninkový program  Velmi dobré platové ohodnocení  Zajímavé a různorodé projekty pro významné klienty v ČR i v zahraničí  Atraktivní balíček zaměstnaneckých benefitů (stravenky, 5 týdnů dovolené,FlexiPassy, příspěvek na penzijní/životní připojištění,atd..) BA degree (preferably from system organization field) Computer skills: Microsoft Office, ERP system, SQL Min. 3 years relevant experience; previous data analysis and project management experience is a surplus Superb attention to detail, strong analytical and reasoning skills Ability to work well under pressure and to tight deadlines Effective time management and organisational skills  Skills and Qualifications  • Learns to use professional concepts. Y42 is a fast-growing company, founded in 2020 and backed by some of the world's most renowned investors. They all deeply believe in our vision of frictionless business intelligence.  We pride ourselves on having assembled a team of 100+ diverse, talented and dedicated experts from all over the world. We are ambitious and we hold ourselves to a high standard. Y42 offers a very exciting and fast paced environment. We like a challenge and learn by doing. Our ambitious mission: Making it easy for everyone to use their data productively.  If you are looking for a place where you can have an impact, work with talented people and make a true difference, you will be really happy here.  As our Junior Finance Analyst, you will: Take over daily, weekly, and monthly operational topics; Prepare finance KPIs for periodic reviews; Prepare periodic AR/AP reporting; Own, report, and improve the data quality of financial KPIs; Carry out ad-hoc finance analysis and reporting topics; Assist in monthly investor reporting prep; Assist in board meeting prep. You’ll be great for this position if you have: Proficiency in MS-Excel and Google sheets; Confidence to carry out data manipulation and analysis; Business understanding; Analytical skills; The ability to think logically and pay attention to details; An educational background in finance/business. Why you should join Y42: The opportunity to significantly shape a future unicorn startup early on; A competitive salary along with employee stock options to participate in the company’s success; A well-located, modern office with air-conditioning and countless food options; State-of-the-art work equipment, incl. MacBook Pro, Bose headphones and monitor; Public transport pass or Swapfiets e-bike subscription; Weekly team lunches and regular team events; Free fruits, snacks and beverages; Flexibility to work from home or our office. 🌈 Y42 is proud to be an equal opportunity employer prohibiting discrimination and harassment of any kind. We want to work with the best people no matter how they look, dress or speak, or whom they love, believe in, or aspire. We are committed to building a team that represents various backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, as we believe diverse teams with complementary skill sets make the strongest teams.  The typical hiring process at Y42 CV application: Share your CV with us and any supporting documents if you like. We will get back to you as quickly as possible. Get to know each other: In our first call, we want to exchange expectations and clear up your most urging questions. Furthermore, we want to excite you about our mission and product. Main Interview: In this interview, our hiring managers want to learn more about your skills and thought processes. We want to understand your abilities and align on a technical level. Culture Interview: In the last hiring stage, we want you to meet at least one member of the management team. We deeply value team chemistry and want to give you the opportunity to get to know each other before any signings. Et voilà: Offer! We aim to finish the entire process within 28 days. 🌈 Y42 is proud to be an equal opportunity employer prohibiting discrimination and harassment of any kind. Questrade Financial Group (QFG) of Companies is committed to helping Canadians become much more financially successful and secure. We are everything a traditional financial institution is not. Our vision is to revolutionize financial services for the benefit of Canadians by providing the most innovative and cost efficient financial services online.  That’s why we empower our employees to continuously grow their professional careers with QFG. We believe in having a diverse, inclusive place to work and our flexible working arrangements brings that to life so you can unleash your creativity. Our values are a part of our DNA, and we care deeply about our people helping us fulfill our mission and become an important part of our community. We are always looking for like-minded professionals to join our team. Come grow with us.  Think you're the best in database technology? We want you!  Questrade Technologies Group (QTG) acts as the back-bone for Questrade. They act as strategic partners with each business unit to help Questrade leverage technology to gain competitive advantage. The team is comprised of very skilled, very committed individuals working collaboratively. They collectively create a unique work environment that is fast-paced and challenging, but also very open and supportive. So are they the serious, geeky-types? No way! Fun, freedom, flexibility is how QTG members describe the work culture here.  And where does the Cloud Database Administrator fit into this?  The Cloud Database Administrator will leverage their proficiency with database technologies and servers to the implementation of core cloud database infrastructure components, create tools for automation of repetitive tasks and proactive monitoring, collaborating with multiple project and the architecture teams.  What’s it like working as a Cloud Database Administrator at Questrade?  The Database Administration team provides support for all database engines within Questrade and will enjoy the challenge of operating complex and mission critical systems under extreme loads. The Cloud DBA will be able to work with a diverse set of database engines within the cloud infrastructure as well as the chance to work in a hybrid environment that includes supporting on premise database engines. The DBA team works closely with multiple teams such as Engineering, Production Support, Network and Sysadmins. The role also requires team members to work weekends and evening when on call.  So are YOU our next Cloud Database Administrator? You are if you have… You have deep understanding of Relational databases, NoSQL databases, Cloud databases You have 3+ years of experience with database administration You have a deep understanding of Cloud computing concepts and solutions including public, private, and hybrid cloud. You have demonstrated experience supporting at least one of the predominant public clouds (AWS, Azure, or GCP) You have experience with Linux operating system with proven experience of supporting database systems running on Linux You have strong, proven, demonstrable experience with advanced scripting and automation development using shell scripts (Bash), Python You have hands-on experience with container technologies, like Docker runtime Excellent organizational, communication, analytical and interpersonal skills and ability to write clear technical documentation You have experience with GIT/GitLab You have excellent problem investigating, analyzing and solving skills You are able to focus while under pressure and pay close attention to detail BSc in Engineering, Computer Science or related discipline and experience is desired  Brownie points if you have… You have experience with Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) You have experience working with Infrastructure-as-Code tools such as Terraform, Kubectl, Helm You have experience or interest in the financial industry You have experience with Data Dog You have working experience with MySQL, MongoDB  I-DM1  Sounds like you? Click below to apply! # LI-Hybrid # LI-TY1  At Questrade Financial Group of Companies, with multiple office locations around the world, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive and accessible work environment. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings, and believe that when our teams feel supported and motivated, their creativity becomes a source of innovation. We are also committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and also one which reflects the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in to help us revolutionize financial services for the benefit of all of our customers. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment/selection process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.  Apply Now

location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
desc: About Us  HyperionDev is the largest provider of software development education in Southern Africa, and one of the largest globally. Counted among the top education technology startups in EMEA with headquarters in Cape Town and London, we support learners from over 40 countries in changing into fulfilling tech careers. We are dedicated to closing the global tech skills gap and we achieve this by integrating tech education with human mentorship and expert code review, lowering the cost of accessing tech careers.  In 2017 we won first prize in Facebook's Innovation Challenge, with Facebook selecting us as the most socially impactful startup operating in Africa and financially backing us, alongside Google. In 2020-21, we closed one of the largest Series A fundraises in South Africa with nearly 1500 investors backing us in the biggest crowdfunding round in history for an Africa-linked startup.  We were originally launched from the University of Cambridge, and our leadership team consists of world-leading talent from companies such as Google, 2U, and Zando. We are looking for team members who are ambitious, motivated and have a track record of over-achieving and exceeding targets.  Join us at a time when we are reinventing tech education and how technology can drive higher quality education at scale for markets that have some of the most underperforming tertiary institutions and schools globally.  ABOUT THE ROLE:  As a Code Reviewer at HyperionDev / CoGrammar, you should ideally be experienced in carrying out technical, high-quality code reviews and would possess strong programming skills in one or more of the following: SQL Java Python JavaScript Machine Learning Data Visualisation and Analysis Mongo Express React Laravel PHP  In this role you would be a member of our code reviewer network. This is a network of technical experts who can review code in a variety of contexts, both education and business. Reviews can range from a quick 10-min feedback session on a basic piece of code, to a 1-hour technical interview with tech job applicants.  To fit this role, you must be driven by a hunger for excellence. You must possess an uncompromising and critical attitude when it comes to code quality, and have a passion for people development. You should be technically capable and confident to advise on code reviews, offering a supportive and educational experience to the individual/s you are assessing. You should strive to improve the code's quality, structure, readability, and efficiency in a systematic manner.  Are you excited by the enormous impact this work can and will have in assessing and improving the quality of code around the world? Then this role is for you!  RESPONSIBILITIES:  As a Code Reviewer, you not only fill one of the most key roles in our organisation, you define what we do.  In this role, you will be responsible for completing, and will own the quality of, the technical code reviews we provide to our international partners (some of the biggest brands in technology, recruitment, and education headquartered in the US, UK and Europe).  A growth mindset is essential because at any point in time, you could be invited to work on an advanced-level curriculum or a new technology stack in order to meet the requirements of our partners. Therefore, continuous training, further learning and specialisation will be an integral part of this role.  Requirements  Minimum A degree, diploma or certificate in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems, or another relevant field. (Skills acquired through informal learning are welcome too) 1+ years of programming or teaching experience in one or more of the stacks/technologies mentioned in the section 'About the Role'. 1+ years of peer or professional mentorship experience, in any capacity. A keen interest in working with code from the perspective of assessing and improving code quality. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Meticulous attention to detail. Fast learner and enthusiastic to train in new stacks/technologies. A problem-solving and positive attitude. Start-up mentality and the desire to see the team succeed. An interest in the future of code education and online learning. Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.  Preferred 2+ years of professional programming or teaching experience. Active involvement in local and international tech communities.  Benefits  Flexible & remote working: We are a remote-friendly organisation and offer flexible work options.  Join the heart of tech in Africa, the US, and Europe: You'll work with the best of the best in edtech and developer education. Join one of the most ambitious and highest performing tech companies in the space, with a founding team that draws their former experience from companies such as Google, Amazon, GetSmarter/2U, and Yoco.  Life-changing work: Solve real problems that make education and tech careers accessible to those who need it most: you're allowed to brag about it.  OUR VALUES  We're a people-first company with a purpose that underlines everything we do. We're obsessed with the potential in people and challenge them to do their best work. We embrace a culture of growth and learning to deliver on our vision and ours is a relentless quest for improvement.

Responsibility Work with data application team to develop and maintain data application back-end services Develop data processing pipelines for data modelling, analysis, and reporting Requirements Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related technical and engineering fields 1 years of working experience in data application development,backend service development,data processing and related fields Experience with at least one programming language, such as Golang, Python, Familiar with relevant development frameworks, such as gin, flask Experience with SQL Good sense in data analysis and data management, self-motivation to keep learning new data technologies Charles, Lau Ngie Hao License No.: 02C3423 Personnel Registration No.: R1656741  Please note that your response to this advertisement and communications with us pursuant to this advertisement will constitute informed consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of personal data by ManpowerGroup Singapore for the purpose of carrying out its business, in compliance with the relevant provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012. To learn more about ManpowerGroup's Global Privacy Policy, please visit https://www.experis.com.sg/privacy-policy

Job Description  A better internet is possible, one that empowers people to choose how their personal information is used. This might seem daunting, or even impossible, but at Proton, building this better internet is what we do every day.  ProtonMail was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, ProtonMail, is now the world’s largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as ProtonVPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, use end-to-end encryption that gives our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.  Today, Proton is making privacy universally accessible to more than 50 million registered users, including journalists, some of the world’s largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 30 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.  New York Times journalists, some of the world’s largest corporations, and millions of ordinary citizens use our products so they can choose who, if anyone, sees their information. Join us at one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world’s most impactful tech companies, we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.  Purpose of the role  Over the past few years, Proton has established itself as a global leader in online security. Unlike most companies in the tech space, at Proton we value customer privacy above all, limiting the data collection to anonymised operational data. This makes the Data Team’s job a very challenging one! The Proton Data Team is in charge of all things data in the company: from product analytics to financial metrics, including topics such as product or infrastructure performance. We leverage our on-premise custom data platform to provide support for data-driven decision making throughout the company. Come join us and help make a better internet!We are looking forData Scientiststo help us grow our data platformin Geneva. You will collaborate with multiple teams throughout the company to use data, with a focus on server-side analytics, to provide analyses and visualizations that will inform data-driven decisions and contribute to drive product development and marketing strategies. You will also make significant contributions to our internal analysis frameworks and help build new analytics applications to fulfil the needs of the company.  What You Will Do Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets Use data to produce dashboards and reports for a wide array of stakeholders Contribute to the internal analysis frameworks and take ownership of some of these tools Create new applications to provide more advanced analytics Contribute to ongoing data cataloging efforts Job requirements Experience working with and analyzing large, complex datasets Advanced knowledge of Python, experience designing or contributing to large libraries and codebases Masters of Science or higher degree in a quantitative discipline: statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc. Good knowledge of SQL Strong analytical skills Basic understanding of business intelligence, marketing KPIs, and web analytics Knowledge of Scala is considered a plus Why you should join Proton Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world’s top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH. Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - ProtonMail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more. Grow with us - We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields. Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else’s problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do. Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities. Proton uses the Recruitee recruitment platform for a more effective hiring process and a better candidate experience. Your data will always be kept confidential and is not shared with any third parties. Keep in mind that you will receive emails from the email address careers@protonmail.recruitee.com or other addresses on the domain.  Due to recent scams, please be careful with any suspicious emails pretending to be Proton team and forward them to abuse@protonmail.com. Proton will never ask for payments from candidates.  Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.By applying to a role at Proton, you acknowledge that we will process and store your personal data for at least the duration of the hiring process and as necessary to enter a contractual relationship with you.

desc: Direct message the job poster from Viavera Recruitment Sarah Bogaert HR & Business Consultant at Viavera Recruitment Our client is a global company in the oil & energy sector, represented in >50 countries, who is looking to strenghten its Market Data Competence Center based in Brussels.  Do you want to play a role in the interesting world of energy commodity markets? Are you interested in learning about the parameters that affect trading on these markets in an international context, ranging from geopolitical tensions to very specific situations hampering transport of energy?  Do you want to collect and process dynamic data on these circumstances and report them to your colleagues who are actually trading the energy products? Are you eager to work in an international company that cherishes the diversity of people? Then look no further! You will be part of the team running the Market Data Competence Center You will be in contact with your internal colleagues requesting data relevant for their professional activities You will be in contact with the 35 professional data providers to explain and select the requested data and their format You will collect, analyse and summarise the data and report them to your colleagues A lot of the data will be numerical, you will process and summarise these with the help of Excel  Do you have what it takes? You have a Master degree, preferably in Economics including Statistic courses (or in mathematics) A first experience in an analytical position is a big plus You have a very good knowledge of English, both orally and in writing You have an analytical mindset, you are detail-oriented and precise You work in a structured manner You like to work autonomously You are communicative and like to have contact both internally with your colleagues and externally with partners You have a good knowledge of MS Office including Excel You have an interest in energy commodities & trading  Offer: A temp to perm contract Being part of an international company in the heart of Brussels Good accessibility by public transport (in the city center) combined with homeworking Being part of a young and dynamic team in a multi-cultural atmosphere Extensive education Very interesting salary package including meal vouchers and compensation of public transport Once you have a permanent contract you have an extended insurance plan

About The Role  We are looking for a talented and self-motivated Junior Data Reporting Specialist to join our team. In general, the scope of responsibility is to prepare daily/weekly/monthly KPI reports, ad hoc reports and presentations internally and to the Client. The reports need to follow the previously agreed design and criteria to provide key insights and visibility to the goals of the organization. This position is closely working together with the Service Delivery Manager and the Client to deliver reports and analyse possible performance improvements.  Key Tasks And Responsibilities Responsible for the production, definition and delivery of KPI performance and operation reports (daily/weekly/monthly) both internally and externally to the Client. Ensuring that reports are completed accurately and are organized based on raw data exports from Client systems. Proactively fixing issues and faults found within the reports. Checking completed reports and approving them for distribution or escalating if there are any issues. Distributing all reports to relevant recipients on time. Visualising the data in PowerPoint presentations. Preparing VOC (Voice of Consumer) reports and presentations based on data exports. Liaising externally with Client regarding all changes/updates to reports. Liaising with the Service Delivery Managers regarding all changes/updates to reports. Producing ad hoc reports required by Service Delivery Manager and the Client. Updating and maintaining the necessary documents. Being able to provide KPI or process improvement suggestions based on gathered data. Possibility to work in a hybrid mode.  Requirements Any experience in a data analysis or reporting specialist role – preferred. Great communication skills. Intermediate level of knowledge/expertise in Excel or above (especially calculation and analysis related skills, pivot tables, formulas and functions, formatting, charts, knows other data analysis tools) with ability to expand knowledge in this field. Usable knowledge of other with MS Office tools (PowerPoint). Experience with BI systems would be a plus. Exceptional analytical skills and attention to detail, problem solving. Good personal organizational skills. Ability to work well in a team environment. Flexible, adaptable, managing multiple deadlines and multiple tasks. Demonstrates proactiveness, ability to learn quickly and apply new ideas.  Languages Required Native speaker for language required (Polish) English Language level should be B2 or higher (according to CEFR  Benefits  Transcosmos is proud to offer such a fantastic and unique working environment, built on a successful family culture of ambition, experience and teamwork. We are proud to promote longevity and progression at every level with the following benefits: Direct employment contract for an indefinite period Private medical care Multisport card Training opportunities Diverse and friendly work atmosphere Modern office environment Local and global career progression opportunities

job_title: Junior Accountant - G/L - Remote based role in US
desc: Req ID: 186462  NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.  We are currently seeking a Junior Accountant - G/L - Remote based role in US to join our team in columbia, South Carolina (US-SC), United States (US).  NTT Data Services are seeking a Junior Accountant (general ledger and reconciliation) for our North American Corporate headquarters. The Accountant works in the Controller group looking at consolidation and reporting and ensure all data is accurate for monthly and quarterly reporting. This person will be looking at data related to compensation incentives, etc. Also, will look at data related to companies we have acquired and integrate their data into SAP which will include some data mapping.  Responsibilities Might Include Work with consolidations both current and as we acquire new organizations Manage the data around incentive programs like annual bonuses, commissions, retentions, etc. Prepare monthly journal entries requiring calculations of a moderate to high level of difficulty. Prepare monthly balance sheet account reconciliations with a moderate to high level of complexity. Review general ledger detail and expense run-rates to identify and record required adjustments and reclassifications. Experience working with reconciliations. Apply knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and Company policies to solve moderate to complex problems. Experience working in a fast paced, global, rapidly growing team Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree (B.A. /B.S.) or equivalent in Accounting/Finance or related discipline. 2 years of accounting experience with General Ledgers. Experience in Accounting Software. Excellent Strong written and verbal communications skills required. Basic Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Accounting/Finance or related discipline 2+ years of Accounting experience 2+ years of General Ledger Accounting and reconciliations Preferred Qualifications Degree in Accounting About NTT DATA Services  NTT DATA Services is a global business and IT services provider specializing in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services. We are part of the NTT family of companies, a partner to 85 % of the Fortune 100.  NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regarding to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
